n_FcCLddNuC2flgq48MJcA.text: The Sekushi 7 & Hanna roll was amazing. Nikko was our  sushi chef and made a phenomenal Aria special roll for us. I came into this restaurant not a huge sushi fan and left wanting 3 more of those Aria rolls. Definitely stop in for a bite to eat If you're in Paris

BB9AZm1cEFaUubEv_Sa88Q.text: This sushi place is a nicely tucked hole in-the-wall inside the Paris hotel. The sushi I ordered was very tasty and my wife highly enjoyed her sushi bento box. Even the hostess, Jada was awesome at securing us a very coveted seating.

AZKYFHxiPhn1ZwhLAA1gww.text: Great service and very friendly.  I got the teriyaki chicken and asparagus.  They have a lot of other great options and the food looks delicious.

YCnJR5gFTYduUGAyQ2ATdw.text: two stars is "Meh, I've experienced better, and that was my experience.  three stars would have been "a-ok" and that was not really it.  i had great service and the food came out faster than any sushi I've ever had.  unfortunately it was simply not good food.  it was not poisonous, it just wasn't very good.  i really like sushi, but if i go back i'll have the soup or teriyaki or other Japanese items, but not the sushi.

While I ordered a Pork Katsu Bento box, portion of the rice is small not enough for sharing with my son that I have to ask for another cup of rice and the dressing for the salad was ginger flavor not bad though. ZH0cNS_DzKYsOgg7Pgxn8Q.text: UPDATE!!   Returning after 4 months, and I am very pleased to inform all my fellow Yelpers that my original review stays True on all subjects.   The Wagyu Beef (any item) is out of this world! Both the seared and the skewers! Cooked to perfection; basically melts in your mouth   Sashimi is sliced spectacularly. Everything about the sashimi- temperature, thickness, texture, and flavor- made me want to just keep ordering more! Despite the fact that an order is only one piece, but it's well worth it for the quality that you get for it.   Just to note again, the vibe here is a great place to bring your friends and chill/enjoy quality food and 2 for 1 SAKE DEAL AND A SHOT BAR!   ORIGINAL REVIEW:   Very unique and colorful plating; overall very pleasant experience.   Ambience: Good vibes, tranquil music in the background, minimal unnecessary noise from staff/kitchen. (5/5)  Food: lightly portioned; however due to the reasonable pricing, it allows you to eat more/try different items WITHOUT getting bloated. Quality of the food is excellent, but if you want buffet size portions, you might want to reconsider. If you want to actually taste the food and enjoy what you are consuming, this spot is ideal for just that. (5/5)   Price: Affordable; considering that it is located on The Strip and it is Japanese Cuisine, it is considered quite reasonable. (5/5)   Service: Spectacular! All servers are very pleasant and are constantly walking around to see if assistance is needed. They are all very friendly :) the best aspect of their service is that they always check for finished plates and clear your table; which is a big one up because no body likes to eat on a crowded table. (5/5)   Overall: Definitely would return and would recommend as a great spot to chill and munch that is affordable and convenient since it's on The Strip.

cSWcpViww2JJeeB9PToaXw.text: We went to this restaurant because my daughter usually likes udon and we stayed at Paris so the location is convenient for us (it's inside the hotel). However the service and food were both disappointment. The service was so inattentive: first we waited for more than 10 min to even get water; no one came to ask for our orders even though we sat right across from the register and the waitresses/waiters came by us several times; we had to wave several times and eventually ask "loudly" to get someone to come over; then later I had to ask twice several minutes apart to get a fork; then my udon didn't even come when my husband almost finished his bibimbap dish; finally they never gave us changes for our payment (luckily we had some changes so we could cover the rest of the tips but what if we didn't have the exact changes with us?) About the food: The beef skewer was undercooked and hard to chew. The udon was nothing special and on the salty side. The only good thing is my daughter finished her Japanese potstickers so that should be decent enough. We would not recommend this place and would not come back.

Y5OwwYa2lKF2wnQUhjTokA.text: I waited in the line for about 5-10minutes and was little confused cause they were sitting people at the restaurant on the right which didn't seem to be part of Sekushi. I wanted to just eat in my hotel room and due to confusing line, I asked the waitress inside if they take to go orders and if they do, where I can place an order. She said they take to go orders and told me to go back to the hostess desk. I waited in line again for more than 10 minutes only to be told that they are not taking to go orders "per her manager". I informed her that the waitress inside told me I can and was told "my manager said no". I wasted my time because the waitress inside doesn't know any better which is extremely frustrating. I get that you need to make necessary decisions based on business demand but make sure you communicate well amongst your staff so customers are not given wrong info. I was honestly looking forward to trying the food because I have only heard great things but I am not sure if I will every try this place after this interaction.

BSwAkc-fOFj4p1bysRJ4vA.text: Food was not bad. It was a bit overpriced. The service was really good. My server Teresa recommended the oysters and I thought that was the best part of my dinner. Gave them 4 stars because the server was really attentive.

The service was terrible, the worst, one party in our group of 3 couldn't even eat her meal it was overcooked and chewy, the sushi was ok but nothing exceptional. For the cost, which was overpriced for what you received, go to Mon Ami Gabi, sit outside and enjoy the Bellagio fountains. BBnOmPMKnguPxwnjiXtDHw.text: My friends and I decided to go to this restaurant based on the many positive reviews, the decent price point, and its vicinity to our hotel. But the minute we arrived, we all felt concerns about eating raw fish from a place that seemed a little...off. But, we figured it was in a big hotel on the strip -- so maybe it wouldn't be the best sushi of our lives, but it would be acceptable. How wrong we were! I became violently ill within hours of ordering the 7-piece nigiri + hana roll. My suspicions tell me that a questionable piece of mackerel is what likely gave me the severe food poisoning. I had to cancel my plans on Saturday night, instead having to hang out by my hotel room's toilet all night, feeling more sick than I have in years. It's the next afternoon, and I still can't seem to keep anything in. I reported the issue to the restaurant, and they seemed concerned but ultimately didn't do anything for me, and didn't even refund me for the horrific experience. My three friends who ate with me escaped without getting sick -- but my experience has been so terrible that I wanted to warn other potential customers.

w2gJVLYuoEIlDkDpJOf-cA.text: The best sushi in Las Vegas! Novi was an excellent server. Salmon skin hand roll, oyster shooter, negihama were all spectacular. Great restaurant!

k-_ryJN6WY4lOUq5VYcy7g.text: This is my favorite place to have Japanese food in Vegas!  They have these amazing Garlic edamame, great ramen and sushi!  I'm a vegetarian and there are lots of options including tofu skewers.  We've been here 5 times this visit and it's probably not our last!  5 stars!  Also, Jennifer is awesome!  My grandson has lots of food allergies and she made it work for us!  5 stars!

uyTfG82ha_7GhPCp2ifMHw.text: Ramen was decent. We ordered the 5 protein skewers for $30 which disappointed me. We got the wagyu, bulgogi, shrimp, scallops and sea bass. The scallops were small; about the size of a nickel. The whole protein plate tasted great but it was all small portions- really small. I know it's Vegas and all, and most prices are inflated, but $30 for the protein was NOT worth it.

5aRtiP9Bh6mZjJ0YwmwAjA.text: Quick and great service! Great ambience and the location is very convenient! Everything on the menu looks good.

lEj477696TDOdQXvKN4sPA.text: Let's face it, after 3 full nights in Vegas, the hubs and I were in need of some take out and a movie. Because I had been eyeing this spot in our hotel since we checked in, we decided to check it out!  S = Superior sushi rolls! I opted for the traditional eel roll, which was absolute perfection! The extensive menu offers a wide variety of fancy and simple rolls, perfect for any sushi lover! E = Excellent Korean dishes! my husband chose to nosh on a few different kabob's to introduce me to the flavors of Korea! K = Killer staff. We had a tough time navigating the menu, but the hostess was so sweet, friendly and gave us great suggestions to accompany our meal.  U = Unbelievable vibes/atmosphere! Although we got our food to go, the space exudes a cool/trendy/environment that feels as though you've stepped into a little shop in Korea or Japan! S = Seaweed salad! OM NOM NOM! Literally full of flavor and so delicious! The hostess talked me into adding this menu item to my cart, and so glad she did! SO GOOD! H = Hidden in a corner of the Paris hotel, it's quaint and small, and yet, you can't miss it!  I - Incredible prices! After ordering sushi, seaweed salad, 4 different kinds of kabob's, sushitio peppers, eggrolls and more - our total was a mere $50!   I find myself craving this place since leaving Vegas and will make a point to stop back in! MMMM!

ODyTOpRWwFZ3_E5lJFru5A.text: Service was poor. They squashed us right behind the hostess in a corner next to another table. I could barely squeeze into my seat as there was someone sitting at the table next to us and a 7-8 inch gap for me to squeeze through to the sofa-type seat. We also only received one menu to share (2of us), and no happy hour menu. We had to ask for one later. After we ordered food no one came to check on us once, and they didn't refill our empty drinks. We had to ask a busboy to find a waiter later to give us a refill. The noodles I ordered were alright. I ordered the spicy tonkatsu. It was not spicy to me and lacked flavor. The California roll was all right and the sashimi sizes were very variant. The California roll was mediocre as well. For these high prices, mediuflld, and poor service, we will not return. One of the biggest pluses for this spot was the good old school hip hop music playing however.

eH0SLv9JDfXyLatcD4JIsw.text: I actually only ordered something to go from this restaurant, however, the customer service was fantastic. The hostess Jada was super helpful when it came to recommendations and helping me narrow down what I was looking for. This restaurant is very clean and the ambiance is great. I will be coming back.

SmxyMMdm--g44vZCi4ZVNA.text: I was bamboozled by all of the high reviews on Yelp. I came here this past weekend with high hopes of this being a great sushi/fusion spot. I was highly disappointed.  This place is located inside of the Paris Hotel and Casino. That should have been my first clue. It's literally located on the side of this wanna be alley way mimicking Paris streets. Huh....  The inside was not appealing at all. Very tiny. Small little booths with a center sushi bar. The walls were covered in some weird graffiti type of art. The vibe here is not a sexy one. Very casual and unromantic.   Service was pretty good. Food came out fast. Very attentive.  As for the food - We ordered pretty much everything they had to offer:  Edamame - Way too salty!  Seaweed salad - tiny portion....  Sliders - Not bad...needed to add ketchup because it was very bland.   Steak in a Bao bun - This was delicious!! Pretty much Bulgogi Beef in a Bao bun. Soooo good!!  Yellowtail Taco - Way too much Spicy Mayo!!   6 different speciality sushi rolls - All of them were pretty good. But very tiny rolls, and each cost around $25 a roll. Way too expensive for what you got.  Creamy Udon Seafood Soup - This was really good. Tasted like mac and cheese.   Overall - this place was way too expensive for lack luster ambiance and small portioned food. There are way better places out there.

kLDh0jh3KoBMFbWD7HXD9Q.text: The girl at the front was super helpful and patient with me while I ordered. She explained what options they have and was sweet when I said I was hungry I couldn't decide. Sushi is my comfort food and I'm glad I could get my fix!

efbS1l7jXbJ-TdSQf_2PCA.text: Good variety of rolls, tapas, skillets! I ordered a few rolls, the Salmon skin roll had a bone ! Despite not being so busy, I got a medley of waitresses and it took like 20-25 mins to get our bill! Overall, experience and service can be improved!

_zLcjf_zcUUKaueU9Dz_rA.text: The menu selection is amazing. We ordered takeout  and the gal who took our order was super helpful with our questions. We ordered the King Cali Roll, Aria O, and the Kimono and they were perrrfect for our late night cravings! The ambiance was relaxing inside. It was around 11pm and there were lots of tables open. Their specials were awesome, too. Two-for-one House Sake and Oyster specials were enough to make us say yasssss! They're located directly across a cute shop called Le Journal, so it's nice that the foot traffic isn't too busy either. Highly recommend this place if you're searching for awesome sushi in the area!

3JqkFkNHYambsm4pdK_qLQ.text: We were walking inside the Paris hotel at around 10:30pm when we came across this place. So we decided to give it a go. We were sat down immediately by the sushi bar and it wasn't too packed. We were given a "Late Night Menu" that was only available from 10pm-1am The prices for the sushi were around $18-25.   For starters we had the Kumamoto Oysters ($4 Each) which were already prepared for us and they were so good! We ended up ordering more. Now for sushi, I decided to try the Hot Spring Roll ($18) which had the baked scallop, crab meat, cream cheese, masago, and spicy mayo. It was a good sushi roll but I didn't think it was excellent.  At the bar you're able to see the sushi being made right in front of you with fresh ingredients. We were talking to one of the chefs and he was really nice and had us try different types of sauces. Now don't forget to check into yelp to get a free cheesecake or devil's pie. They didn't have any of those available so they offered me a Mochi which was nice. So I got the mango mochi and it was good!

FdftiS39kvVu8lDcs110Hw.text: It's a little pricey for the portion but not bad.   I ordered: creamy seafood udon - not bad, udon wasn't over cooked and the broth wasn't over seasoned, perfect balance and combination of the creaminess of the soup and seafood. Nigiri -   wagyu beef; nothing special, it is sweet, tasty and soft   foie gras; very tasty and velvety, must try   saba; love the fishiness, doesn't have a weird after taste, one of my fave   hamachi; I didn't care for it, just like the wagyu beef, nothing special, it wasn't melt in my mouth but it definitely did not taste fishy.    hotate; nothing special about it either, it was sweet and tasty. didn't taste fishy at all. aria o roll - the rice was waaaaaaaaaay too mushy, maybe it was just that day, not sure. flavor profile was not bad, it was a nice combo of flavors (i love avocado), ordered this roll since it had the least amount of sauce, I don't like rolls in general.  Service wasn't bad, the servers were attentive and friendly. The food was just not mind blowing though but I don't mind coming back for the other stuff on the menu.

mvIj6rQntfQKmgWVH4vr4A.text: Jada was super helpful and friendly. She was super sweet   And gave some food advice! Fast service and friendly staffs. Super convenient location, right off the elevator to the hotel rooms.

mdRPFW4EKHWBfTvcjQUHrQ.text: Stopped in for lunch and the whole crew thought it was pretty amazing.  It's expensive but that's it.   I ate a piece with a raw quail egg on top and it was amazing!   We also had gyoza and the Baja crisp roll all was great.   Service was on point too!   We didn't have a wait for a table for 4 on a Friday at noon.

WQY_t0uUms0Wh_UmpmgzZA.text: Overpriced food. Tried the ramen and it came out lukewarm! Staff is very attentive, but unfortunately they are not detailed enough to notice that the extra dishes they handed me were crusted with leftover food.

62fYah6yIt88v-SfWjb3zg.text: I always hated reading reviews of people that didn't eat at a restaurant.  But my experience was bad enough to write a review.  Two weeks ago, as we were walking from the casino side; we decided to stop by for lunch.  All we saw was the bar and sat down.  I found it weird that we sat there for 10 minutes and the two guys behind the bar kept looking at us but wouldn't talk.  I wasn't sure if they speak English so decided to go look for a waitress.  As I got up, a lady approached me to tell me that unless I see a hostess, no one will be helping me.  Mind you, you can't see a hostess when you're coming from the casino floor.  I told her that I never saw a hostess, she told me 'good luck getting service'.  Really?  The restaurant was empty and this is how you treat a person?  I was so irritated that I came back after I ate elsewhere to speak to the manager.  The same girl says that the manager isn't in and that I have no reason to complain.  This was so rude!  I took a business card to call in the complaint.  Called couple of times and got hung up on when I asked for the manager.  I didn't raise my voice or tell them that it was regarding a complaint.      This was such a terrible customer service spot that I wouldn't waste my money here.  If a manager reads this review, you have to manage your staff better.  Your staff is rude!!!

IWIAUN_BQRYqy-BciBIAWA.text: This place was amazing it was late so we only had about 15 mins to order but it was still enough time to order. I had a spicy tuna hand roll and the green mussels. Green mussels were amazing. They were spicy but so good. My friend had the salmon avocado roll and she said it was one of the better sushi she has had. I would give them a 4 star because all they have is Pepsi products but the food and server were to good to give anything less than a five star

o3PYEWW16t0rAmv-ggQQCQ.text: Great sushi place located in Paris.  My friend and I sat at the bar with a view of the main promenade - good for people watching.  The sushi was great, reasonably priced, and the staff was very attentive.  Would absolutely recommend.

ZwwHFPiRPbiR1VyQPUr4lw.text: I love the vibe, the customer service is amazing. Over a great experience. It's a 10 on my book

zM9oXcUU0B6ORNjaV5HOkg.text: Great skewers. Jess was super friendly and funny! The skillet is nifty.

06B5UqFALzbBLQDWwPvhuQ.text: Ridiculously fast despite being packed. Top shelf fish, but wish nigiri orders were for two pieces instead of one Every server in the restaurant paid attention to my needs, but only Nikki handled my mayonnaise aversion like a boss. Get the lobster roll!

VOB-AxbAGy3Sh6BIVCuauA.text: Had some great late night sushi. Reasonably priced and delicious. Good crowd even at 11PM

YQVXaFXO2TTApl0YxjNMdg.text: Love this place. It was very accessible, the place was clean  and the food was delicious. The Wagyu beef and Foie Gras sushi is so good!! And Nechar is an excellent sushi chef. He not only make the best sushi but he's very entertaining as well. Our kids loved watching him making sushi. We highly recommend this place

Ho9d_iUQj_qTalHl2CPShw.text: Couple problems that i experienced.1) miso soup. too salty, maybe don't order it if you could. 2) rice is too hard to chew, under cooked base on my knowledge. 3) Japanese restaurant but all the employees are non Japanese working here and playing korean, so that could explain a little bit of something i guess. good luck to find it, hidden inside the Paris hotel center..over all, not a fan of this place..

N6DI8CQr8RmO_AUAmSLGnQ.text: Delicious sushi...try the ones with lobsters signature rolls...perfect place for 2-4 people and very quiet...

-yZ2mFCasYZkJurljDcZ_w.text: We were so excited to try this restaurant.  The menu look legit.  We ordered the kampachi tiradito ,the yellowtail tiradito, spicy garlic edamame and yellowtail jalapeno roll.  The kampachi was suppose to have truffles and did not.  The yellowtail wasn't yellowtail and the roll was horrible.  The edamame was ok and the service was very slow.  We did order sake and that was good.  Maybe it's because it's new but I would not waste your money here.

-Ef9fY2lBUz84RNJB_v0jA.text: This place was awesome ! Fast and friendly. Gorgeous atmosphere(in Paris). We will DEFINITELY be back!! :)

wTjZItiXupWuMy9qzVz9bg.text: When you dine out, you generally expect a restaurant to have what is on the menu, except when they run out of daily specials.  And when something is not available, you further expect to be told when presented with the menus before you make your selections. This is largely why I can never, ever recommend this place.  Our neighboring table had the same problem and simply left.  Good decision!!  You also expect your server to get your order right, especially when any confusion stemmed from them not having things on the menu. So would I eat there again based on the food they actually did have?  No.  And you probably shouldn't either.  Salty miso soup; Greasy and tasteless "egg rolls".  The main courses our party ordered included tempura shrimp, Korean beef bulgogi and pork katsu.  All were all well below average except for the price which was well above.  They also feature sushi, which we didn't order or try, or try to order!  Face it, Las Vegas is full of food options.  This place in the Paris Casino is not one of them.

UMtAuYziUFIxeP7gMNjAxg.text: If you actually eat and enjoy sushi in NYC, LA, SF etc do not bother with this place. The service and presentation is good 4 stars but the food needs improvement.

ayjrzl1Lc46OINQ84yJmYA.text: The food was good. The udon tastes like alfredo sauce with udon. But service sucks... we were not checked on for 20 mins. I was trying to order more and the servers kept ignoring me. I made I contact with someone of them but the girl with the short hair rather talk to the sushi Chef then check on us. I guess that's what you guys pay your severs for. there is so much staff here but everyone is just conversating with each other.

T3YeBvqInzNhZ0Ki_dHMcw.text: I definitely recommend this sushi spot! Weethara took very good care of us! She was very attentive the whole time, filling our glasses when needed. And came by to check on us regularly.

xhacxEkPeCCHILF6c0HaeA.text: Probably the best sushi I've ever had. They take an extremely interesting spin on Japanese food, not just sushi. All the rolls have very unique ingredients and nothing is the same. All of the flavors and ingredients are very high quality. For what you're getting, the price is very good too. Love this place, will return when I come back to Vegas!!!!

iR0O3k66R2GVqCXattB2Pw.text: Came in to try this place after 10pm and they have a limited menu. No tapas. Service was really slow. Green tea is Ten Ren brand...didn't taste like Japanese Green tea. It tasted more like a watered down Chinese black tea. We ordered the rainbow roll $22 and it was a small  skinny roll. The crab filling still had crab shells. The sushi on top was only three kinds of fish tuna salmon and shrimp. The sushi combo was okay. Not spectacular.

HikAWSoOCl_qMRHd7zudSQ.text: My friend love to stay at Paris Hotel this time. and we visit her 7:00pm and we went first time at this restaurant . We love this food immediately because fish is so fresh!! And Executive Chef Eric is really nice guy.and meal was all amazing!! We also ate Wagyu Kobe beef From JAPAN!!! IT WAS so delicious and AMAZING FraverI'm so glad we have a Sekushy in Vegas now!!

2vSynNHTBZiZo-69-zEMEA.text: I ordered the specialty rolls and it definitely did not taste good.  Expected more from a restaurant in this casino.

TnMEkr6b1iHrNRdY4F6YPw.text: I was on the Vegas strip and was craving some sushi.  Came in for a quick bite and enoyed everything I tried. I had the Aria-O roll, Salmon roe sushi with quail egg, salmon skin roll, sweet shrimp and asked for the deep fried head (usually doesn't come with it),  wagyu tataki  appetizer as recommended by my server, and grilled butter scallops . Also had the edemame and Green Tea cheesecake. I would recommend this place and the staff was great especially the host and my server, Tien. I sat at the sushi bar, and also overheard other people complimenting her service. Place has only been open only 6 weeks, but they are definitely here to stay. Will be back when I visit again in April!!

Everyone was super friendly and I came just when they were switching to the late night menu but let me be the last dinner person since I came alone to vegas, dining solo was so good! They took pity on me! Coming back for sure I fell in love with that roll and they played jams from the 90's old school! Yay!

rxWqBQ60fjmjD396sUVnFA.text: Mmmmmmmmmmm yummy sushi.  Craving sushi and this hit the spot.  Everything from the kumomono oysters to the nigiri was spot on.  Rolls were filling and temura was on point.  Staff very friendly!! We will be back when in town

vQslTXah43QCQAwo8OXL1g.text: Very fresh fish,  good service and reasonable prices. Nice place to dine in vegas!! Good place to have sake and everything was wonderful!

JS4GyFPjHPSiieJlgyJq4g.text: Outstanding! Especially the unagi don....YUMMERS! The thickness of the sashimi was WOW!! The house sake was SMOOTH! Recommend getting it hot. Service is great and friendly, atmosphere is chill and relaxing....great place to eat and enjoy with your friends or family.

DN-4aOamIXQRRj87Hzle8w.text: I've been here twice. We came during happy hour when they were running a special on the rolls so we ended up ordering a few. They came out promptly and were delicious. Everything was fresh, balanced, and flavorful. Service was great as well. Definitely would come back.

eQw8uuGq2A6GrNMYGhGAvA.text: Best sushi we've ever had!  Everything was fresh and delicious. My husband and I were in Vegas for our anniversary for the first time ever!  We chose this restaurant based on yelp reviews and were not disappointed!  We ordered a sashimi sampler and 4 rolls in total. When you first sit down they bring you steamed and lightly salted edamame. Once my husband showed me how to eat it, I fell in love! We got the combo first. Each piece of fish was better than the next and all melts in your mouth!  When our rolls came we realized that our eyes were bigger than our stomachs!  But, it was so amazing we ate it all!  Everything was very fresh!    The coup de Gras was the cheesecake. We told them we were posting a review on Yelp and they brought us the best tasting cheesecake I've ever had. It was creamy and not overly sweet and absolutely perfect.   Overall, the food is amazing, the prices are competitive and the decor is fun and lively.   If you are looking for amazing sushi in a really cool little Japanese pop culture inspired atmosphere, this is the place for you. You will not be disappointed!

mhrIR6es3qOhG2uuZ8R_1g.text: Tried sushi bar for lunch. Sushi sampler was fresh and testy. Well prepared and as Japanese, I approve! My daughter tried Oyster shooter. She approved, but if you are sensitive for raw ingredients such as raw quail egg, oysters, don't try. They also serveBento box and Ramen noodle.  Wagyu beef skewer was tasty, but you only get one skewer.

mZ1l_xVDMz68tP1TmpPL9w.text: Great sushi and great service!! The fish was very fresh and very tasty! We went for the happy hour which is from 3-5pm. Select regular rolls are $6. We had the spicy tuna, yellowtail jalapeno, salmon avocado, and the crispy shrimp rolls. All were delicious but the yellowtail jalapeno was a personal favorite! We also got the aria o roll which was amazing!!! Definitely favorite roll. When you sit down they also give edamame on the house. Would recommend if you're at Paris and looking for a good lunch spot.

ehioeLw4t40mpI0glqwiBg.text: Excellent rolls and experience I wish our waitress was more clear on the price difference for hand rolls(not cut up) and the sliced rolls it would've saved me and my friend some money and confusion. Overall the food was delicious and I would recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is excellent!

N6AZf84o-DnnWU6nDilObQ.text: The food was AMAZING! Nikko and Dorien provided the best service. The fish was jumping on the plate it was so fresh. I truly believe Nikkos and Doriens hands have been blessed by the lord himself. After the first roll I couldn't believe that they made chef Ramsey look like chef Boyardee. Watching the two communicate and work together to perfect each dish was like watching two angels guide me to food heaven. I wouldn't be surprised if Nikko and Dorien could walk on water. I'm deeply considering moving to Las Vegas because of them. I HIGHLY recommend everyone to visit Sekushi and you'd be a fool if you don't ask for Nikko and Dorien. This place deserves more than 5 stars.....they deserve a MICHELIN STAR!!

S7JJZIIJanLjDvghs81nTQ.text: It was definitely a surprise to see this while walking around the Paris Hotel and Casino. While strolling around the hotel, I came across Sekushi while looking for restroom. Checked on yelp to see what the rating was. It was on-par, if I could do half stars, I feel like this would be 3.5 stars. Way better than what I was expecting!   I was lucky that I went in between major mealtimes, and I was seated immediately.  There was free edamaeI ordered the Gyoza and Diced Teriyaki Chicken [Rice] Skillet, with a fried egg on top, from the Japanese Grill menu. The gyoza was good, I just felt like I wanted more from it.  The teriyaki sauce wasn't too sweet and the chicken was cooked well. Most placed with hot skillets, with rice or noodles, tend to over-cook the protein to compensate for the heat from the skillet.  The restaurant itself is toward the back past the casino. The restaurant shares in dining area with the ramen restaurant next door and has a little sushi bar in the middle of the floor. Seemingly one of the harder restaurants to miss while walking around. The walkway shows a neon lighted sign for Sekushi, which provided a modern feel to the restaurant. There wasn't a lot of seating, but there was enough to handle wandering hotel guests. The server who was waiting on me was kind and checked on me a few times during the meal.   Definitely recommend if you're stating at the hotel or just wandering around the Paris hotel.

9vLxZa6SSuy2fjIXRo83bA.text: First timer here. Wanted to try this place because it wasn't here he last time I came. My friend and I shared plates. We ordered the bulgogi beef and diced teriyaki chicken. You have the choice of ramen or rice. We ordered one of each. Each plate was $20 and $19. I definitely didn't have an omg I must come back here experience but it was decent.   The service was ok. They were friendly and the food didn't take long after we placed or orders.

B09_wBXO6EEVq0F1lOyMXA.text: Ordered a bunch of little things because I was starving.  I had the pork dumplings, the California hand roll, the shrimp tempura roll, the wagyu sushi, and my friend had the pork dumplings with me, she also ordered her own shrimp tempura roll and she ordered another roll for herself. It was cool that the edamame was complimentary so that was a good starter. I think the customer service could've been a lot better, we waited a while before we were asked what we wanted to eat. Also, the rolls were amazing but one thing that stood out was the wagyu sushi, as good and tasty as it was, I don't think it's worth the price for just one piece. The bill at the end was not as bad as we thought because we did order a bunch of things.

xmy8FtoYM_4qN1nMFFvnsg.text: Great little gem in Paris!! The staff is super helpful and nice.  And the sushi is great and reasonable.  The ambiance is nice and there wasn't a wait.  I highly recommend.

14YL5quRsyOwpshNjdMjpg.text: Tbh I tried to find something that I like, but the food was just too salty. We tried wagyu beef with green tea salt, miso ramen, spicy miso ramen, chirashi, teriyaki chicken with rice and noodle. The only thing that was decent is the wagyu beef, but even that is heavily salted.   Chirashi is of course not salted, if it is then I would have probably flipped. But the sashimi was warm, and were sliced into such huge pieces, I had to pick between eating the sashimi first or rice first.  I would much appreciate it if they would slice them into 3 smaller slices. That way you would be able to eat a slice of sashimi with rice in every bite.

fOBgCprKK4c_YzoBsRSMpQ.text: Friendly, lightning fast service. Food came out less than 10 mins after ordering. The pork ramen was good and large portion. The gyoza were ok, I assume not house made, nothing to write home about. The steamed beef bun had excellent flavor and stuffed with beef. Chicken teriyaki skewer was small.

The service was great and the staff were very friendly. The atmosphere was really nice as well. I'll definitely be coming back next time I'm in town.

-g4VUbSHQm_q9fgsRmMOyg.text: Pretty pleased with this spot overall.  The restaurant is small, lots of seats at the sushi bar.  I really enjoyed my Surf and Turf Roll - with two caveats - a couple of my steak pieces has tough fatty spots and it was quite salty (I like salt, so it didn't really bother me but it may be off putting to others)  The Aria O Roll was fun. jvMYqf_YdCncDmWegV5HOw.text: Great tonkatsu ramen around the corner from the elevator to my room.  Can't beat it!  Had Kirin draft beer, and a nice seat at the bar people watching.  Would recommend for anybody in Paris.

DqdriZz6OmVuVScrDBb5pQ.text: This place is fantastic! Lerma took great care of us! The food is extremely high quality and flavorful. The sake was also fantastic. Will be coming again for next Vegas trip!

-MfyuZvJCwH1n_8CaUPpfw.text: NIKKO is the best. Always come here on my break for lunch and my sushi is always nothing less than perfect. & he's super sweet & friendly. Sushi always tastes super fresh & the servers and hostesses are always very kind.  Whenever i'm here, the guests surrounding me are always having a good time and enjoying their food. Sekushi is definitely a feel good restaurant with great vibes from their staff & environment.

1sGERr4V1l2SrcJ7elujjA.text: I really enjoyed this place, from their service, to their food, and the atmosphere. It was a really relaxed place to get some sushi.   The employees were so nice and always made sure to check on how we were doing.   The food was food, I really recommend the sliders and the spicy garlic edamame for appetizers. I had the surf n turf roll, and spicy tuna roll. Those were delicious and filling! My bf had the pork ramen (you can request for them to make it spicy) and he really enjoyed it! I tasted his ramen and I can agree that it was one of the best ramens I've had!   This place is great if you're craving some late night Japanese food!

LtEqIQ3ffyi295Gv6GvdRw.text: Best Food and the front staff was great nice two young ladies helped us out answered our questions and we are visiting from San Antonio Texas will come again.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nAnDgkL9haCSGtQKv2wCzA.text: I saw this restaurant in December when I visited but didn't get the chance to check it out. I'm so glad I finally got to on my most recent visit! We had an early dinner here and were seated at the sushi bar. You receive complimentary edamame with your meal. They have a large variety of sushi as well as small and large plates. We both ordered bento boxes, salmon for me and bulgogi for my boyfriend. He also ordered kirin draft beer and said it was good. The bento boxes include your choice of meat (they also have teriyaki chicken and panko shrimp), salad with peanut dressing, a chicken egg roll, and white rice. You also receive miso soup as an appetizer. The soup was really good but the SALMON was the star. It was perfectly crispy on the outside with the skin on and the salmon itself was so fresh! It reminded me of what my mom makes for me at home. I sampled my boyfriend's bulgogi and it was also yummy. We also ordered pork gyoza and those were good as well. The egg roll and salad were just okay. For dessert we shared the mango and red bean mochi and they were a sweet and refreshing ending to our meal. In short, the food and service were very good! I'm a fan!

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango and red bean mochi

Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon bento box

4JP3KNqY2uW8fbahilLU1g.text: Decent sushi but they have a lot to work on. I just learned that it's only been open for 6 weeks, so they are clearly still working out the kinks:  The good: -Fresh quality fish -Oyster special totally worth it (learned about it from a family at the table next to us): 12 oysters for $24 -Friendly service  -Quick seating; there were a couple of tables available (while some of the other restaurants in the vicinity had long wait lines) -Interesting menu   The "needs improvement" -While service was friendly, it was very spotty and inconsistent. They cleared dishes quickly (for the most part) but some items took a very long time to arrive. -A couple of the oysters were a little weird...they were fresh, but a few of them had some inedible portions (that were not pieces of shell). -Chirashi was mostly rice and very little fish; not the ratio that one expects for the price. -Again - the quality of the fish was fresh, but nothing about the food screamed extraordinary.  It's Vegas. Gotta raise your game if you're going to survive.

lO7_22E7lmhTSjDruKKg1w.text: Great atmosphere and food!  Where most food on the strip is way over priced, Sekushi actually provides value for what you pay.  Novi took great care to give a perfect dining experience.  I will definitely return.

k0GM2Z71B-49-JlLFNd6gA.text: Everything was amazing and Teresa helped me out with ordering my food.  Service was very timely and great food came out in perfect order from appetizers to main entree. Def would be back when in Vegas again

r_M6cK-sbbQonEAcrDukcg.text: The food here is really good! Try the aria o roll, the most different thing I've ever tasted. Another roll I really enjoyed was the Kimono. Will make this our destination to every vegas trip!

Q1rJBSYPGnxg2hNneJoifg.text: Sweetest waitress served me. Food is pretty good. I was the last guest here and ordered literally on the last call at 12:45am, but they were so nice and gave me food! There's also a wonderful check in offer in which you can get cheesecake or devil's pie. Since they ran out of cheesecake they offered mochi! So I ended up with a nice refreshing dessert :)

wBwpiTr2HMY54FhAGnju4A.text: Lovely little sushi place right in the Paris Hotel. The waitress, Yui, was great about keeping our water filled and checking on us to see if we wanted to order more rolls.  We started with  the spicy tuna rolls, AriaO rolls, and rainbow rolls to start. We also had a nice cold Sake and there was a nice selection of Sake to choose from.  The rolls were fresh tasting with none of that nasty amonina odor or taste. We finished with the King Salmon rolls.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. AriaO rolls were my favorite. They were fresh and not over powering on one item.

D2QKyDcjJHz8F8KraOwtWA.text: Our hostess Jades was super friendly and helpful when placing our order. We had never been to your location. She's explained the menu and had some suggestions for us to try. The prices were affordable for being inside such a beautiful hotel. I am currently sitting waiting for out to go order and am letting everyone passing us know how great the services as been

qDUzf_DYqg4ZLjKLqTu3nQ.text: This place is awesome. It has all of my favorite Japanese/Korean dishes! Food, service and ambiance is fantastic. Will be returning the next time I am in town for sure.

blwriIOrowUskIk65jYkKQ.text: Great service, seated very quickly. Staff was very friendly and attentive. Definitely recommend the specialty rolls!

NZUgHIOjJYW2zeP4ENcI0Q.text: The Baja crispy roll was really really good. Will definitely get that again. Great service. Tasty miso soup too.

o2qjUOfPkR3UjDkoyHygvQ.text: The food was amazing! Everyone from the hostess to the waitress took care of us. Mika was especially great, friendly and attentive. Highly recommend! Thanks Mika!

lYBGslQ99Ohq0Ph8DbKnHg.text: Don't let the affordable price fool you! Other reviewers who gave this awful place more than half a star must be the owner, owner's friends and relatives. The kitchen staff are not trained chefs at all. The rice was mushy, completely overcooked. The sushi size is miniaturized, there is zero flavor profile. The sushi pieces were unevenly cut - different height, some were slanted. While the service was good, no service can make up the waste of money and sub-par food quality. By far the worst, the worst restaurant in Vegas.

xF7dtMNfkr1ZTiq2B2iOsg.text: If I could give zero stars, I would!! We spent $120 on 3 small, tasteless rolls (Sekushi Rainbow, had shell pieces from the crab, King Cali, basically a grocery store California roll, and their "signature" Lobster Roll, no flavor) and a 3 piece sushimi salad that literally came at least 10 min after everyone else got their rolls. The salad was an appetizer. Service was good, the only good thing I have to say about this place. Needless to say, we're headed for a real dinner now! Don't waste your $$$!!

PttDk20cprEyTy0oHIp4Xw.text: Just okay. Rice was tough. Fish was decent. Service was slow (but not horrible). In general, this is a mall-grade, unremarkable sushi restaurant.

X5w4nwpRkV9C5K5BOAdYYg.text: Not sure why this place has four stars.  The salmon and hamachi were grayish the rolls were not well assembled. The fish tasted strong so it wasn't that fresh.  The servers were very pleasant but you couldn't talk to a chef even at the bar.  I would avoid for sure.

aHnory6RfyEXvSb4mnW8mQ.text: Absolutely terrible. Came here because it had good reviews somehow. The sushi is extremely expensive and the rolls are tiny. The restaurant was mostly empty, yet it took them 30 minutes to make our sushi. My friend got the sushimi salad and she was the LAST one in our group to get her meal. It had 3 slabs of sushimi on it and a handful of lettuce and a tomato slice. DO NOT GO HERE.

xavbFFbJtu1veKqAcIoPkQ.text: The good. Sashimi was very good. The quality, flavor and texture were excellent. Very fresh. Everything else was mediocre- average. Service was ok - I had to track a server down after not being acknowledged for some time (not a huge deal) after that very attentive.  The restaurant decor / ambience was lacking for an in casino restaurant on the Las Vegas strip.  Again, similar to what you will get in your average local strip mall sushi joint (only with Vegas strip price tag).  When I look at the overall meal and what I spent this place gets 2.5 stars and I likely will try other spots vs coming back.

VS1NU0Ye9GhavtWbt1I3LA.text: We were starving after walk a couple hours in Las Vegas Strip,then we look for a Japanese restaurant close by.finally,we found one in Paris Hotel.we decided to give a try,we were satisfied with the food and the services,specially Novi she did a good job,she always smile,nice and take care our table.i think she deserves to get raise.because she really did good job,for sure we would come back.

Rm08JJGNsZcu_XyQ2BE5hw.text: My girls and I saw this place on yelp, and they had good reviews, so we wanted to give it a chance. The interior is cute and the servers are attentive. We got the Hot Spring, Aria-O, and Negihama. We really enjoyed the Aria-O the most.

2hQf-qNImegJArcIPinF4w.text: This is a great restaurant with amazing service. The waitress was extremely nice and attentive. We had the eel avocado roll.  They were both very tasty. oCS03m9i7lhERas4i30sDQ.text: It is great sushi restaurant. Our server was nice and food was delicious as well. Good!!!!!

xeip5tCX5AcXq7hujzjqjA.text: We were looking for a good sushi place for dinner during our last night in Vegas. Came upon this place through Yelp and decided to make a last minute reservation.  This is a cute little sushi bar located across from the guests' elevators in Paris Hotel.   The wagyu skewer was my favorite thing on the menu, the meat melted in your mouth.  We ended placing another order of it because it was so delicious. Some of my other favorites were the Kumamoto oysters and the NegiToro roll, the latter was super soft and absolutely delicious.   On the downside, the grilled butter scallops was overcooked and a bit tough. The sashimi sampler was average, the presentation was beautiful, but the fish themselves were hit or miss, i.e. loved the mackerel but disliked the snapper.   Overall, a great option to have a casual sushi dinner, service was attentive (our waitress was Yui) and efficient.

OZ7-2cYya0PF9kLJVEjvrQ.text: Incredible service and delicious food. Nikko was the most amazing sushi chef ever. I am looking forward to coming back here. Please give this man a raise!! I would highly recommend this spot to any foodie.

nLJFIbGybw2x8dG92mcrGw.text: We decided to eat here last minute, and I was glad that we did. As is typical for Las Vegas, a person can't eat for less than $15, but this restaurant isn't a whole lot more than that.  We were seated quickly, and the dim sum cart came around pretty quickly. I have this sticky rice and it was very tasty. One of my companions had a pork bun and couldn't stop raving about it.  For the main course I ordered the vegetarian noodles, and they were okay. Probably not something I would order again. However my partner ordered the ginger chicken and I ate half of his plate. That is definitely something you would want to order if you're there.  Service was good and timely, and I would definitely eat there again the next time I stay at the Paris. I highly recommend it to anyone who enjoys Asian food.

YJ-9CsT4A7vZWpM_Byn_OQ.text: I ordered the uni bowl and it's a really good portion for one person. Highly recommended. We also ordered other cooked dinner, it was ok. The steak with rice was a bit over cooked. I really really love their uni. Fresh and creamy. Approved by uni addict :)

uvEn3MuzitapyKaRWtEKQg.text: Yummy! Healthiness! Fresh!  Had dinner & lunch here during our stay.   The Specialty Sushi is awesome & the regular rolls are good but small.   We had the Bento Meal for lunch & it was filling. I got the Teriyaki Salmon with the sauce on the side. I was afraid that they'd over marinate it but they didn't... Actually next time I'll order it with the sauce on it to save me a step :-) Hubby had the Bulgogi Beef Bento... it was good but if you're used to the Korean BBQ Bulgogi Taste, this is different. Not bad, just not expected.   Green tea Ice tea is refreshingly unsweet & made with Matcha. YUM! I asked for some to go & I never ask for To Go drinks.  We will definitely be back! Yum! Oh & did I say that the service was awesome! Very thorough & helpful!

3ZSFDxpPaMP4MQak3kUrpA.text: Me and my husband just moved here from California, look out any opportunities and new challenge .. well I invited by one of my friend to try out this place sekushi inside the Paris hotel , my husband and I having a late dinner . So, when I see from the front door, I think this is just ok place. Once we get sit it around 4 of us, Novi was our server that time, I saw her name tag. And also she was greeting us with welcome and warm smile. She show us the menu both I think have so many pages, or with 3 pages sushi menu and the other big with picture, explain each detail, and also bring out one of the daily special menu to our table.   Wow, she's excellent , great, friendly, patient, lovely, her service was fast, her speed is so fast, she knew what we need, keep on eye. Ask us if our dining food was ok or not? She pay attention in every single detail, we love it.. she work hard , nicest server ever in whole strip I think.. I mean sincere not fake coz we know server job base on tips. Looks like they all share same tips, but none of other server was care about our table.   Overall, we so happy.. she deserve much better high end restaurant in big 5 stars hotel with her attitude , professionalism. I hope this company treat her well and give her what she deserve. Will come back again if we coming back to vegas. Great . Very satisfied.

TSpp-OJ1gzIRMje-Z9qaHQ.text: We left Le Cabaret in the Paris casino looking for a dinner spot and happened upon Sekushi. My first thought was that it was small and simple looking. We had to sit at the sushi bar since those were the only available seats. The waitress brought over complimentary edamame while we perused the menu. We ordered the salmon skin, shrimp panko, and the spicy tuna rolls. All were good and on par with most sushi that we eat. The star of the show was the creamy seafood udon. Amazing! I could not stop eating this. It's made with shrimp, scallops, mussels, crab meat, fish cake, mushrooms, and vegetables. This is a must try at Sekushi. I need another bowl of it.

I split fried green beans and the tempura shrimp (not pictured) and then had a volcano roll and another roll which I forget the name. Everything was delicious! NeWFdGgCiZbSybdyletRwg.text: Sekushi provides a great quality of sushi and service. Sit at the bar if you can so you can watch the sushi chefs (probably wrong term) prepare your order.  Great food, great service. Very reasonable prices. And for "casino food" it doesn't smell like smoke in here at all and we genuinely felt we were in a restaurant.

AiR6BPPcsVz7Ji5cYFiTlg.text: I was a little nervous to come here based on the reviews being so all over the place. We came here on our last night in town for something convenient to our hotel before heading to the airport. Check in on Yelp got us a free house sake which was a nice touch.   My boyfriend ordered the Sekushi 7 dinner that came with a special chef's choice roll. The platter had shrimp, tuna, salmon, yellowtail, squid, mackerel, and fatty tuna. The chef's roll was a simple roll with mixed fish (I watched them cut up fresh tuna, salmon, and a white fish (?) and dump into a container to make these rolls), avocado, and cucumber. He liked everything on the platter and thought it was all very fresh.   I was in the mood to try a few different menu items, so I ordered an oyster shooter, butter scallop skewer, yellowtail taco, and the Aria O roll. I was a big fan of everything, especially the roll - I had hoped to taste the mango more, but the salmon on top was so melt in your mouth I wanted more. The a la carte sushi is overpriced here per piece in my opinion, so it was more worthwhile for me to just get another roll. I got a roll that was super salmon focused, both inside and out (I can't remember the name, but it isn't on their website). This was the only thing I wasn't as big of a fan of; it wasn't worth the extra money spent as it somehow it didn't let the salmon shine as much as the Aria O roll despite having MORE salmon in the roll.

jA2Ey3XSYqBclotzVVvfIg.text: After a full day of nonstop walking and sightseeing in Vegas, hubs and I decided on a quiet evening in the hotel room with some takeout. We stopped by Sekushi in the Paris Las Vegas Hotel, and ordered a few things: Tofu Bibimbap, Vegetable Ramen, and a Miso Glazed Sea Bass Skewer. The food was incredible! The sea bass was so tasty that it left us wanting more! The bibimbap had an array of vegetarian delights; crispy tofu, kimchi, corn, broccoli, asparagus, and rice. The vegetables were very well-seasoned, especially the asparagus which was really delicious! Last, but not least, the ramen did not disappoint! I have been craving ramen for a while, and this one was packed with shiitake mushrooms and noodles! I have to say that I was a little apprehensive trying this place because of some of the Yelp reviews. Our dining experience proves that everyone has differing opinions, or that sometimes establishments use constructive criticism to improve their food and service. I don't know which prevailed in this case, but I hope this encourages someone to try this restaurant and others despite negative reviews! Maybe you haven't heard the best things about it, but if you're still curious enough to experience it for yourself--go for it!!!

fVyRe1B8l5L0GkMjZVhhZA.text: Hostess was lovely. Very fast service and friendly staff. Veggie ramen is super yummy. Waitress was quick and efficient. Thanks for the great meal  Would recommend. :)

rpxt66s4bNPI4RmSnQGXGw.text: I happened to walk by this place in Paris with my wife and kid and with modest expectations for LV and a starving preteen, we decided to go with Japanese.  The restaurant was fairly busy, but we were able to get seated fairly quickly at the bar in front of Chef Min. I did my normal inspection of the case and was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the fish (I worked as a Sushi Chef for 9 years).  My wife and daughter ordered the Ramen from next door and the broth was an amazing, well balanced beef flavor explosion with some some equally delicious char siu (bbq pork).  No grilling or torching of the meat needed (horrible techniques for thin meat).  Back to my meal...   I started with a few of some great, meaty half shell oysters, followed by some sweet kumamotos... I was hooked, and from there, I asked Min for an Omakase, and let him work his magic.   Seared A5 wagyu - no teeth needed Seared Foie Gras with Russian Caviar and 24k gold flakes - sure, why not. Chu-Toro with freshly grated wasabi and I'm calling it a day.  Chef Min definitely earned my respect and I'll be seeing him soon in the future.

C64krwdwIsqEOxCjIjpezw.text: On the way to The Paris hotel from Bally's! Super delicious sushi! I was craving something refreshing and this place did not disappoint! I like light, refreshing tastes with ponzu sauce so the waitress recommended the "In and Out" roll which is seasonal and not on the menu. It was absolutely delicious. The yellow tail was super fresh, sprinkled with toasted garlic, and tiny fresh herbs it was perfection. I ordered it twice and could have done more. It's is a bit pricey but worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smooth and sparkly Sake
Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;In and Out&#34; roll!

i5T9bcjTYJ3pux8L_7_Yvg.text: I love sushi, and have it probably once a week at home.  I am always in search of a sushi spot that can actually compete with my fave place.. because why not?  Time and Time again, they always fail to surpass my favorite. But tonight they got themselves some competition in Las Vegas.  When it comes to sushi in Vegas, you're paying 3-5x what you'd pay back home. So it better be worth it.. here at Sekushi, the prices are reasonable for Vegas, AND the food is wonderful.  The chefs work very fast behind the sushi bar, and spare no time for mistakes. It's obvious they love what they do, and they're very good at it.    I ordered the Alaskan salmon roll, Japanese gyoza, Baked mussels, and panko shrimp.  The roll was out in about 5 minutes, when the place was pretty busy. Very impressive! It had wonderful flavor, and the balance of all the ingredients was wonderful.. letting each thing shine through.  The baked mussels were cooked perfectly, and the sauce with them was great. Warning though; if you're a baby like me when it comes to spice.. maybe ask them to hold the spicy aioli.   Japanese gyoza was super hot, fresh off the fire.  And filled with delectable flavor.    I would come here again!

jJg2ETGa973DnlqX_19C5g.text: I was not impressed by any of the dishes, especially given the steep price here for fast-casual Japanese food.  We only stopped at Sekushi for the convenient location in Paris, and the artfully decorated, modern space captured our eyes. Sekushi offers two menus featuring a raw sushi bar and cooked Japanese food, like skewers. We ordered:  Aria-O Roll: very average roll with salmon and shrimp with a pop of texture from masago arare and a pop of flavor from a honey truffle aioli; didn't hate it and didn't love it Wagyu Beef Skewers: best of the bunch; warm and tender beef that's well-seasoned with a sprinkle of green tea salt (didn't taste the green tea) Shrimp Skewers: pretty raw for a cooked skewer and had a bad charred taste Sea Bass Skewers: pretty good / a little sweet from the miso glaze Spicy Pork Kimchi Skillet: the skillet was sizzling hot but why was the food lukewarm? The meat was tough in consistency and the kimchi tasted pretty meh. Hard pass Chirashi Don: just pretty awful. The bowl consisted of 6 pieces of sashimi over rice, and each piece of fish tasted (and looked) less appealing that the prior - lacked any flavor and freshness. Another hard pass Negitoro Roll: overwhelming rice to fish proportion; not worth it  I'd say we tried a good portion of the menu in terms of variety, chosen with the help of our waitress (great service btw). None of the dishes felt standout. Will not be returning as there's too many better Japanese places on the Strip!

waYVyAUOhWTdYBb0HJn_DA.text: Great food and nice ambience! The host was very hospitable and answered all the questions that we had. We went with her suggestions for food and they were all amazing!  The ambiance was perfect.  Love this place.  Will be coming back again.

KjJy-67WPJbrS7GR3fCs6g.text: Food and service we're amazing!  Jada went above and beyond to help me find a specific drink I've been looking for but apparently is rare here on the strip.  Our server Sophie was also prompt and polite. I highly recommend this place for anyon looking for a good place to eat which has high end food that won't break the bank.

pll_XeSvkFXRdywAgvd9pQ.text: Extremely disappointed relative to what my expectations were. The display cases with ice and seafood, look amazing. P.S. this is a fake display. The wagyu and pork belly skewers are probably the worst tasting pieces of meat I have ever consumed. My girlfriend and I both spit out our "pork belly." It tasted more like shoe leather and should not be called pork belly because pork belly is incredibly tender and juicy. The salmon nigiri was amazing. The rolls were over-priced and unremarkable. $24.00 for a small, mediocre roll is agregious.  There are several better sushi locations on the strip.

iinrhpajNb7pOHPZtRjDWQ.text: Was persuaded by the good reviews, but had a pretty disappointing experience. We ordered the sushi assortment that comes with a chef's special roll. The fish was definitely not fresh and were not the best cuts. The roll was pretty basic too. Only good thing was the free sake with Yelp check-in. Would not recommend if you're looking for authentic sushi.

1oWaoiSu70MB7v8u3qJQ7g.text: Located in the Paris casino. Service was good on a very crowded night.  Food is fairly authentic.  The menu featured your typically Japanese fare mixed in with Egg Rolls (Chinese), Bugolli (Korean), and Sushi rolls which are more Asian Fusion than traditional Japanese food.  i.e. if you go to Japan you would typically get a nigiri sushi but not likely a deep fired roll with sauce smothering it.  The Miso soup was pretty authentic.  My son and I ordered a bento each as well as a few side dishes.  The salmon was fresh and tasty.  The chicken teriyaki was great according to my son.  Free sake if you check in.  Would consider coming back the next time in Vegas and craving Japanese food.

But I was pleasantly surprised and decided to try it after speaking to the Hostess Jada as she raved about it. She was incredibly friendly and helpful and seated me right away after walking me through the menu. If you are on the strip and have time to pop into Paris, I would recommend coming to Sekushi for a meal.

SOOKMO9hnGuwJqfGa7yeyA.text: Hostess was great. Told my fiance and I that if we write a yelp review, we could get a free sake or beer. I ordered the salmon don and my fiance ordered the tonkatsu ramen which he liked. My salmon don was light on the salmon, especially given the $29 price tag. The rice was well-seasoned but my salmon sashimi had bones in it. Upon telling the waitress, she apologized and was very receptive, though only gave me 20% off my dish.

5-HuMSzo7A3J_Ntjzvndzg.text: We party if 6 eat at Sekushi , we have skillet and sushi ... the food was great and server was helpful and nice, novi was our server. We appreciate thank you. We will come back ..

cxdn6QyGDMouJF8ABlf7BQ.text: My boyfriend and I happen to stumble upon this sushi restaurant on our way to brunch.   We came on a busy Saturday night and the waiter, waitress and the hostess were so nice. We said we'd wait for the bar seating and they said they had a table open for us if we wanted to sit right away. So sweet. We waited for about 20 minutes then we were promptly seated but during those 20 minutes the waiter, waitress and the hostess asked if we still wanted the table. Again, so sweet of them for checking in on us and seeing if we changed our minds.   We ordered the Waygu beef tataki and boy was it flavorful. I liked having the lava salt on it. The Creamy seafood udon was extra creamy. Reminded me of seafood pasta in Alfredo sauce. The Aria O roll was delicious. I love the crunch on the outside of the roll. My boyfriend ordered the chef's choice sushi and the fresh wasabi. It was a generous portion for an extra $3.   Note: if you check in you'll receive a free desert. We were so full so they kindly packed it to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu beef tataki

W61eAUsKFhImt-1sAc8Mdg.text: My rating is based on the help I received from Jessica Garcia, not the actual restaurant. She went above and beyond in trying to get me seated to enjoy my last night at the Paris hotel. After a fun night at the tables, I was told the sushi bar close at 3:00am, boy were they wrong. I arrived around 12:52, and a party just was just seated. Miss Garcia worked with me to ask the chefs if they could do one more order; but as they agreed, she was overridden by the manager. So I was not able to enjoy what looked like a wonderful menu. Since I was not able to eat I'm not sure how the food actually is, but Miss Garcia is the cream of the crop when it comes to customer service and taking care of the customer... Hats off to her and her pride in her work!

Y-huBfPe-Fz2DfUDzuRbeA.text: I love sushi anytime I can get it. My friend and I were trying to find affordable sushi before the Britney concert (you know how pricey Vegas can be)... The only thing I didn't like was the spicy mayo; it was sour tasting.

3bYAE5VEVLywBWqWl1eCWw.text: Just chose to try this  Misso Soup was not that great  Rainbow Roll from premium selection was ok Chicken Teriyaki bento box was not at all interesting  Servers are good Smile and try to take care of you hence 2 stars I have had much much better food in San Francisco otherwise  Leaving the food on table :-( Going to try something else.

UoqdpsNyZrz_IpbkzE32jw.text: Came here for a lunch with the wifey and we left full & happy!  . The sekushi roll was amazing! The smokiness of the foie gras was a surprise and a welcome one. The flavor profile was very unique and combined with very fresh tuna that melts in your mouth made this our favorite roll of the lunch! We would come back just for this. . The kimono roll was a very close second, as the combo of he spicy tuna and nice crunch added to a change in pace of texture from the sekushi roll that led for a debate of which was our favorite.  Again, the cuts of fish were very fresh. . We tried two pieces of the Otoro, $15 each, but worth it with all its melt in your mouth goodness. . Service was great.  Very friendly, prompt and courteous.  Thank you Weethara for a very pleasant lunch experience.  We will definitely come back to try some more rolls!

j2sOfCcvx0hI3MgtNi7Idg.text: Review #129 - 2017  My aunties decided to dine in at Sekushi since they were staying at Paris Hotel & invited us to join them along with a few other people that I've never met before.  Unfortunately, since it was already late and I didn't want my daughter to ruin everyone's meal, I opted to just stay in my room.  My aunties felt bad because they said that the sashimi was really good and they wanted to get me something so I asked for the sashimi salad.  My auntie brought my order to my room around 10:15 PM & I ate the whole thing in less than 2 minutes.  Maybe it was due to the small portions, but also the fact that the fish was super fresh and their salad dressing was so good made me want to go downstairs for another order.  If I ever decide to stay on The Strip, I'll be sure to stay at Paris since my aunties's room was much nicer than my room at Bally's--just so I can come back here for their sashimi salad.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So fresh &amp; delicious!

VADZuOKUq1tZ4K4cWKI1cw.text: Good place to have a quick and easy food fix after hangover, other than that nothing is really exceptional about this place and overall tastes are rather neutral and in some case inexistant.

dKT8shGKFGn7RWV_mwH2ng.text: Sushi bar was delicious Inkko was an amazing sushi chef!  Inkko let me sample different sushi options and was on top of his game.  Every time I come to Vegas he is the only sushi chef I will come to see.  I was greeted by a super sweet hostess and taken directly to the sushi bar.  She was very attentive and brought me edamame to eat while I decided on my sushi options.  I decided to venture from my  normal routine and try some hand rolls. They were all delicious and tasted very fresh.   I come here every year and I will always come back.  The sushi is consistent and delicious always with good service.  The sushi chefs will try and make anything for you.  They ask you what you like and they make it to suit

jkgv8BREGYkjFnbMtNLzxQ.text: Located in the Paris hotel, me and my parents ate here after a long exhausting day of exploring Vegas. We just wanted a quick meal. We ordered an eel avocado roll, salmon avocado roll, beef bento box, and the Chilean sea bass app. I did not like how they do not offer brown rice, I find that a little odd. The main reason I am taking the 2 stars off is for the incredibly slow service. My Chilean sea bass came out about 25 minutes after my parents food. I was not happy. But the fish was absolutely delicious and I would order it again if I ever return. The sushi I tasted was just average, nothing special.

eAnI61k5bUTWxr1hoo5vMQ.text: Went there again saw the same chef, Nikko. As expected, the food was amazing. Not just the taste but the presentation as well. Fish slices on the nigiri was more plentiful than any other sushi places i've tried. Oysters are so fresh and the wagyu beef melts in your mouth. This is my go to place when i visit vegas and Nikko is my go to chef. Service is amazing as well!

idBiPE8XMXpSL8Oh2KAUyQ.text: This is Japanese Restuarant is in the Paris Hotel. Close late hours I think 2am. My friend & I ate the skillet & it was pretty good. We order short ribs skillet (double kim chi for the sides) & chicken teriyaki skillets (mushrooms & Vegas for the side). These 2 dishes was very delicious. Our tummy was very happy. Host & waitress was very friendly. I would come back here again.

L04HTIrtWDjdZ6jfRXA7OA.text: So I'm used to better, but this really wasn't a bad location at which to have a meal. Indeed, their happy hour specials (which I took advantage of) were some of the best options I could have had for a meal in this hotel at the time. I was able to have a reasonably decent meal, especially a filling one that was reasonably healthful. Service was a bit uneven -- I didn't get more tea very quickly or anything, but I did have a decent meal alone. It doesn't feel very authentically Japanese, but this is the Las Vegas Strip so what did I expect, really? It suited my purposes and that was enough for me.

bYd07BeX8FumM9jEL55qmw.text: Not good. The atmosphere was cafeteria like. The baked roll was so overpowering with tons of spicy mayo , that it was gross to look at.  Not a great alcohol list. They didn't understand gluten free. Fish didn't seem fresh

G5kmnfrBwkUhY_j4abl_-w.text: So I'm staying at the Paris hotel and noticed a new sushi spot, of course I'd have to try it! They're hand rolls are seriously so amazing that I had to come back the next day for more!! The avocado salmon hand roll, jalapeno yellowtail, and spicy tuna are what I ordered .. they have 5 stars for food taste but unfortunately their service was not the greatest but it's understandable since it's a few days they've been open. I'm a frequent sushi eater, their fish is EXTREMELY FRESH! I've been in Vegas the past 3 days, and I've come 3 times already! I'll be back again for sure! Their lunch prices are ok, but dinner prices are a bit pricey compared to the food we receive! Oh well, that's Vegas for you! But all and all, it's great

ZEoDMf1MQ1QofRwMEc0rvw.text: Not sure why this place is rated so well. I ordered the rainbow roll, miso soup, and steamed rice. Miso soup was super good but the rainbow roll was alright. The fish did not melt in my mouth, seemed kind of tough, and didn't seem too fresh. Prices weren't that great either. Sucks that this was our last dinner in Las Vegas. Regrets.

yPnq_l9LKnidBf6PLBR_NQ.text: Solid fish and good price for Vegas strip, but the service and seating are HORRIBLE.  Tables for two are on top of each other.  I mean you have to pull the table out to get into the booth without having your ass knock over a drink on the table next to you.    The service is even worse.   With a tiny table the severs bring out your courses with no where to put the dishes. They just stand there and look at you, like you have to grab the plates from them and figure out how to fit everything on the table.  They run food without knowing what table ordered it.   Several times a runner brought a dish to our area and just yelled out its name..."spicy tuna roll" ...3 of the 6 tables that ordered it now have to figure out who gets it.    What is it with Asians and horrible serving/customer service?

msZMwOhzpGDwJLeEm_aGpw.text: I just found this restaurant by accident. These two young ladies Jessica and jada were nice enough to show me the menu and showed me some real popular sushi rolls that looked really yummy. The restaurant is very clean friendly and really hopping with people. I just wanted to say again Jessica and Jada were great and I was impressed with the service 5 Stars

aDtmesJWUjuubKyePmeG8g.text: First time here and I was expecting higher quality per previous reviews.   Service left quite a bit to be desired - staff didn't check on us, didn't have chopsticks, Soy sauce, or wasabi ready for is when we sat down     Food was below average,  but expecting it to be amazing. I would rather go to a fast service sushi place than return here again.   Save your time and money and go somewhere where the food is fantastic and staff take care of you.

Muxd21aXMgz0VsyHwHU2yg.text: We arrived around 7PM and the wait for a table was until 9PM so we sat at the bar. We weren't given a drink menu and had no idea about the variety of Japanese beers and sake they had. It was a guessing game. The waitress came to take our food orders and we had to ask about the drinks otherwise we wouldn't have been asked. The food came out before the drinks and I had to remind the waitress about the beer. I ordered the six piece sashimi which came with yellowtail, tuna and salmon, typical but fresh and delicious! I ordered one piece of $15.00 Otoro sushi which was delicious and fatty. I also ordered the Wagyu beef skewers tapas style which was delicious as well. I recommend this place for convenience.

UCdDFJa8RWW-SSgPeLKVNw.text: This place was really unreal  Best service around and the food was amazing. I can't say enough about Novi, she was great!!!

BNvlGXUmYQq6_rZrvTvWnA.text: OK fish in the desert.  Not as over-priced as other sushi restaurants on the LV Strip, Sekushi does a pretty good job. Nigiri sushi is priced by the piece ($5-$8 depending on the fish), instead of by the pair as in normal sushi establishments, and as a result you end up paying 2x for your nigiri. Rolls are $15+, and are "slimmer" than normal.  Fish quality is as one would expect in LV:  not straight from Tsukiji in Tokyo, but not spoiled either.  Service is friendly and efficient for the most part.  Although the waitress did forget to put in the order for one of our rolls, she remedied the situation quickly.  One drawback is there is only a limited selection of premium sakes and a few types of beer.  Locals would surely know of better sushi destinations in LV, but for visitors with a sushi craving Sekushi fits the bill.

MJ4_hSv9i4lR01htvHOYiQ.text: Miso Ramen was excellent!!! Was starving and looking for a place to eat, definitely made the right choice...

ILjeKq4q7pQv9sib7EXQRQ.text: I went back the following day; because, I really wanted to try Seksushi.  Holy cow, the food was AMAZING.  HUGE generous cuts of fish so fresh it melted into my mouth.  The Sake (salmon) and hotate (scallop) were out of this world.  I mean, some of the best I have ever had and the prices here are  unbeatable for being on the strip in the Paris.  The Aria roll was absolutely perfect in every way.    Service was great as well. Thank you Ji Hye K for being attentive and accurate.

aqqiJ4RPiLXjMsnr7rhA7w.text: The food here is great.. i had the sliced teriyaki chicken with noodles and sauteed onions. It was sooo delicious, located between ballys and paris, and is one of the only places i will be eating lunch, while here for a four day convention. The food is great, not heavy and super fresh... defenitely worth checking out

l10M-DNxRMHjjwtAM2fDuA.text: This was the first place we went to get dinner in Vegas... because I love Japanese food and it was highly rated with just two dollar signs on yelp. Im not sure how they got two dollar signs on yelp because one piece of uni was $8 before taxes... where in most places its usually about $6-$8 for two pieces. I went ahead and ordered it anyway because I love uni but as soon as I tasted it, it wasn't as good as the other places I normally go to.. you'd think for the price it would at least be comparable but it was far from it... and I dont remember seeing on the menu where they source their uni. I also ordered the Aria O - which was recommended by our original server, it's one of their more popular rolls... unfortunately, after almost waiting for two hours, it never came. The manager and our main server were very nice and kept on apologizing about the mishap - where half of our orders never came out even after almost two hours of waiting.  Me and my friends were hungry, upset and to add insult to injury - one of their male servers that handed us the tuna tartare gave us attitude. Im not sure if he was having a bad day or maybe he thought we were just a bunch of complainers but he should've seen/ known that his manager is already trying to do service recovery and he just made the whole experience from bad to worse after almost slamming that bowl of tuna tartare on our table and giving us so much attitude - we were a group of 6 girls and everyone saw and felt the attitude he gave us.  The manager ended up not charging us for the food that 3 of my friends got and offered to take care of us if we came back but most of us were traumatized with the experience and just opted out.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $8 uni nigiri - ONE PIECE!

kDQUW0oSeApzq5qn_zWEyw.text: I loved eating here. Novi had the most amazing energy and made it so not only did I enjoy the food but i actually forgot this was Vegas. Food was good but the service and attitude made it the best!

hQEdclnLYPml3vX2CdGcHA.text: Must stop when walking through Paris! Do not miss out! The staff is great and the food is amazing!)?)

_I2V7J5kIGcwH40HThSCkw.text: Oh MY GOODNESS!! What can I say about this place. It was AMAZING! Me and my girlfriend were walking around, looking for a place to eat at Paris. We saw this sushi place and decided to try it out. We were greeted right away and shown to our table. It looked busy but was suprised on how fast we were seated.   When we sat at our table, we had gotten our drinks right away. Our server then greeted us. Her name was CHIKA and she was really professional about her job. Greeted us and asked if we had any questions. She helped us on explaining the menu. Even though it was busy, she took time to make sure we had our questions answered. She explained the different types of sushi and her recommendation. We decided to order the avocado with salmon and cream cheese. IT WAS AMAZING. The flavors all complimented each other without over powering the taste of the sushi. We then orderd the  Cheese cake with green tea sauce, which was to die for.   While eating, our amazing and attractive waitress Chika made sure we had everything we ordered and was taken care of. If I was single, I would have asked her for her number. But I hope my girlfriend doesn't find this posting or I will have to go back and eat sushi while getting her number   Anyways, best service great tasting food. Will recommend others to try this place. Make sure you ask for Chika.

2Y85TrpkaF1RyOXJ7lOGQg.text: Ambience is good. Sushi is good. Service is good. It's all just... good. Ok. Not great. Not the best sushi meal I've had in Vegas. And I've certainly had better at hole-in-the-wall spots in the Bay Area. If it's all going to be this mediocre, I would expect it to be MUCH less expensive. $8 for ONE piece of sake nigiri?? $15 for a small house sake? This place was a whole lot of MEH.

Gave it a four stars experience because we stood waiting for a long time before the hostess who didn't acknowledge ask us. The food overall is fresh and delicious.
