UdVLJSwaLy2eQWGGb0F1ow.text: This was my least favorite Japanese restaurant ever. My husband is half Japanese and we live in Orange County and visit Diamond Bar often so we have a very good selection of Asian restaurants nearby.  We were seated quickly, the restaurant was not busy, but once we were seated a few groups walked in after us, and the server went to these groups first before checking with us. They don't seem to be assigned to tables so we were forgotten for several minutes, and about a minute away from walking out before the server came by.  We ordered a bento each and the tempura green beans. She brought us our waters and some Edamame a few minutes later, then the fun started.  I watched the tables adjacent to where we were sitting be brought dishes and the runner ask both tables if they ordered the thing he was holding. This didn't just happen once, it happened 4 times.   My bento was brought out before the starter, then after several minutes where we were sure they had forgotten we'd order it the starter showed up, and then a few more minutes for my husband's bento to be delivered to the wrong table before finding its way to him. By this point, my salmon was cold. The Miso soup that comes with the bento was served when my husband's bento arrived because they had to make it, and that was probably the best thing we were served. He also didn't receive his roll when the bento was delivered, that came another several minutes later.  The rolls included were very small, I'd assumed they were half but these were tiny compared to a normal piece from a roll, and the entire place is over priced. Don't order the green beans, they were very soft and needed at least a little salt. At $19 per bento, and considering they charge $20 and up per roll, this place could not be more overpriced for mediocre food and service.   Some of these issues I could understand if the restaurant has been busy when we came in, but it was not. To the point where several of the workers were standing by the bar while we were waiting for any one of them to just bring us water.  I don't think I've ever been to a place that was this bad at just getting the food to the right table. Don't come here, there are better places eat inside Paris.

h7-AifiK300bZmFGrjWgyQ.text: Excellent food and friendly service! I had the ramen noodles and really enjoyed them. The servers were really nice and helpful

I give it two stars for the service? The waiter was nice. Save your money and go buy a sushi roll from the grocery store, you'd probably be more Satisfied with that!

MprV2aLsuh5aRwj1AvNbbw.text: They offer you a free cheesecake if you give them a 5 star. I think that's how they get high ratings. Food tastes just okay, overpriced.  Not recommend.

sKhq2BfVc9Agg_cKfukQ1g.text: Very good sushi. Tuna was very fresh. We had the spicy tuna, the spider roll, and salmon roll. All three delious.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PCDg9rVtnvnNE35FffVh5A.text: It's situated in Paris close to the buffet.   The outside of the restaurant looks very attractive, open, and inviting for people walking by.  We made reservations on open table, came on Friday at lunch.  The menu is pretty broad, as it seems to share the restaurant with the ramen restaurant next door?  We got  Salmon Skin Maki - the rice was really mushy here, and the rolls were cut very thin.  It's clearly a 6 piece maki forcefully cut into 8 pieces.  Wasn't impressed with this one. $9.00  Aria Premium Roll - This roll was better with texture.  The little rice puffs on the outside of the roll gave it a nice crunch.  The jalapeno gave it a nice kick, and saucy enough for a single bite.   $19.00  Sashimi 12 pieces - The presentation for this was quite nice.  We got 6 different types of fish (2 pieces each).  The chef brought it over, and nobody explained what type of fish we got.  Just put it down and walked away.  So I'm just going to guess.  Salmon, Hamachi, Bluefin Tuna, Halibut, Some scaley white fish, Mackeral.  The cuts of fish were really thick and a great size, no complains there.  But the type of fish offered were not unique.   $39.00  Salmon Collar - This came fried and not grilled, which is weird, since they serve skewers??  The size of the salmon collar was pretty big.  It didn't come with any sauce like other Japanese restaurants would offer.  Just a fried salmon and a slice of lemon.  We asked for ponzu sauce, and they happily gave it, but this should come without someone asking.  It was meaty, and although it was fried and didn't have the smokey flavor, it wasn't too bad for the price  $5.00  Negihama Hand Roll - The handrolls came with a lot of filling and not too much rice, the nori is nice and crispy! MUCH better than their maki rolls!  $7.00  Negitoro Hand Roll - Buttery fatty tuna in a handroll with crispy nori.  This one was probably the best of all the dishes, although a little pricey for just a handroll, but you're eating in a hotel, I guess it sorta justifies $10.00  Total came out to about $60.00/person for lunch, it was pretty steep considering I didn't have anything special. They do give you a bowl of edamame on the house when you first sit down They also take total reward credits.  One of the reasons why I came, but didn't really feel like I ate anything special.  Maybe I need to sit at the bar and have the sushi chef make me something special.  The service was okay, always topping our water cups.    2.5 stars rounded up to 3.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 12 pieces Sashimi (nothing special)
Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. negitoro and negihama handrolls (very good)
Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Skin Maki (cut very thin and mushy rice)

xA74ZwiP7CUcBCqsrypqcA.text: When visiting Sekushi, everyone's attention needs to be directed to the creamy seafood udon. It's nickname is the "hangover cure" and I've never had anything quite like it. Although we did order other things at our table, only the creamy seafood udon stood out. 5 stars for the creamy udon, and 3 stars for everything else we ordered.   Make sure you get the creamy seafood udon, not the non creamy version. They really pile on the seafood and the soup is absolutely delicious. If you like clam chowder and udon noodles.. this is the dish for you! Unique and filling, I'd get this again in a heartbeat.

mlh5OCppdXj8Ij9zyxFqkA.text: Had an amazing time the servers amd chef were very kind taking my order i have to give a big shoutout to Nikko one of the sushi chef that prepared my food he was very nice and we had a good conversation the food is great I would love to say i will be back

SNFPoQUoGqexPBLwrOLh4w.text: I have been here three times over a few Las Vegas trips and keep forgetting to review! This restaurant is kind of split into two, and this review is for the left/sushi side. It's nestled in the Asian "aisle" of restaurants in the Paris hotel casino.   We've ordered lots of different sushi, and a few beers. We tend to always get a crunchy/spicy tuna type roll, salmon rolls, gyoza, edamame, and some tamago nigiri.  Their fish is always fresh, the rice is cooked properly, the rolls are substantial and (considering Vegas casino restaurant) affordable for what and where it is. You can pay a lot more for much lower quality food in Vegas so this place is a win for a satisfying (and fast) sit down meal that feels fresh and healthy. It really helps cut through the hangover and heaviness that Vegas vacations and buffets bring.   The service is great and attentive, and the rolls arrive fast. It's usually not crazy busy but my assumption is that the average American tourist doesn't gravitate to sushi, and we generally eat our meals on vacation in between peak hours to avoid lines.  Must try! And we'll be back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

T8Myz02yi6dWb-t-hN8_SA.text: My first time coming to eat at this place. Right when I sat down they took my drink order and left, then I kept getting asked like every 2 minutes "are you ready to order? Do you have questions?" And I kept saying "no I just need some time to look over the menu" I've been to a lot of sushi spots before so I understand the menu. After getting asked 4 times in such a small time span I just choose the rainbow roll and a salmon lover (not sure if it's called that but it was salmon on top and inside) along with some sashimi.   The fish is very fresh, that's what I like about this place. And I enjoyed the salmon lover roll as well but the rainbow roll I was not able to even finish it! It was VERY DRY! The crab that they used for the inside of the roll made it not have a good taste, it was very plain.   Once they hand you your order they just leave you alone, no water refills no nothing. Once I got the check I saw that the premium rolls (the salmon and rainbow roll) were more than $20+ PER ROLL!! I wasn't even able to read the menu so great because I was rushed by the employees. The rolls are not THAT great, I've had better for a lot cheaper and having better service.

lGSih3oqxM3zCQ5eLFZ0HQ.text: This place is very True to the Japanese aesthetic. The sake is great and the sushi is very authentic as well. If you're in Vegas and in the Bally's/Paris casino area then you should defiantly stop by. You won't be disappointed.

uxPPUCRc9WPUXeDFsVCo6g.text: Right in the middle of Paris, Sekushi is a really great mix of Asian foods. Sushi, ramen, pork buns, and a variety of meats are all on the menu and delicious. I had the Tonkatsu ramen with an extra egg and it was not only huge, but delicious as well. Free edamame started off the meal, followed by a pork bun, and then the ramen and I am stuffed and ready for bed! Good portion of noodles in the ramen and the egg was cooked perfect (I hate it when the yoke is over cooked).

8kWbsfJX52ZmT8xTwQEIiw.text: This place calls itself Japanese restaurant. First off the name would turn off any Japanese customers. The Name is Sexy Japanese Restaurant Now to the food  sashimi was so thick had to cut it with a knife. I don't think they know what a carpaccio is. All in all terrible.  Only good thing about the restaurant is the staff was good.

Overall-filling, delicious, and will be returning for more on my next trip to Vegas!

ufEtqG5yED_6SKIUn9IsQg.text: Sushi was good and lovely waitresses to help get you meal to you quickly. I was so ex it's that the Paris hotel has a sushi bar I I knew exactly where I wanted to have for dinner.  I tried out the tuna tartar for my appetizer. It came with a crunchy side. The tuna was good but kinda bland. It just wasn't memorable to me.   The surf and turf roll, which was tasty since I love truffle salt on top of the roll. I enjoyed this roll, and never had one like it before. The meat was cooked nicely.   After those two items I was still hungry so I added the negitoro roll. This was about as bland as the tuna tartar. So I closed out this meal which came in at $60. Ehh I wish I would have spent the money somewhere else.

JH0qSNyofEn1yCa25C0m4w.text: Wasn't sure about this place at first. I have high expectations for sushi/Japanese restaurants and especially in Vegas, which is overly commercialize, I wasn't sure if this place was good.   Order the omakase sushi (18 different sashimi course meal) and to my surprise, the fish was excellent. Not fishy at all.   My job takes me to a lot of places where the sushi is "fresh" so really didn't think this would live up to other places I've been too. Granted you can't get a live caught fish, but the fish served here makes it seem like it was just caught.   The omakase is $90 which for some may seem high, but you get the  cuts and types of fish that would normally cost a lot more. I would recommend this place to anyone visiting Vegas and the Paris Casino.   Nikko, who prepared the dish prepared it with precision and upmost care. It looked amazing. Not sure if my picture does it justice since I took one picture and then just dug into the food.  Not only was the food great but the service was excellent as well. No I was a great server. Never needed to ask for anything. She was there and brought things before I even had to ask!   Check this place out!

QvIxtofzhvrOEqsqw1zFdA.text: Staff was extremely helpful in explaining the menu and getting us sorted for food with our children. Great spot that allows you to eat at open tables with some delicious smelling Asian food even if your kids just want pizza down the way!

9VtKwqgYvpUV0sjszAlQBA.text: We were staying in Paris, wanted Japanese food, and discovered this downstairs. There aren't very many tables, so we had to reserve for 8:45pm. My family and I were pretty starving by then.  Aria O Roll ($19) - Mango inside was an interesting choice. I rarely eat sushi with sweet/fruity ingredients. The crunchy outer layer is definitely unique!  Chirashi Don ($22) - Yummy assortment of fish and fish eggs over rice. Too much rice, not enough fish!  (not creamy) Seafood Udon ($19) - My mom initially ordered the creamy seafood udon, but it turns out that the soup was super dense and cheesy. We sent it back asking for a seafood udon in a normal soup base (not on the menu), and they were super nice about.  Food is good but not amazing. And the price tag--yikes.

_H6Zbsuaa0qdgKSAUyuW8A.text: First time here.  The decor looks nice.  Luckily it was not busy when we arrived there.  Be careful when ordering off of the menu!  Since we assumed this place mostly served sushi, we thought the sashimi salmon and rice picture shown would be what we get.  Nope.  The salmon is actually grilled and not the raw sashimi salmon and white rice bowl we thought we had ordered.  I think the menu is so confusing and should be redone to reflect what the entree really is.  For example, show the grilled salmon with the rice instead of picturing it raw.  The whole salmon entree was not very good.  Skip the clear broth Seafood Udon bowl also.  It is very bland.  The scallop skewer appetizer was so tiny, I could not even tell they were scallops.  The Chirashi bowl (small) was very underwhelming as well.  There were barely any sashimi pieces with a bunch of rice underneath.  Overall, all of the items were extremely overpriced for small portions of mediocre taste.  Our group walked out of there disappointed and still hungry.

r8Ni5qNRi9ABnj39ZCuk2A.text: Loved it. Got in and we were hungry for an early dinner. Their happy hour stuff before 5 is a great price. We had multiple sushi rolls, sashimi, and several oyster shooters. All excellent. Our kids had sliders, also very good. We ate at the sushi bar, the chef there was excellent, obsessively clean in his station, and friendly to our chatty 9 year old son. Definitely recommended.

I ordered a glass of wine and shrimp tempura roll.  My friends ordered a few other dishes but I don't know what it was called.   Being that I do stay at the Paris from time to time, I'll possibly return.

5Tc1657TejFRED6aWYi-Kg.text: Came in last minute without a reservation. Still managed to seat us right away. Our waitress Wee was awesome. She gave us recommendations since it was our first time being here, she was attentive and extremely nice!  I always ordered the So-Mack tower, it was good but beware the Suju sits on top. Its plenty of drink. Still ordered another drink to help finish it. Other than that it was an awesome drink to try.  And if that is not suffice, there's a shot bar there also. Have fun!  Edit: sushi is amazing here. Doesn't matter what rolls you order, took some to go..

jjlwZw6IaYcB4hlN-lzeAg.text: This was very disappointing.   Went just last night for dinner. We got the bulgogi bento box, yellowtail/jalapeno roll, spicy tuna roll, waygu beef skewer, and scallop skewer. The rolls are a fair size, but pretty sure the jalapeno was just green pepper and it was big chunks with zero flavor or spice. The skewers were SUCH a waste! The scallop was 3 little halves; basically 1 1/4 of an actual scallop and nothing great. The wagyu beef was also quite lame. The bulgogi was barely cooked, super fatty and just not that great. It was sitting on top of a huge pile of shredded cabbage in some juice. Like when you don't fully cook the meat all the way through and it's still watery in the pan. I also didn't care for the ginger dressing on the salad which I normally love.    If you're looking to treat yourself on a nice dinner out in Vegas, go someplace else.

3zDE40138fQkzZJsp67iXA.text: This place is cool and the sushi is delicious! The decor is colorful, fun and modern...kind of like their sushi!   My boyfriend and I tried their Sekushi Rainbow rolls which has Alaskan King crab, tuna, salmon, yellowtail, shrimp, cucumber, avocado and wasabi tobiko ($22).   Next we ate the Surf and Turf rolls ($26) with seared wagyu beef, panko shrimp, avocado, black lava salt and truffle oil. The beef was warm and so yummy!  We finished off our meal with the Kimono rolls ($19) with spicy tuna, panko shrimp, avocado, crispy onion, and balsamic sesame. I enjoyed the crispness of the onion and panko shrimp inside the rolls.  All of these rolls were colorful, fresh, tasty and very easy to eat. The ratio of rice versus filling was perfect. The mix of different flavors and textures were amazing! These rolls looked as good as they tasted!  Overall, I found the rolls a bit pricey but I did recognize that these were high quality sushi rolls. They were refreshingly different! I definitely recommend this place!

5__wtdKo4xQykxPk4jIDVg.text: My husband and I went to this restaurant around 11PM on Memorial Day weekend.  It took a while to get someone to take our order. We ordered some yellowtail sushi, a spicy tuna roll, and a rainbow roll.   The spicy tuna and yellowtail were okay.  The rainbow roll was the diameter of my thumb and tasted like it was previously frozen.

Aria O roll - absolutely amazing. The masago is crunchy, the cilantro is amazing, the spice is just right! Oyster Shooter - probably the best I've ever had and I order it everywhere Spicy Garlic Edamame - this is seriously spicy!  (Too spicy for us) Surf N Turf roll - very, very good! Green Mussels - good, a little on the spicy side.  One constructive criticism...the servers should be mindful about reaching across in front of a patron...we had 3 different people reach across in front of us during our meal.

mVNOZtvetiUJgBjO8jOtFg.text: My boyfriend and I came here to get our sushi fix for our Vegas trip and we were unfortunately extremely disappointed. We ourselves work at a pretty well known sushi place in LA and for a sushi restaurant in Vegas with such high pricing and mediocre sushi, we had high hopes.   To be honest, the good probably outweighs the bad, but for a place that sells sushi, it leaned more toward bad for me. I'll start with the bad and end with the good.  CONS: If you want SUSHI, and I mean NIGIRI, do NOT come here. It would be a waste of a penny. It costs $5+ for just ONE piece where at most other sushi places, they charge you that much for 2 pieces.  Sushi had no presentation what-so-ever. No toppings. No options for toppings. Halibut was extremely plain without lemon and salt or ponzu or something. I received a scallop that was falling apart halfway.  Half the waiters looked like they were just there without really knowing the menu or really offering service. They took your order once and bye. They won't even pick up your plates without you asking them too. Really poor at sushi bar. Out of 4 waiters, 1 was attentive enough. Sorry I don't remember the name.  PROS: If you want satisfying ROLLS, give this place a shot. Their signature rolls were up to par and decently priced for being based in Vegas. I tried the Sakura roll and it was saucy and tasty all over.  (We also tried to Negitoro Cut Roll and it was average.)  Come here for the small plates and the cooked food. Judging from the menu, this place really likes its Wagyu, so plenty of Wagyu items here. Not easy on the wallet though. - Gyoza - was tasty and tasted how gyoza should taste. You can probably skip it though. - Sirloin Steak Steamed Bun - DELICIOUS. No more words for this but that. - Wagyu Sliders - Good but not all that.  Complimentary edamame when you start. Not bad.  Overall, this place is worth a shot but I don't think I'll be back anytime soon. I'd rather go to Katsuya or try another sushi place out. But if you're looking for some rolls or tapas, make your way here. Sushi? Nah.

sfAgWv1hN-a9wyqc9lLskQ.text: Wow. I recommend this place if you are looking for a legit sushi/nigiri/sashimi. I am from la and i have not tasted anything better than wht this place has to offer. Hostess jessica was really kind and helpful and sushiman nikko is an amazing talent. Super delicate and meticulous. Five stars hands down. Thank you jessica and nikko for amzaing experience.

QO5hqdeOxoMGqjdzaZVosQ.text: We had an amazing time at dinner tonight. Our table was very comfortable and the reservation was ready on time. The food was delicious and on point, we highly recommend the Kimono roll. Nui was our server and she did a great job, very courteous, efficient and friendly! We will definitely go back every time we come to Vegas!

3nCI3uei34ErpMaY54ssTQ.text: The ratings are extremely deceiving here. I ordered the creamy seafood udon while my friends ordered the ramen and a few rolls. I thought the udon was okay until I got sick later that evening. Ramen was also disappointing  as it was way too salty and the noodles were still stuck together when it was served to us... As for the rolls, these were okay but very pricy. To top it off, everyone in my party of six got sick after eating here.

Ch6mpkkmY2aAPcbV3sIMDg.text: Our first time here and it was better than expected. We had the wagyu beef tataki, sashimi salad, Japanese miso ramen, salmon bento and crunchy roll. They were all good and fresh. Will come back again because of the friendly service.

The creamy seafood udon i ordered, the sashimi plate, and the baked mussels were all excellent. The servers were attentive and the table they gave us both allowed us to have a relaxing dining experience.  We will definitely come back.

lE-qXompafzRj1s5CyNPlg.text: For someone that doesn't eat sushi, I really liked this place.  I'm always looking for sushi places with good non-sushi items so that I look forward to going and my wife can enjoy sushi.  Sekushi's Chicken Teriyaki Bento was great and filling.  It came with steamed rice, ginger dressing salad, miso soup and spicy tuna roll (or panko shrimp roll) and chicken teriyaki (of course).  Portions were surprisingly large and was a filling meal (something I'm not used to at Japanese restaurants).  Ordered: Edamame (complementary) Chicken Teriyaki Bento (miso soup, steamed white rice, ginger dressing salad, spicy tuna roll and chicken teriyaki) Aria O Roll (salmon, shrimp, avocado, mango, masago arare jalapeno, micro cilantro, honey truffle aioli)  Summary: I would recommend this place.  Just keep in mind that I'm not a sushi expert :)

I ordered yellow tail which is something I use as a benchmark for a sushi restaurant because the taste degrades really fast if it's not fresh... and they're yellow tail was very mediocre, Super fishy and bitter. Fresh yellow tail tastes like butter.  The rest of the food was good, but the fact that they charge double the price, for mediocre nigiri sushi really turned me off.  Their specialty roles were $20+ this place should be classified as "$$$", not "$$" with these prices, if that was the case and I wasn't caught off guard on a night I wasn't tying to drop a bill on dinner, I wouldn't be so upset.

LIA2SrCUaw96J1V4Nc0blw.text: I have made it a task to always try a new sushi restaurant every city I go! I believe I have found my 'must go to' sushi restaurant in las vegas. This place is not too big, not too crowded and easy to miss, seemingly unimportant but lord does it pack a HUGE punch!  I'm talking about Sekushi at the Paris Hotel in Las Vegas. Their staff is extremely friendly and sushi knowledgeable, the service is dead on, the sushi is as fresh as it comes, the presentation is to die for and the flavors will blow your mind!!!  Also, reasonably priced for it's remarkable quality. I've been to many "fine" sushi restaurants in Las Vegas that tripled the cost and didn't come anywhere close to this! So if you, like me, are a sushi fanatic and you find yourself in Vegas. Take a trip to Paris! LOL.

MxoRn9yJifRiPku4PI7v9Q.text: I was looking for a place to eat and used Yelp and found this place! They have only been open for 2 months but they have it together. Unique rolls and great sushi in Paris! Great service, helpful staff...yay!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesecake!

MI1PxZvJZFBNyRkRHnPeqw.text: The sushi was amazing!! And the panko shrimp bento is wonderful!! This will be my go to place every time I visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The sushi here is amazing!!! I had the panko shrimp bento as well it was wonderful!!!

Lgw87D7znqMeWV1-mounNA.text: Fresh food and great service. I enjoyed the rainbow roll and uni shooter  Yui is great :)

8Lejq8shXXkve8f7BlzDpQ.text: Poor service has been confirmed. The people are definitely nice but I'm not sure if they are short staffed or disorganized. We sat at the sushi bar after 2 pm and after a wave of conference attendees had left. The bar had five seated at the most including the two of us. Our drink order took over five minutes to be delivered and it didn't come with water. When we asked, the server came with one cup of water. I ordered a bento box, and they ended up bringing it separate from my wife's chirashi bowl, and giving it to the guy seated next to us. (He didn't realize it was not his until they delivered me his five minutes later with Bulgogi (I ordered Salmon).   Overall, the food was just okay. Quality is just as good as buffet sushi. So with the poor service, it's not worth returning.   (I don't know how it has 4.5 stars!)

ESLP-q8NOIGLska2PTCfYw.text: Overly hyped sushi place located at the Paris Casino. Let's begin by saying that the staff was not at all attentive nor was I given any adequate utensils until I asked for them. I as well had to ask for soy sauce after my food was delivered and that took a bit of time while my food stood there aimlessly waiting to be eaten.   Now the food. Well let me sum it up this way. Your local cheap sushi place will offer better quality sushi and overall a better experience. I don't and I mean DONT recommend eating here.

ew-UfQz_SxAPOSS7DzN-qQ.text: If you are a sushi person, this is not your place. I got the panko shrimp roll and it was literally only the shrimp and rice. No other filling. It was also ridiculously small and I was still hungry afterwards. I tried some of my husband's beef bulgogi and the meat itself had great flavor but the rice was kinda salty.

z9Nww4BV8llmfks-jf1LDg.text: Im not the best in yelping cuz i always forget to take pictures of my food, i devour it lol and then i tell myself " oh man i should of taken a picture! This was on the way to a night club at Paris casino and we were in for some sushi! So we came here and ordered very quickly and food came out soon after. The miso soup was on point and hot. We ordered the Aria O roll x2 and the baja crisp x 1. They were both good but the Aria O was the best. Definitely try it.

R-o_jbngt9JVFIYzoA9MFQ.text: Nancy.Nancy Nancy...! A True professional. Nothing but one great experience after another after another! I eat here four to five times a week. She always treats me like a king! The food is unreal, the sushi chefs are the best! It's all about the service and Nancy always comes through with a smile and delivering great food. Thank you Sekushi for being in my life.!

2FN1Pbo4Ot6Lz9JCwdjXNQ.text: Great sushi, cozy atmosphere and customer service! I love the kimono Roll and miso glazed sea bass.

fsOMb3WgMUc0ieowaiLKow.text: High quality fish prepared by a real sushi chef. No gimmick. Just quality. Yes, there can be improvements (miso soup was a tad bit salty, but mostly because they use a high quality miso or that the edamame was over blanched and lost vibrancy) but for Vegas, a city filled with profit-driven businesses, it's rare to find a business that is passion-centered, and certainly in my experience sekushi is a passion driven restaurant with quality sushi in a convenient location in the Paris hotel! Worth coming out to!  The foie gras sushi was foie-king great. The surf and turf was a textural delight, with different flavors noticeably exploding in a perfect linear sequence.  The nigiri was good. The Uni was Santa Barbara Uni of the highest quality. Perfectly shucked oysters with no sand, super fresh oceanic bursts of flavor, and topped with an umami-laced citrus ponzu.   Overall, stellar meal. Would love to dine again.

mH43vZm4EAGCHWSzruylXA.text: If you want Sushi in Vegas COME HERE!! The service is amazinggg! From Jessica greeting you at the front to Nikko dishing it up at the bar, I am sooo impressed! Food was outstanding and I would come back just to see it prepared in front of me.. Definitely exceeded expectations!

x01BNvLG4BUQ7QQ-ygjv0g.text: My wife and I just got back from a show. We were starving and had our minds set on a good steak. Being that is is my wife's first time in Vegas, every detail of our three night stay was planned. After finding out there was a 45 minute wait at 9 pm on a Saturday night, we decided to "settle" for sushi. Staying at the Paris, you plan on eating French or Italian food, be thought we'd give it a try as we enjoy some good seafood from time to time.   The seating was immediate, the drinks came quick. We wanted a table, but instead were reluctantly offered a seat at the sushi bar. What an experience! Nikko was preparing meat in front of us. To say the knife skills we a form of artwork would be an understatement. The level of conviction he had for every dish he made was outstanding. As we began to eat, he very respectfully began engaging in conversation. By the end of the meal, it felt we were friends. He was extremely personable yet remained professional and timely on his artwork of making 5 star sushi.   I simply cannot wait to eat here again. Mostly because of the time we had sitting at the bar and meeting Nikko! Make sure to take care of him because I happened  to offer him a job in Oregon. He kindly thanked me for the offer but said he was happy with the 6 years of being on the team.   I've eaten great food all over the country, and it takes the right experience to make that food taste great. You will not regret going out of your way to eat at the Sekushi.

4_WCn6kNfrxJWPBIwh_7VA.text: Don't waste your money! The sushi rolls are awful! The service is bad too!! Don't let the reviews fool you! Taste horrible..don't go! The best thing was the beer!

There's a happy hour on sushi from 3-5pm where sushi is only 3 dollars. Give this place a try. You definitely won't be disappointed by the food or the service!

_ypDdXGveXCF2ut_VozCQg.text: Food was exceptional. The sushi chef Nikko has so much flair and skills with his food. I didn't know what to order so I asked him to give me what he thinks is best. He amazed me with his food presentation and everything I ate was amazingly good. The service was quick and beautifully done. I sat on the outside of the sushi bar which is close to the main walkway of Paris and as people were passing by they saw the plates that was being handed to me and many people were turned on to eating here because of it. I definitely recommend this place not only because of the great sushi chef but even the hostess and other workers were very accommodating and refilled our drinks before i could look and ask for one. The staff is very friendly. I'll be back here again for sure!!!!  PS. I had to add this last part because I like how the management took the time to respond and thank me for my comment. It shows that they really have great customer care and appreciate the feedback. Again great staff, place and food!

jg0MaKJMvtIenwXmmd8rhQ.text: Really tasty Japanese food with authentic presentation. Melissa and Teresa were very helpful. Thanks!

4AgjPe87FiWl-vMYjPiwJA.text: 3.5 stars! This restaurant is located inside the Paris hotel and it took us awhile to find. It's located near the back of the casino and where all the restaurants are located at. We were seated at the sushi bar. It's a bit overpriced but what do you expect...it's at the middle of the Las Vegas strip.  I ordered the Japanese miso ramen ($18) and my friend ordered the Chirashi don ($22). We were given edamame to start off. The ramen broth was on the bland side and it didn't have that nice rich miso broth. I eat a lot of ramen in the Bay Area and had the best ramen in Japan, so you can say I'm a ramen snob. There were a few slices of chashu and half an egg, topped with bean sprouts and two pieces of seaweed. It was a decent size bowl size of ramen but the flavor just wasn't there.  The Chirashi don was a piece of art! There was a variety of raw fish on the bed of rice. The rice was a bit dry but the fish was fresh.   I also checked in on Yelp and I asked for the cheesecake. Unfortunately, they were out of the cheesecake but they had the green tea mochi. The mochi was filled with green tea ice cream and topped with some whipped cream. So remember to check in guys!

_NEM1GBbnbRfkBFTfofdXQ.text: This was a cute sushi place we encountered on our last night in Vegas. Its tucked away in the Paris hotel. We ordered a couple of rolls and the sushi was fresh and tasty. Recommend if you want something casual and craving sushi!

briFAPsQ84cTtnS__klHEw.text: The food was solid. We ordered sashimi and a couple of sushi rolls but there were plenty of options to choose from. Sashimi was fresh, well presented and really good. The sushi rolls were very good as well. The service was a bit slow for an early dinner and not on a busy day. Price is on a higher end but expected for a restaurant inside a casino. Recommend.

p6WWo9tn95ZkhzNRmbdJFw.text: Came to this sushi place for my sister's birthday. I wanted to take her somewhere nice. This was the worst 70 dollar meal I have ever had. The size of their sushi is pathetic. We were wowed. Sushi from gas stations is bigger. 10+ dollars for the smallest rolls I have ever seen. The quality of the fish was hit and miss. I understand Vegas is expensive, but I went thinking I'd gladly pay 75+ dollars for amazing sushi. The reviews are from people that know not what good sushi tastes like. Never again.  Grade: Oh Honey No

_BDUugow-daL_SajJGc3-w.text: Sekushi is by far one of the absolute best Sushi restaurants I have eaten at. I am giving this wonderful place a 5 star rating for the reasons listed as follows.   1. Ambiance. When you walk into Sekushi, you know immediately that you are in a well managed establishment and will receive only the best treatment. You are welcomed in by all members of the Sekushi team, seated in an area that best suits your personal needs, and the atmosphere around you can only be described as aesthetic. The restaurant is well lit, and far from dull as it is decorated with everything from neon lights to retro Japanese movie posters and kawaii anime eyes. Overall, a very trendy dining experience for people of any age.   2. Staff. The people are enthusiastic about what they do here. Not only do they greet you, but they say farewell and thank you on your way out. They staff is quick to deliver the food as well as make it, yet the food and service do not seemed rushed in the slightest. Every server seems to be well polished in their profession as they are light on their toes, friendly, bubbly and well mannered. The bussers are quick to clean the place up as well as they are kind to offer cleaning up anything that may be of hindrance on your table. The chefs are skilled in their stations as well, always ensuring that the food is well prepared and that their station is always sanitary.   3. The food. Everything in this establishment is extremely well prepared, and let me just say that you get what you pay for. My first time ever eating uni I tried here. The color was just as it is supposed to be; a bright light orange. In comparison to the other restaurant I ate it at afterwards, I was astounded to discover that this other place had given me the worst tasting food I had ever eaten in my life. After eating at Sekushi I  have learned what good sushi is supposed to taste like. The fish is fresh and colorful, the food is far from bland, and is a symphony for the taste buds. Everything from the appetizers, to the entrees, rolls, deserts and alcoholic beverages are up to par,  delectable and full of flavor.   Oh, and one more thing, Nevada locals park for free inside the Paris parking garage, which is a huge added bonus. No worrying about rushing your food down to get that cheaper parking ticket. :)

UuXw4-xAYaKSjEzTCx_f6g.text: This review is based on the robata section. I don't know if it's because we were there near closing but the food did not taste fresh. Instead it was over cooked and hard. The portions are small and expensive for what you get but it's expected since it's Vegas but I wouldn't mind if he quality of the food we're good. This was not the case. They did have a good buy one get one free sake special. Maybe the other two sections were better but I didn't get a chance to try it.

72VJBYsKlaPFLsEjcsqAAQ.text: This was the worst sushi place ever. I would spend lots of money on good sushi but this place had the smallest pieces of sushi I have ever seen? Their prices are off the wall and the sushi comes as one order, not in pairs of two (like usual). We have a waitress at the sushi bar? Weird. And what's even more hilarious they told us they had high quality sushi? Haha! The most disgusting place ever!

I have a shellfish allergy and sometimes struggle to find items on sushi menus that don't include shrimp but this place had lots of options. My husband and I were eating a very late dinner and wanted something light so we got miso soups, a spicy tuna roll, and a yellowtail roll. All were delicious. I would come here again.

2R9soCr6hOFY_qBvyzErlg.text: This restaurant has very nice service and atmosphere. Our server, Yui was very nice and attentive. As far as food goes, it is just OK, slightly too salty. We had chicken and beef bentos and they were good, while rice was slightly dry. However, I would go back.

KRJOPjX6M-idtlIiT_pTkg.text: First sushi restaurant I've been to in Vegas and was left wanting more. Without coming off as too pretentious here, both my fiance and I spent over a decade combined working in restaurants so we understand the workings of the service industry. We get that sometimes servers are overwhelmed or in the weeds with too many tables, etc... I felt that our server had plenty of time to talk with the fellow co-workers but never once checked on our table once the food was dropped off. This means that by the time she finally did come back and dropped the bill off we hadn't received two of the items we ordered. Unfortunately we never had time to communicate this with her prior to the bill arriving because she never stopped back. Of course once this was addressed they were then taken off our bill but no additional service recovery was taken. I'm not asking for hand outs, but if you forget not only 1 but 2 of the menu items a table has ordered you should probably make an effort to do something to prevent a review like this from happening. All of this being said, the fish was fantastic, albeit slightly overpriced but what isn't in Vegas. We were very pleased with our food but the service, or lack thereof, will drive people away from this place. The only thing saving this from being a 1 star review was the Uni sushi. Some of the best I've ever had and I'm a huge sucker for Uni

p2jmPKM7V2beYdZhMCNZpA.text: What a great find in the Paris Hotel. The food was fresh and delish. Shishito peppers were hot off the grill and very tasty. Lobster roll was beautiful and tasted even better the sauce was DE-vine -- just the right amount of kick. Wish I took a pic but I ate it too quick!  If you're on the strip and craving Japanese give this place a try. Definitely will be back when I'm in Vegas again.  Thank you to Yuri who was attentive and sweet. Thanks for a great meal.

Rd5-7isL9IknbWqBTnTwSw.text: We stopped here  with my little because he was craving sushi. Sushi was fresh and delicious. Service was amazing. Prices are not bad. We had the king crab California roll & spicy tuna both were very tasty.

EqwWm-TTN3RkYMa9XPeSNg.text: We had 2 rolls and some shishito peppers on a late weekday night. The peppers were very tasty!  The rolls were ok, kind of small but without a ton of rice which is always a plus. People watching here is great as well. Also, service was very good.

9xmtsYV6PIRs2odg2mamiw.text: 2.11.16: I was really craving for ramen thinking that they will have it here. Well they do have it but not at the time that we came. They have a late night that is different from their regular menu starting at 10pm. I was too lazy to go elsewhere so we stayed.   Located in Paris Hotel we sat near the front entrance. It was pretty quiet at 11pm. I guess everyone is out and about clubbing while I'm just hungry. I wanted something not too greasy so I opt to order their Rainbow Roll called Sekushi Rainbow. In this roll it's actually real crab, came with alaskan crab, tuna, salmon, and yellowtail as the protein. I order fresh wasabi on the side. To my surprise it didn't look like fresh wasabi. As wasbi is a root and if grated it would look like garlic consistency more than what we got. Maybe they mix it with other stuff? It was different and good.   It's hard to say I'm a fan here as I only ate one dish. For $22 I think it's priced pretty high for a roll. I rather have imitation crab meat lol.   Need a place that opens until 1am that is not fast food? This might be it.

X98dulor2KKYixe9pA6Ybw.text: While everything in vegas is expensive, the challenge is to get maximum value. Sekushi delivers. And it is not really expensive, the food was excellent, piping hot, the service fast and competent, and the hostess was fantastic. She was the deciding factor to try the reataurant. I am coming back.

AGhc2ogEX9GZpVUhdDqGqw.text: FOOD POISONING - Unfortunately, last night was our first night in Las Vegas and we felt like having sushi for dinner so we opted for Sekushi due to the great reviews. We ate around 9 pm, and it was great, until I woke up at 7 am exploding from both ends, shaking with the chills, and abdomen cramps all day. I had to go to urgent care (and spend 4.5 hours and $200) to get an iv to due not being able to keep any water down. It has been absolute HELL. I am beyond disappointed in this establishment. DO NOT ORDER ANY RAW FISH HERE! What I ordered:   King Cali handroll Unagi avocado handroll

n5UuTa4L0mYOSEhlxgAntw.text: I get why normal sushi eaters don't like this place...it's because the patrons here order cooked dishes versus sashimi or sushi rolls so I think that's why the restaurant doesn't up their sushi game. I got the seaweed salad and the rainbow roll. I could tell with the first bite that the dish wasn't as fresh as a roll from Whole Foods.  Service was attentive and I got my food very quickly. I probably wouldn't come back here unless you are starving (me at the time). Not a must stop sushi stop.

axLz7W5CAD8PH3C6dQpZFw.text: I've gone to many Japanese restaurants but their food quality is delicious The crab meat isn't drowned in mayonnaise and the roll isn't drowned in sauces. You can taste the flavor of the roll and enjoy the fresh ingredients  We ordered the king salmon and wagyu roll! Deeelliccious   When they first serve you they give you edamame~

aUXNGyX2z2P3l6R_NeInHQ.text: Hmmm, not a lot of sushi choices. I'm a big fan of salmon rolls and salmon, so I ended up getting the Aria O because that was the closest thing to salmon roll on the menu. It took awhile to get seated even though I was looking at some empty tables, but I ended up walking around and coming back. After we were seated, it took awhile for our server to come back to take our order. The table next to us was seated after us and I overheard the server tell them that they're out of plates and napkins? The sushi is expensive for what it is, and there were way too much things on their rolls.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon avocado roll. Horrible, 1/5.

MHMROGUpDhKK4ILnRfUD-g.text: I wanted to try the pan fried part of this restaurant the other day and was treated extremely rudely by all the staff members of the restaurant. Now this review is directed at the hostess and the 2 Asian girls working on the pan fried section of the restaurant. NOT the sushi part. They do however both fall under the Sekushi brand.  Any ways, I came down from my hotel room the other night and walked up to the hostess. She looked at me with a confused look as if she was wondering why I was standing in front of a restaurant.... I'm trying to eat, DUH???! Maybe she was judging me cuz I was alone idk.  She finally brought me to a seat and said the servers will be with me shortly. I kid you not, after sitting there for 10 minutes, not a single server came up to greet or offer me water. IT WAS LATE NIGHT AND THE RESTAURANT WAS NOT BUSY.   I saw the two Asian girl servers helping others and one of them disappeared after a while. The other one was busy counting some papers at the kitchen window (maybe her tips?) and basically I wasn't attended to.  After another 5 mins, I was fed up. I got up and told the hostess: nobody's helping me so I'm just going to leave. She did not make an attempt to stop me.  During that time, I did not know the sushi and pan fried section both fell under the same restaurant. I walked over to the sushi part and asked a server if I could just sit any where? She points at the same rude hostess in the front and said; ask her.   By then I was fed up and didn't bother giving this restaurant a single penny of my money. Disappointing service. I could care less if your food is beyond amazing... BAD service = BAD food.  I would highly recommend AVOIDING this restaurant. Go try YONG KANG ST next door- they are amazing and served me immediately. Y'all should change ur name to SH*TSUSHI.

9yokIv3CkI7F4PzqOq_OIg.text: We really, really liked this place! So much that my mom wanted to come twice during our stay in LV!   Let me start by saying The service was fantastic! When your drink would get low, they were on top of making sure to refill it. Everyone worked well together to make sure customers were treated great!   The food...YUM! Let's see in total during both trips we ordered the following: Miso Soup: probably the best miso soup I've had! We ordered seconds on this. So fresh, delicious and perfect start to a perfect meal!   King Cali roll & shrimp roll: didn't love the Cali roll but the shrimp roll didn't stand a chance! FYI they are super tiny rolls, so use this as an appetizer.   Beef bulgogi bento box: very very good! Well cooked beef slices, with large amounts! Flavor on point! Bento box comes with soup, salad, chicken egg roll and rice. I enjoyed this way too much!   Salmon bento box: Salmon had great flavor and was cooked well. My mom loved it!   Ebi don bowl: this is a rice bowl, with an over easy (extremely easy) egg, onions and shoyu sauce with 2 fried shrimp. I came on a Friday and couldn't eat meat, so I got this. Looking at it, I was disgusted because of the runny egg, but I mixed it up and gave it a try...and glad I did because I loved it. Had a perfect sweet flavor because of the sauce, extremely good and worth it! Just wish it had more shrimp.   Gyoza: the sauce made these soooo amazing! I let them soak up the juice before eating them and I still crave the wonderful flavor!

SYhUo8--M-b_HfvtGn844Q.text: So so quick which sometimes you need. Polite and nice staff. Fresh and good. Accommodated soy wrap and small roll slices with no issues. Delicious red bean ice cream like dessert.

NS2Z4pOboVV59ZYzSo31OQ.text: Great food. Very tasty. The only thing their white rice could be a little mushy ( coming from Hawaii it makes a difference )  but very worth the $$.  Great friendly service too

jj1GO1lxTz5BDPeBHibE7Q.text: OK, so I was in Sin City for a weekend R&R getaway and didn't want to load up on heavy buffet food. So I stopped in Sekushi at the Paris Hotel.   Short version: a very friendly and intimate Japanese restaurant with some of the best sushi I've ever eaten. However, have some patience with the kitchen - and a few of the dishes really need to be fixed because of their salt content, so be wary.   Long version: After winning a nice amount of money at the 21 table, I decided to splurge on my last afternoon in Las Vegas and enjoy some delicate Japanese food. So I parked myself at the sushi bar at Sekushi.  Sekushi reminds me of a "Shokudo"-style eatery: it's intimate, with about 10 tables or so, and a big sushi bar. Quite aesthetically pleasing to the eyes, it is located right off the elevators of the Paris Hotel.    Besides, I like the name of the place, even if John B. didn't in his review. Yeah, the name translates to "Sexy" - so what? It's catchy and fits in with the entire decadent concept of Las Vegas. If you have a problem with it, then it sounds like a personal issue to me. But I digress.   NOTE: If you check in on Yelp, you get a free flask of house sake, served either hot or cold according to your taste. That in itself was a big draw for me.   When you sit down, you are offered a complimentary bowl of edamame, or soybeans. They made a delicious and nutritious start to the lunch which was to come.   I decided to start out with sushi. I ordered a la carte-style servings of eel, octopus and shrimp. It came out in a reasonable amount of time (given the fact that the place was a bit packed), and the servings were nice and thick. Definitely A+ in my book! (Pic attached to show you the proof.)   Then I decided on a lunch bento box of chicken teriyaki. I had to wait a bit for it, which wasn't a big problem - I had loads of time until I had to leave. The staff was nice enough to tell me that it was on its way. Nice.   The bento box was HUGE - and I'm from Houston, where we specialize in big portions of food. Besides the entree and the rice, there were gyoza (fried dumplings), a salad and some tempura. WOW.   The breast of chicken teriyaki was succulent and rich, and the tempura was plentiful, delicate and tasty. So far, so good.   The salad, however, was a BIG disappointment. I don't know who made the salad dressing, but it tasted as if they dumped a cup of salt into it. I could only eat a few bites before I had to just give it up. YEEECH!!   The price was right for location and overhead - I paid about $30 for lunch, which was all of the above and two flasks of sake. Given the fact that you are in cost-conscious Las Vegas, it was definitely a better deal than the $30 prix-fixe lunch you would get at the hotel restaurant.   So - would I return? Definitely - if I had an hour or so to kill, because it is not a place where the food comes out quickly. However, I hope that the chef and the management look into the sodium content of some of these dishes, because this place just missed getting a Peter Hughes Five-Star Review. Sayonara!

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tasty Japanese sushi!

KRdsPZaXv2TtnHHyryR6ew.text: After the disappointment of Yong Kang earlier in the day, we hoped for better with a late night snack at Sekushi which is next door. Thrilled with this pick. We were seated at the bar immediately. Tables and banquettes are also available.   The resto was loud due in part to the proximity to the hallway and due in part to the lack of decorum and good etiquette demonstrated by the table of boors behind us. It's Vegas, and we've all tippled a bit over the line and been a bit too boisterous in the result. This was not that; it was extended shouting and cackling. I was surprised that neither the hostess nor the servers asked them to reign it in a bit.  The sashimi salad is a bargain at $14. Many big pieces of sashimi and plenty of tasty greens. The spider roll was delicious; $16 isn't unreasonable, but it's not the deal that the salad is. Large beer is $8.  A great spontaneous pick on this last-minute vacation! Maybe that's the secret to choosing restos - if you've been planning the trip awhile then carefully select a destination meal. If you fly away on the spur of the moment then dine on a whim!

2-pi3wsMtheZI7GWVNyEuQ.text: Wow! Is Seriously all I have to say from start to finish! Had the most welcoming experience ever from Chef Nikko Sitting at the sushi bar and totally just had him put on a show for us!!! Wow wow wow he exceeded our expectations on every level! Definitely can't wait to come back!   We started our conversation off by telling him that we have a sushi roll named after my wife in Chicago, told him the ingredients and he exceeded by every means! Best we've ever had!

K1KT654sBbTTcq3wVOK3tg.text: Great atmosphere, attentive staff but the food left me lacking. I got the sashimi bowl which was presented nicely but was lacking in flavor. It was basically lettuce, fish and 3 tomatoes that weren't very ripe. It could have just used some sesame seeds or even edamame or some crunch to spice it up. They do give you some edamame to start and those even needed some salt. The patrons next to me had some sushi that looked good and they seemed to be happy with, so it could have just been the salad that overwhelmingly.

YhLioOi0tLTEWmXZUt7rzg.text: This was a great place to get a Japanese meal! It's conveniently located inside the Paris hotel. I came with a group of 4, and we were seated immediately. We were given edamame as a starter. I checked in on yelp-and I was given a free house sake! Our server was awesome, shoutout to Lerma, and our meal was served promptly. My water was refilled without me having to ask, and she came to check up on us multiple times.   The spicy tuna roll and cucumber avocado roll were fresh and delicious. The teriyaki salmon bento was so good. The salmon was soft and flaky with a crispy skin. I loved that it came with a side salad, rice, and an egg roll.   I would definitely recommend giving this place a try if you're craving Japanese.

PQ5d26VdMGwg_lD6dxzdjw.text: If you're in the mood for some solid Japanese food but can't decide on what to eat, Sekushi is the perfect place for you. This place has everything from sushi and robata to bento and ramen, and everything is done surprisingly well.  I've read through some of the recent bad reviews of this pace and I think it comes down to one thing. Expectations. Sekushi is located in Paris Paris, next to the casino. Which basically means that it's not gonna be the most amazing sushi you've ever had, and it's gonna be a bit expensive.  What it does offer though, is a trendy little Japanese spot that delivers a variety of menu items, all executed pretty darn well. I wasn't blown away by the chirashi or any particular nigiri we ordered, but the fish quality was high and the cuts we're very satisfying. Even more satisfying was the fact that we could order a few sticks of yakitori as well as other small dishes, that were equally well prepared. The butter scallop skewers were as smokey and tender as any yakitori shop I've been to.  If you've been to an izakaya before, you know how hard it is to find a place that does everything well. Sekushi is like a trendy izakaya on steroids, because they have literally every Japanese dish you can imagine. Even some weird rice and noodle skillets that seem as authentic as that fake steak in their display.  Only in Vegas can you get a Japanese restaurant that caters to everyone and still does everything pretty well. I'd say that's worth paying a little extra for. If you want some great sushi, go to China Town. Come here if you just want to have a good time and enjoy some good eats.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Uni.
Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu beef skewer.

KWID-UdttU9uucxT29WUWg.text: Las Vegas is a crazy place when it comes to getting food. You can eat in one of the many restaurants locate on the strip, one of the many located off of the strip, or you can eat at a tiny restaurant located deep within the casinos and mini malls with some truly amazing food. We walked by Sekushi very early in the morning and thought it looked really good, so when lunch time came a little later we decided to head back over and give them a try. What caught my eye? The bulgogi beef with white rice and corn, it looked incredible in the picture and I was praying it would like equally as good when it was in front of me, and boy oh boy, IT DID! We were sitting at the little bar right in front of the grill so we we're able to basically watch them prepare our food and it truly looked amazing being made and when it was served to us. The meat was so flavourful and tender that it practically fell apart in my mouth, so good. The rice and corn was great as well and tasted very good mixed in with the juice from the bulgogi beef.   Overall, this little restaurant may of been the sleeper hit of my trip to Las Vegas. The food was amazing, the setting was wonderful, and the staff was friendly as well. Do yourself a favour and check this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Look at this masterpiece.

09MmjxU3DT8ciE6XzKO4zg.text: My friends and I visited Vegas for 4 days, and out of all our meals this one was probably the most disappointing.  We came in with 8 people. On average, we each probably spent around $25/person. The problem? After finishing our meals, almost none of us were actually full.  I had the chirashi bowl. The presentation was super cute and the sushi itself was good, but they only give you only one piece of each fish. At other places, I could get double the quantity and the same quality of fish for the same price or less. Proportionally, they also give way too much rice.  One of my friends did the skewer deal (I believe 5 for $25) and that was *especially* not filling for him.  We did appreciate the free house sake obtained via Yelp check-in -- they give a LOT per person. But unfortunately, it doesn't the negate the overall mediocre experience. Will likely not be returning.

Du1WYPpvXWVWdsYPG1gDlQ.text: The ramen is definitely not worth $20. I am not a fan of the ground pork on top of my soup.   The spoon I had was cracked and I felt it on my lip every bite. I specifically pointed out that the spoon I had was cracked, and politely asked for a new one. She brought me a second cracked spoon. How hard is it to find a decent utensil?   My girlfriend ordered some rolls. The first piece she picked up came with a long black hair. We pointed this out to our server who brought a manager to review. The manager brought it to the sushi chef to justify and he loudly claims "this is a woman's hair!" The hair was black and my girlfriend had just got her hair colored a week ago. But every waitress in the place had long black hair and he didn't accuse any of them.   I wish I had taken a photo of it before they removed it, but this was literally the first piece of sushi we were about to eat. After he embarrassed my girlfriend, the sushi chef aggressively asked "So what? You want another one?" Considering it was half her meal, she said yes.   The food is forgettable. The service was rude. Don't get Japanese in Paris.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My cracked spoon. And replacement cracked spoon. A place that charges $20 for a bowl of ramen can afford a few new utensils.

_Iq42-nl3iu4JUufHzyfTg.text: I came here for a snack (quite an expensive snack) when I wasn't too hungry but wanted something delicious to eat. They serve Foie gras relatively plainly here similar to just a piece of nigri sushi.   I give it 3 stars for having Foie gras at all and for the beautiful plating. The actual Foie gras wasn't the best I've had in that it wasn't the most flavorful. As I'm writing this, I remember the flavor being relatively bland and unseasoned. While foie gras is definitely able to stand on its own, sans excessive accoutrement, I do think that an Asian or Asian inspired sauce would've improved both dishes which are otherwise overwhelmingly tasteless and fatty.   Essentially, I got a few pieces of high end tuna nigri with small pieces of Foie gras on top, and then a plain piece of Foie gras. These are not shareable sizes if you're a fan of Foie gras, though you'll wish you had someone to share the cost of such plain dishes. In my opinion, more of a salty miso based sauce would've been appropriate for both dishes (not just plain soy sauce). My favorite combination at another local sushi restaurant, Sushi Roku, is the seared Foie gras with truffle miso sauce.   Absolutely beautiful plating, poor seating/atmosphere, and poor service.

zV_KS5ZeEgoast-BozUoug.text: I almost always trust yelp...and then this happened.  I wanted sushi and found this place to be close by (across from Cesars Palace) with good reviews. I was craving just protein post gym and went with the 12 piece sashimi $39. For this price I expected good sashimi, not great, but good. I got fridge sashimi. Sashimi that was too cold and tasteless. I was very disappointed.  The only good thing about this was the soy sauce.  Krissy K. got the skewers plate (also going for protein alone) and she got to choose any 5 skewers for $25: -Wagyu Steak, Butter scallop, grilled shrimp, JFC chicken and Korean Kalbi. I only tried the JFC chicken and it was good with a nice crispy sweet outer layer. The rest were not good where she even had to dip the beef in my soy sauce for taste; you will have to read her review.

wWLE3bXUreIiRV2BlGcnyw.text: I think this restaurant is a worthwhile stop if you are in the mood for some late night sushi.  There are MANY sushi restaurants along the Las Vegas strip so it took my husband and I a while to figure out which one we wanted to go to before the rest of our busy night.  We knew we wanted to be safe and make reservations and that we wanted to be close to the show we were going to afterwards.  After comparing reviews and prices of the many sushi joints we finally decided Sekushi was the winner.  Big PRO: the price.  Majority of the other sushi restaurants on the strip are $$$ and not that much better with reviews.  We figured we could save a couple bucks by heading here instead of another place that probably has the same quality of fish.  I would recommend getting reservations if you are on a fixed schedule like we were because they do not have a ton of seating at this location in Paris.  Sekushi gives off a "outdoor market/restaurant" vibe with limited seating and some oddly shaped chairs/tables.  When we first arrived there was not many people there but about halfway through our dinner the place filled up quick.    We ordered: -pork belly appetizer -King Cali Roll  -Salmon skin roll -Yakuza special roll -Sekushi sashimi 6 piece entree  The pork belly appetizer was very BLAH but I loved the other choices we ordered.  The sashimi was extremely fresh; some of the freshest sashimi pieces I have ever had.  The salmon skin was interesting because it was the first time I have seen a chef actually leave a very small amount of cooked salmon on the skin.  Usually it is all crunch but it was a very nice added flavor having some of the smoked salmon still attached.  The king cali roll was very large but not too much that it annoyed me when shoving it in my mouth.  I love eel so the Yakuza was delish but I could have done without the panko on the shrimp.  Definitely give this place a try especially if you are staying in Paris.

DUVln1h7xHPwQb2ZX-uekQ.text: Came here with a large party and waited about 10 minutes, which isn't bad considering how small this place is. We split our group into two since they couldn't accommodate to such a large party, which was fine with us. For my table we ordered an assortment of skewers to try, such as the beef, pork belly, shrimp, and some other items I can't remember at the moment. I ordered the pork belly kimchi sizzling plate & a negitoro cut roll to share with the table. My bf ordered the Kimono roll for us to share as well.  The Kimchi sizzling plate was good in my opinion, it came with a generous portion of pork and a free topping, which I choose the fried egg. It was filling and piping hot throughout my meal. The negitoro was also very good. The skewers were just okay, not sure I would order them again for that price. The Kimono roll was standard, nothing too special. Definitely had a kick to it though. Overall this place was good & I would eat here again.

0nClb8TrJfO1axVDZyp-8A.text: The quality of sashimi is great, the chefs cut you thick juicy pieces rather than stingy small pieces of sashimi that doesn't even get you full. If you are one of those people that like carpaccios or tiraditos with thinly sliced pieces of sashimi, I wouldn't recommend this place to you. They give you your money's worth, especially if you're eating on the strip. The only thing I didn't really enjoy were the Robata grill skewers, a bit on the dry side, especially the scallops or clams (maybe they were clams).   Sushi isn't all that they have. It's a corporate restaurant, if you're strolling through Paris and want Asian food, stop here. There's Chinese and Japanese. The staff and chefs are very, I mean very non-robotic, they have personality.

iHfR1SJwVs2fKK4k8MOE9w.text: Came here for the first time , their service is really good, so are the food. I really love their green mussels, spicy tuna handroll, surf n turf and kumamoto oysters!! Those are the MUST TRY food!!! I'm glad they satisfied my hunger'! :D

Ucx3nvidKigClhMcBVZtoA.text: While spending a long weekend in Las Vegas, my daughter and her friend were craving crepes and I wanted sushi, so I grabbed a roll to go from Sekushi.  The hostess was very nice and took my order for a Rainbow Roll ($22) and a green salad.  Being gluten-free, she told me that the chef could make me a GF salad dressing for my salad.  She also told me that the Rainbow Roll was a large roll, which I was happy to hear given the $22 price tag.  When I got my food, I carried it over to the the table where my daughter was and upon opening it, could not believe how tiny the Rainbow Roll was!  6 tiny pieces in a tiny container.  It also lacked much flavor.  The salad was just spinach & lettuce leaves, nothing else, and the dressing that the chef made for me was pretty much just GF soy sauce with a little ginger in it.  Such a disappointing & expensive meal, for what I got!!!

8oVwxUJLFicG2UaKwn8_Hg.text: It was delicious! The miso soup and seaweed salad did not disappoint. My fiance got a sushi combo with seven different nigiri. His favorite was the pacific snapper. I got a chicken teriyaki bento box. The chicken was very flavorful. We'll definitely be back next time we visit Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KqBsYcYL-94P4NXZFrL_zw.text: I'm truly shocked this place has more than 1 star. This is hands down the worst excuse for sushi I have ever eaten in my life. The salmon skin roll was smothered in eel sauce, and the salmon eggs had a fishy odor. Nothing was fresh, nor was it prepared properly. The service wasn't great. Please don't go here.

uEdcN82zcfN_JKPzVOdXTg.text: If your lucky enough, Nikko will be your chef. We sat at the bar and he took great care of us! Definitely gonna stop by next time I'm in Vegas!!!

J28OS-8SH7i61vthKyPbzQ.text: I loved this spot between Paris and Balleys Fresh food really quick service and extremely nice servers and cooks! Check it out soon

PLSeVp5nkSjeseCmrlrbzw.text: Great spot, amazing rolls. They also have gluten-free soy sauce; awesome option for a lot of people out there I'd imagine. Best sushi I've had in quite a while.

hEV2rjCkBfQIe3uRqXWemg.text: Aria O and Baja Crunchy rolls are so delicious - a perfect balance of flavors. Prompt and happy customer service.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baja Crunchy Roll
Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baja Crunchy Roll - perfect balance of flavors with a crispy outer layer. Very prompt, happy customer service.

EzPGxM-aisM9aPEqp6qv-Q.text: Amazing!  Nikki and Tuan did the damn thing!  Amazing food great service!  I don't eat sushi but I do now!  Go here!

H8MRKBc5U2vSkvzeeh4HBA.text: My husband and I came to this restaurant for my 30th birthday, and it did not disappoint!  The tuna, salmon, octopus, yellowtail and hamachi Kama were some of the best we have ever had! This was a great place with fresh sushi and great service. You can't go wrong here!

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

q98fc39pBGFOKooVAEWOTw.text: Really great option for some authentic food. The skewers were a bit small but overall the food was excellent. Meat was all tasty, tofu was really good. Great little option if you are looking for something different.

9tTRr3Vnm_JW9RUb-71R6w.text: This place has really really fresh raw fish. It is so awesome. It is not overly price like other places in Vegas. Our server is Yui , she is super nice and helpful.
