Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These are super fresh...

flPSohwCxnUAqtFoy3UUWg.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our meal here. We tried 3 sushi rolls. All were good but the two I would recommend would be the Surf n Turf and the Aria O. Service was great!

gG6clBtgFGDnFyfBAuZ7mA.text: Yuck, nothing to recommend this place.  Service sucked we ask 5 times for ponzu sauce, finally received it when we asked the manager.  Had to send one roll back because it tasted off.

5ekK3XESJj1d_jf4W-NN-g.text: Doesn't do deep fried after 10pm, uneven rolls, sushi/sashimi extremely expensive charged by piece, underserved, barely serve wasabi and charge $3 for extra (ridiculous), didn't inform tea is per person and charged extra.

D398Y5zGouOsRCi6KFFJ8Q.text: Seafood udon tastes very good. The soup base is like almost like uni soup. Very good taste. We also got the chirashi bowl. I recommend this place.

hHbHbb2sVxYcNhGPCR0BGw.text: Yui was a great server, but the dishes were a bit expensive. It was a delightful experience having a sit down  restaurant at the strip serving sushi.. thank sekushi!!

3D1ckOADeH-Ixoilijt0eg.text: The chicken teriyaki bento box was good and everyone in my group liked the Sushi. Also received good fast service for a quick stop while walking around the strip.

7NbCzUFWEncssHqus8bR7g.text: We had a great time. Our waitress Melissa did a wonderful job. The food was great. I had the Bulgogi beef bento. We also tried the Panko shrimp roll and the King Salmon Roll. Our orders came out quick. The music was good. We where there to celebrate our friends birthdays. Will come back again. They where able to accommodate our party with separate checks. Will definitely recommend this place.

V1a1ar05W_pIYqVdLyUloA.text: Very good food.  Came out fast and accurate. I recommend this restaurant. 1st time here, definitely will be back when I'm in town. Melissa took great care of us. And surprisingly not expensive for Vegas.

YQeBS_kbJ3poFM3MIeMdWQ.text: The food is excellent! The service was a little slow the night I went, but it was a busy time so that could be why.

sA2PC-84t_so60tLiFV5rQ.text: I was on a weekend trip with my girlfriends and we stayed at the Paris Hotel. We were so excited to come to this restaurant inside the hotel once we seen their menu outside. They had many unique menu options and hard to find items such as blue fin tuna. We tried the uni shooters, oysters, blue fin tuna sashimi, tuna belly roll, and sea bass. Every single item was amazing. We even had their chocolate cake for dessert which was given to us complimentary by the most gracious host. The staff was so attentive. The host was receptive and personable and didn't mind the questions we asked about the locations the food came from. We would definitely come back when we return!!!!

FhNeBw-UUc9GAOiEGK4MyA.text: What a great little Japanese restaurant! The bento boxes are fantastic and the service is excellent. We stopped by for a quick meal and were so pleased that we will be eating there again tomorrow. You won't be disappointed dining here.

RCpMuGvIZQlUQo2sy61nzQ.text: this place is a little expensive, but the food is delicious. it was also a little difficult to find - you have to go in the main entrance of Paris LV then wind your way to toward the back of the hotel to find the restaurant. but it was well worth it - decor, music, and staff were all awesome!

_ILTZPkWcqodt08MBt3rzA.text: I had a great experience, no wait, they served the food right away, sushi was fresh. Excellent service!!!

AJZABSP70WWeBB6GutLwUQ.text: What a great place to have fresh sushi. Our waitress Jane was awesome, so was Matt. Thanks for the great food and service.

uWs06e-VrVZUVnlASGuYHQ.text: We wanted something that would be light before going out. Stopped in for some sushi, plus appetizer. Had grilled butter scallops, tried eel and avocado roll, the yellowtail with jalapeno. Also tried Krispy Baja. All were great. Service was great. Must stop if your a sushi lover.

2OiNuEJ5hpmBNSth57IGEA.text: I've never had an oyster shot before and normally hate saki.  This was DELICIOUS!   I want another!!!   The food was also delicious and very fresh.   The sushi rolls were great - some original.  They really do a great job.

RQEW2eCHyy_mt4HwaHFnmA.text: Service was great. Melissa, our waitress,  was super nice. I don't eat sushi so I got the teriyaki chicken. My boyfriend got the spicy tuna, aria o, and the salmon avocado rolls. He really enjoyed it and it's definitely a spot to visit every time we're in Vegas.

8c6lTbu3Ntyxw25yI0eBRg.text: The food were ok. Their salad was alittle salty for me. Melissa was our waitress and she was super nice and an excelent waitress!

zu87e_-zEcelxQ10zNZAbg.text: good food, reasonably priced for the area and served Yui was lovely and helpful :) also great cheesecake!

bbeu6YPPjpE3FG0TixfrLw.text: Wow!!!! What an amazing place to eat at .  We stayed  at Paris hotel a couple of weeks ago , and just happened to walk by this awesome place  before going to see Jennifer Lopez at Planet Hollywood.  We didn't have dinner reservations so we found 3 seats at the sushi bar.  Everything was incredible ! We ordered the salmon rolls , the crab roll and the spicy tuna rolls and the volcano roll which is hot and deep fried on the outside. I've eaten a lot of sushi in my life and I have to admit this was the very best I have ever had . Not only is the food awesome but the service was outstanding . Our server was excellent , her name was Chika .  She was so attentive and nice . We had a great time watching  Tuan, our sushi chef in front of us making the most amazing sushi just like he was making a work of art . What more can I say . We loved that place and will definitely go there again the next time we are in Vegas . Thanks to Chika and Tuan for giving us a great experience and a delicious dinner!!!!!!!!

oLJRe-djnXDie73scUCNcw.text: Thank god Paris got a quality sushi spot!! This place just opened and it has amazing food without being overly fancy. The shishito peppers, lobster roll and the sea bass are absolutely must orders! If you want to splurge the Uni and the Toro are amazing quality and worth the cost.

yEPTg_FqGr7c4DwaRUEZYA.text: Great food & nice environment. Service is excellent! Recommendation on point! If you like sushi great place to try out!

Mf2loCD_Mw4LWjsmgrROnA.text: Great food, great service.. definitely enjoyed the saki and appetizers..if I could give this place 6 stars I would just because of Naomi!!

xlJ3o4TYZMdLc9lmqxknig.text: This is a great place for a quick bite. I ordered the salmon avocado roll and the salmon portions were really generous. We got edamame on the house which was a nice touch. It's a really great value, especially compared to other restaurants in Paris, and the service was quick and friendly. Yui was our waitress and she was great!

gX7fzhvsURMYYJE8r74zpw.text: Amazing bento boxes. Super friendly staff and the sushi looked really yummy. Will be wanting to come here again.

ROp0fPbUjZvlO3OpeU8Cxw.text: Very solid sushi spot in Paris Las Vegas. Nothing fancy, but perfect for a quick bite. Service is quick and expedient, the fish is fresh, and the rolls are well-crafted. The restaurant is conveniently located right across from the hotel elevators, so it's easy to hop in and out at any time of day.

JrYrlLMFKcdDM5tlVX_LyQ.text: Food was yummy. Nice service --- they took care of my annoying children when they spilled water on the floor. Not really the best place to take kids....our bad.  Loved the Ario O role. The pork katsu and teriyaki chicken bento for the kids were much better than typical sushi places. Salad dressing and soy sauce were a bit too salty.

A-8CEAcuFryZMh98BB2Mag.text: OMG!!!  OMG!!!  Wow! What a wonderful find!  Located in the walkway between the Paris hotel and Ballys. Amazing Lychee sake! Amazing spicy tuna hand rolls! So wonderful! Great food, great service!  And the freshest sushi I've had in mind years! Yui was our waitress and oh my goodness, what a sweetie!  10's across the board!

PGKFxOozb1MqIHL-s-jH3Q.text: We ordered the $29 sushi assortment plate and it was a good value and very fresh. The wait staff was very pleasant (Yui was great) and worked with our dietary restrictions (no mayo can be tough when trying to order rolls). Casual and didn't have to wait very long for our good. Upbeat music and atmosphere.

SnnVob87uE2Bj7zToC4wbw.text: A great hidden gem inside the Paris resort, a great selection and good quality for any late night cravings. Sushi, bento, ramen, and udon can't go wrong.

dqrSXkvk9Gtc31W08nmZww.text: Got the Uni Don. First time in my life trying it and it was delicious. Fun environment and great service.

h1yKdDsTjOoAksO36rgfFQ.text: We went today around 3pm for sushi happy hour! They have $5.00 appetizers that were fantastic. We got an assortment of appetizers with the Goyza dumplings. I had the Tiger beer which was very lite,similar to a Sapporo. Great addition in the Paris!

M6b0HxgyUU0XOAoEslNWAw.text: I can't say enough good things about this restraunt. I ordered the Yakuza roll so Gooooood and they have 2 for 1 house sake can't beet that. And the bartender hostesses and severs were all so nice and attentive great cutomer service.

C2pIukG1YDeAtH3DMNdr0g.text: Great little restaurant.  Yummy sushi and great service.  Yui was a great server and we love the Aria O roll.

ggdPsA3korvxuL1oIiaqNQ.text: We ate at the new skillet section and it was fun and delicious! We got appetizer skewers first.  I highly recommend the sea bass! I got the salmon skillet with rice. It comes on a very hot skillet wth raw salmon around the edge and the rice piled high in the middle. There is a paper wall around the skillet so tou don't burn yourself  as you start mixing everything together as it cooks in front of you. It was fresh and cooked perfectly with lots of crispy bits on the bottom. A great and delicious experience!

0pDUg919qswU2Ep_rc9POA.text: Pretty good sushi, very fresh seafood.  The yellowtail was amazing.  Aria o roll was a huge hit.  The prices are consistent with the restaurants in the area, so make sure you bring your wallet.  We were disappointed that they ran out of both the chocolate cake and the cheesecake.

-7_wO3Qf1rsZSIoK4SFf-w.text: Good food and good service. Grilled Seabass, miso soup, Yellowtail, Salmon...... yummy

sjByD-XUei2CT-bqGYtO3Q.text: First visit to this little Sushi joint at Paris hotel. Very good food, fresh sushi and great service. Price is reasonable and affordable for being in a hotel/casino environment. If you are looking for good sushi and want to stay within the strip,  this is the place to go!

q8pdyNbUIX7DV9RbguqIiA.text: We stuck to nigiri and hand rolls and had a great time. The nigiri were large for the price and tasted great. They also have some interesting items on the menu like foie gras sushi which was really good. Prices are what you would expect for Vegas but we enjoyed all of it, would eat here again.

AL9wpcKH8vzv2EpO2EXxdg.text: I wouldn't expect fantastic sushi in the middle of the Nevada desert, but here it is! All four of us were very pleasantly surprised with the quality of the food, and the service was excellent! I'd come back for sure next time!

989jMbrGb9wzjMP01v8O6g.text: The girl at the front was super hospitable and helpful for choosing our take out sushi! Everything was delicious and we will be back tomorrow for more!

x8i1pH1dCND507LCHChxKA.text: We returned to Sekushi for lunch several times during our stay. It is a nice atmosphere, the service is efficient and friendly. Sushi quality was great, I don't understand some of the negative reviews here. Sushi is not a cheap meal, and prices were about what I would expect. I took a photo of our lunch including a very beautiful quail egg.

XOX1PqeK013pTe_KRyGqGQ.text: Best decision we made during this trip was to eat at Sekushi Restaurant.  This place is inside the Paris Hotel and Casino, in the walkway just past the gift shop and room elevators.  We sat at the sushi bar and were given menus from this restaurant and the Chinese place next door.  So we had wine and a lobster roll and then shared a Chinese dish.  We absolutely LOVED the freshly made lobster roll -- best we have EVER had.  It was pricey ($20) but definitely worth it.  Nice, generous size roll.  The service was outstanding and quick, even though they were busy.  This will likely be our new favorite stop.

CyrR_SzZDqPj0yg_LF37JA.text: Sekushi was a really fun sushi joint inside the Paris hotel. I absolutley loved the decor and music choice - it felt more like a club or a local joint, than a restaurant inside a casino.  We made reservations for 730 and enjoyed a variety of food. I ordered: - Pork Gyoza: delicious! and beautifully presented with a flower - Salmon Nigiri: incredible, fresh and delicious. The salmon was so tender it melted in my mouth - Kimono Roll (spicy tuna, panko shrimp, avocado, cucumber, balsamic sesame and crispy onion straw) - I didnt really enjoy this roll. The crispy onion on top was almost like hard oatmeal flakes? - it tasted flavorless and was TOO crunchy - to the point of being annoying/painful. It completely brought down the meal for me.  My friend ordered the Chicken Teriyaki Bento Box. I had her Miso Soup and some of the fried rice - tasty staples.  I also used the Yelp Check-In offer for the free Cheescake or Devil's Pie -- but recieved Mango Mochi instead (they were out of the other two options). Yum! Cool and refreshing.  Also, I'd rank this as more of a $$$ than a  $$ establishment, as most of the options are $10-20 EACH. And unless you only have one sushi roll or two pieces (pieces, not orders), your tab is going to be higher. My final bill was $52.  I don't know that given all of the other Sushi options in Vegas, that I would return, but I can't say I had a bad experience, so I will give this 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango Mochi!
Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kimono Roll
Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome decor/art

dW81_CMIvnCz3KAiGDkKDw.text: Fast and friendly service!! The menu is loaded with options, so I will be back before I leave! Because the food was amazing! This is a must stop if you are in the Paris hotel!

8i_uNT0q7ufNML_nR43e9A.text: Love it here. Was spending a month working in Vegas and must have eaten here a dozen times. I am very snobby about sushi since Los Angeles has great places and was skeptical but I have to say, the sushi here is as fresh and good as anything I've eaten in Ventura Blvd. It is amazing. The staff is always nice and accommodating. Happy to know this place exists and recommend to anything that wants great sushi.

Z4DCKdluOcJ5L2URqKgVCw.text: One of the worst sushi place I've had....  Located at Paris Hotel, Sekushi is an adorable Japanese sushi bar. Too bad the food wasn't good.  Chirashi don ($22.00): my sashimi had 3 little bones. Not one. Not two. Three tiny bones! I found the first bone inside my sashimi and showed it to my waitress. One minute later I found another one. The slices were very stringy too.  Salmon bento ($19.00): better than my chirashi don. It's sad when you get better cooked food than raw fish at a sushi bar.   FREE CHEESECAKE OR DEVILS PIE WITH YELP CHECK-IN.   Our waitress was very nice, apologetic and comped our meal. That was the first time I was speechless when someone apologized to me. I couldn't even say it's ok. I felt bad for her, but I was very upset.   2 stars!!  Sekushi Japanese Restaurant is not yummylicious!!

4_XDkwHukZdjXCM-KUNR4w.text: We were wandering through the Paris hotel looking for something to eat. We stumbled upon Sekushi and couldn't get past the menu. They have a special of 5 protein skewers for $25. We wanted a variety so we got the grilled shrimp, garlic scallops, waygu beef, Korean kalbi and teriyaki chicken. The presentation was beautiful. They laid out the skewers with a flower and designed it so nicely. All of them were really good. The scallops were my favorite. The only complaint I have is how small they were. The shrimp were the size of popcorn shrimp. Each portion was super tiny. Otherwise, I would say this is a great deal for the price and location.

nheSgdrzt89T4dvgKV0RWw.text: The sushi was so fresh and the staff was friendly. Definitely worth it. The broth of the Ramen was kinda of cold, but they have a variety of choices for seafood. Highly recommend the oyster and uni.

ukFxxVeD3YMV18IxmB_jzw.text: Stopped in last night for a quick drink before heading out for dinner with colleagues. Enjoyed a very unique Oyster Shooter w/quail egg.   Really wanted to try the food after seeing the fish behind the counter.    Came back next night and was treated to edamame to accompany my saki bomb and oyster shooter. Followed up with very fresh and filling yellowtail jalapeno and salmon avocado rolls. Ended the night with a a satisfying slice of matcha cheesecake. Thanks corporate card and Sekushi for a great meal   Hopefully you get Novi as your server. She is awesome.  Kampai

In the last 2 days I have been here 2 times one for food and one for just drinks. As well the aesthetics make it feel like Japan. They have authentic sake barrels inside which just enhances the hole experience.

l-90TZCrcOU0qq_RG7qeRQ.text: Yelpers! You seriously let me down. Almost as much as this place did tonight.  Ordered three rolls and all of them were gross.  I know good sushi.  I know great sushi.  I know awesome sushi. And this place didn't deliver any of those tonight.  I'm now in back in my hotel room thanking the heavens that I have a bag of  prepackaged caramel popcorn. Yeah, the sushi was that bad.    I just hope I don't wake up in the middle of the night.  Because you know...

mMDVf0HJGbvfTUDR9jJd8g.text: The worst Chicken Teriyaki and Tempura I have ever had. The Tempura was thick and greasy and the chicken consisted of thick, tough overcooked strips of chicken with a nasty Teriyaki paste thrown on it.  I ordered the chicken teriyaki bento box the salad was dry with a nasty dressing thrown on it, the eggroll tasted like it was frozen and put in a microwave.  It's just very bad Japanese fast food

Det9n6Og0hlvP8qJoBOE6A.text: Came here 2 times during my stay: First for shots or etoH & second time for food.   Drink: have very affordable shots/drinks Sake bombs: Green tea shot: must try Jamakazie: Oyster shooter with quail egg: in ponzu and same - I'm a sipper so didn't care too much for it.  Hot sake: good flavor -hubby finished the whole thing.   Food: Uni over rice: first time trying. I'll eat it but not sure I will order.  Spider roll: yes. Plenty of soft shell crab there.  Creamy seafood udon: filled with seafood and comes in a large bowl good for 2 people. Not much flavor but the creaminess. It said good for hangover but I don't know. I wanted a savory broth.   Decent food and drinks. Conveniently located by the guest elevators

ohKSlDGhKpoabgOmVDGVSw.text: We came to the shot bar. Just for some quick shots. It took 1 hour to order 3 shots each.  They were nice. But slowest workers.   They also said I had a counterfeit $100 bill. It wasn't. Literally just got it from the bank and it was fine.

RDYXyslMHxfTsQvAoc43Jw.text: I'm sad to say I was disappointed  with the food at Sekushi. The fish was cut thicker than I typically prefer and honestly it was a little "fishy" tasting, which for high quality maguro and toro, should not be the case.   Their sizzling entrees smelled delicious and this is probably the best option when coming to dine at Sekushi.   The service, however, was fantastic. The waitresses are very friendly and they made my experience at Sekushi great.

0_HYjdtlUKQDd3U0IX2D5Q.text: TLDR: use the yelp check in for free sake!! The ramen has more value than the actual sushi   My friends and I stopped by to grab a quick light bite to eat before heading out to clubs for the night. We all used our yelp check in to get free sake which was super worth it by the way.  I ordered the chirashi bowl which came with fresh slices of fish, sushi rice and some fish eggs! My bowl was absolutely delightful and priced at $26! I would say that the value was there because I left the restaurant feeling super satisfied and full.   My friends ordered the spicy tonkotsu ramen and they told me that it was super flavorful with a creamy broth. However I noticed that the ramen did not have any actual thick pieces of pork meat. The ramen only had ground pork which made it a little lacking for me.  We also ordered a salmon roll which I honestly thought wasn't too worth it. The roll only came with 8 pieces and it was super pricy. I think if you come here, you should be ready to splurge a bit due to it being a hotel restaurant.   Overall, my experience here was super satisfying and the service was absolutely amazing. Our waitress came by to check on us often and made sure that we were always having a great time!

Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon roll

q1xMw1w5vp0aHSCm__HmtA.text: Situated along one of the hallways of the Paris hotel, it is a small restaurant with a very modern feel to it: purple/white neon lighting, a neon sign, and modern, wooden decor. I believe there are two sides to the restaurant (or that's what the host told us) and you don't really get a choice of where to be seated. You can tell that the two sides have different vibes; one side of the restaurant, the side we were seated, had very modern vibes with neon lights and top 40 music playing while the other had a more contemporary Japanese restaurant feel to it with chill EDM playing. Nonetheless, the food is the same so don't let the differences fool you.   Service was okay. Our server didn't come check on us at all during our meal. We only saw her when she took our order and when we asked for the check. None of our waters were refilled as well.   I ordered the sliced salmon sizzling plate with noodles, house sauce, and buttered corn. It came to the table on a sizzling plate, so the salmon basically cooked the more it was in contact with the plate. It was really good! The noodles were not soggy, the house sauce enhanced the flavor of the whole plate, and the corn added a nice, buttery touch for the whole meal. I also tried the bulgogi sizzling plate and the meat was juicy and tender.  Overall, this is a good place to give a try. I would definitely come back again to try their sushi.

Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sliced salmon skillet w/ noodles, buttered corn, and house sauce (came on the side)

8I8ojL0XVNRVkuLUHWP5_Q.text: Although it's far from great it's still very affordable. Sekushi is located in the Paris casino. You would imagine this would be ridiculously expensive with small portions. It's not. There's a really good value.   I just came to meet someone. I didn't want to spend a lot so it was a better choice instead of the fancy French themed restaurants in the casino. This place holds plenty of seating even though it's small. At the front is the menu. We looked it over and found some very affordable items amid the more costly ones. Each of us ordered a sushi roll since they were cheaper. The avocado cucumber roll is about $6, which is one of the cheapest things you can get in any casino on the Strip. It tastes like it was pretty fresh. This was accompanied by more items that increased the value. All the rolls come with edamame. That was a pleasant surprise. I didn't think there would be complimentary anything. This wasn't anything that amazing but it was still good.   The Paris casino has some expensive places to eat. At Sekushi you can eat for cheaper. They still have some high end stuff if you still want to throw away money.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado Cucumber Roll And Miso Soup

dEoaM9A9XX7qAWS9qRQNlQ.text: Sits inside the Paris hotel. Menu is pretty limited. We started off with pork buns which were really good. They gave us the edamame for free. We ordered 3 sushi rolls. They were good. I've had better sushi. Sizes were great.   The decor didn't seem that nice. It's like they have two worlds - the "outside" where you can sit on the fake patio in the hotel and there is the inside of the restaurant. Just didn't see that great for the prices.

RecS91o9ejV_D_v9zwNjXw.text: The restaurant is located in a bustling restaurants/shops area inside Paris casino. There are bar and table seatings; I recommend sitting at the bar so you can enjoy the chefs cooking and prepping the food in front of you.  The food is reasonably priced for sushi. There's a lot of variety to choose from: from ramen to sushi, to other cooked dishes. The portions are big so it's definitely worth it. The foie gras is delicious and cheap compared to Nobu in Caesar's. I ate both and the taste is comparable but the price difference is huge.  The chefs can also make whatever dish you can think of as long as the ingredients are available. We wanted something that's not on the menu: uni on baby oyster with a quail egg.  Service is a little slow so order some sake and beer and cheers. We had a large group of 12 so it's understandable. Overall, this was a pleasant surprise and we will definitely be back.

Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Assorted sashimis.

S_-is6SYbvhjSEL22zFk9g.text: Sekushi was a solid option for a mid-tier price point in Las Vegas. We did not have a reservation and were seated almost immediately. Even though all tables were filled the service and food preparation was quick for our party of four. If you check in on Yelp they will provide a container of house sake that is enough for four small glasses (see picture). Others in my party elected for the sushi rolls and sashimi, which were on the whole positive. One person did try the Tonkotsu Ramen but was disappointed by the bland soup base. I selected the Shrimp Sizzlin Skillet with noodles in place of rice and broccoli and corn as the two vegetables. The House sauce was similar to a teriyaki but was thin like water (did thicken slightly as some water boiled off in the skillet). Very flavorful and also healthy, not on be less expensive side for Vegas.

XICpMsp_nur9fdsUXkNEMA.text: Had to update my review. This is our go to sushi spot. Every time we come to Vegas roughly 4-8x a year. Today was really OFF which was disappointing since we have been waiting 5 months to come have a meal here. Our waitress only brought drinks we had to depend on all the other servers to help. The ribeye noodles lacked flavor and the meat had to much fat. Just disappointed today.

BsPMd5uqD51eZyZ3CkeKRw.text: The food at this restaurant is fantastic! I ordered the chicken teriyaki bento box. The sauce for the chicken was flavorful. The salad had just the right amount of ginger dressing and the dressing wasn't over powering. The roll was thick with vegetables and the sweet chili sauce accompanied it perfectly. The other dishes ordered were the shrimp skillet with mushrooms and mushroom sauce, the salmon skillet and the vegetable ramen with egg, chicken and pork added. The shrimp dish was good. While I didn't eat it, I did try the mushrooms and they were wonderful. The restaurant had some seasoning on top which really brought out the flavor of the mushrooms. The salmon and ramen dishes were good too. The only dish which I was not totally happy with was the gyoza. It tasted like it came out of the freezer and then cooked.   Overall I totally recommend this place if you're in Vegas, you won't be disappointed in this little gem.

JHvNMc_owhxgaIXNpqyq4Q.text: Nikko.  This should be the new name of Sekushi.  "Why?" Do you ask?  Because besides the amazing options we chose, this soon to be Michelin chef deserves a ton of credit for what was prepared.   Atmosphere is family.   Service is humble.  Food is memorable.   My wife and I ate here for 2+ hours... Not because it took long for the food to come out... But because we realize how much hard work and effort goes into the prep alone. A lot of TLC goes into every detail here.   Thank you staff for absolutely killing it.

f4M0uxZPSlT6qPaNv4MlwA.text: Nice service and good selection of sushi and dishes. The menu isn't extensive but the quality is great. You'll find sushi and sashimi options (obvi) but there's also bento/rice bowls, rolls, hand rolls and soups.  We had uni sushi, scallop sushi, amberjack sushi, and the Sekushi Lobster Roll.  Everything was great. My favorite was the uni. Fresh and creamy! The roll was pretty good too. Nice flavors that I wasn't expecting. The sauce did over power the lobster, however.  Overall a nice quick sushi fix for my sushi craving, especially with all the American and European foods that Vegas has to offer.

PK6q2SMZg9FRxgEP95wqJA.text: First time eating here and it was great. Service was good and my dish that I ordered was great. Our waitress Naomi was very friendly and constanly checked on us. I ordered the seafood udon. It was just the right creaminess and filled with lots of seafood. Its a huge portion too, essily shareable! I also tried the salmon avocado roll which was very fresh and tasty. The food is very reasonably price, especially compared  to the expensive food on the strip!

xvVsRKze_DG3HYv8ze2NWA.text: Naomi was our server and she was super cool! Her suggestions were spot on; all the service was quick and delicious.  Definitely coming back!

B4uKT_rMKAcy6X-7IF29hA.text: Amazing upbeat restaurant with many choices available. My colleagues and I were visiting from SoCal for the annual SEMA Show. Novi, our waitress/hostess, provided excellent service and was very welcoming and friendly. I will be sure to return again.

8JHqCcqQN2g8xNyP2TM2Dw.text: Called in to get tips on how to get into Sekushi as we read on yelp and were coming from off the strip.  Jada was great! Gave us tips on parking and even held our table for us when we were a bit late.  So helpful.  Great sushi - loved the Aria O.  Our fave

MX2IR03dOwke9x-Miy89jQ.text: Amazing service. great food. best fried rice very well recommend for everyone to come. Food smells very good. Can't wait to try. It's a must to try when your in Vegas. Highly highly recommend it. Especially the great customer service that is offered here.

FUWvnfxACAZ2ZgBr4hR7EQ.text: This place was the only sushi place open late. It's 12:40am and I just had some pretty clean sushi. It doesn't match up to nobu or sushisamba-- both Vegas favorites of mine, but yeah, it's open and better than pizza.

xk8s7uXvGiGCUfUeHZi1uQ.text: Got into Vegas late on a Friday night and was too tired to venture out, so decided to check out the food options between Bally's and the Paris hotels. Came across this place and decided to try. There's lots of exposure and foot traffic here. It was moderately busy. Lighting and ambience had a hipster feel. Service was below par. They all just wanted to stand around and talk to each other. They have one side that's sushi and one side that's skewers and bowls. We order sushi and skewers. Had the shrimp ceviche, surf and turf roll, king crab roll, pork belly, bass skewer, and the salmon collar. The shrimp ceviche was horrible. The shrimps texture was rubbery. I tried to eat it...I really did, but it had no flavor. The surf and turf and king crab rolls weren't very much better. Rice was dry and fell apart. The pork belly had a good flavor, but the meat was over cooked, so it was dry. The bass skewer was quite tasty. It had a citrus miso glaze that was good. The best part was the salmon collar. It was cooked perfect. The flavor was slightly salty but sweet. If it weren't for the salmon, I'd probably give this place one star for what I got for the price I paid.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf and turf
Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2ZzilFYArZP6dm9UqTcQLQ.text: Fourth day on our Vegas trip and everything was great. Never had a disappointing meal yet from In and Out to pho and Italian. The cuisine quality is at a high bar and definitely at par or even better than New York City. That all changed once we ate at Sekushi in Paris hotel and casino. Started off with the hot sake which was pretty good sake for the price. Nice and smooth. Got the complimentary edamame and went with the safe gyoza appetizer and satisfying till that point. The uni scallop nigi was ok but not as great as i hoped. Ceviche taco again nothing mind blowing. Then our entrees came and went all down hill. My girlfriends chirashi don is cover with thinly sliced sashimi that looks nothing like their pictures i saw on yelp. The yellowtail is all mushy and has a weird stanch while the mackerel definitely got too warm and spoiled a bit. My unagi don was un editable. The whole eel has exceptionally sharp and hard bones in it, all over. I ve never had unagi where it was prep beforehand and deboned. The rice from both our entree is off too. I am puzzles how this place got a 4 star. Definitely one of the most over priced fake japanese food joint i ve ever had. So bad that i had to write my comments on the merchant copy of the receipt i left then and create my first Yelp review to warn others. Will be posting on other food review sites to steer people from wasting money and time  at the place.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our actual dinner. Everything else are average and entrees are just terrible.

Hw7eA_L6-B5njUSOs_bdlw.text: Desperate for a healthy meal, we stumbled upon the great Yelp reviews of this place. Our server was great, food came out quickly, and everything was delicious. There's not a lot of great food in this area, but you can count on this spot.

3p0l3lqXNaFZJ2hNwVtPiA.text: This restaurant is Bomb!! Great location and a awesome spot for a quick bite. Nikko is the sushi messiah. Just stop drop n roll!

2cSm_kXZVTc50ZgRA8riNw.text: We ended up at this restaurant by chance, waiting for a Wayne Newton show. We were not expecting to eat Japanese food at the Paris hotel, but we stopped to try it out anyway because the menu looked really good. The wagyu was delicious. In fact, everything that we ordered including the sampler plate was delicious. It was actually the best Japanese food I've had in a long time. Thank you so much Akeeya for the great service as well!

gt6LK9e1238v4DA7isCwXA.text: Just keeping it real...this place does not deserve 4 stars.  The sushi is sub par.  We had the kimono roll, the king crab and yellowtail sashimi.  I eat at a chain called Ra sushi in LA and it's at least 3x as good as this.

La1NkH01d4uLmZr9oF5hDg.text: Good sushi but definitely is overpriced. $18 - $23 for artistic rolls on the smallish size. $19 for udon noodles.  The best of all is that they calculate tip based on tax and recommend 20, 25 and 30% gratuity! Lol keep up these awesome business practices and watch your customers disappear like the dodo bird!

Do7AHcdbFWOshU3wmDnjRw.text: For the money, i've had waay better sushi! Not coming back. The skillet dish was much better than sushi.

x1Bj-GUw37pWuffOsefAgQ.text: Located inside the Paris hotel casino.  Great happy hour see pics.  We had the oyster shooters, and almost every role on the happy hour menu.  We were actually full at the end.  The mackerel sashimi was very good if you like mackerel like I do.  The price outside of happy hour is higher.   However the ladies are prettier here lol.  I say check it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4GDz16h1jGRhWKEeYL_DFA.text: Service was amazing hostess was great she made us feel right at home great conversation and the atmosphere is so relaxing and phenomenon I will recommend this for anybody

Jj_pufvFc1dhcUfvq1OHBA.text: Great food and reasonably priced for the strip. Really good rice, crispy seaweed n fresh fish on the nigiri. Uni n Otoro were awesome. Yakitori was also really good. Scallop was my favorite

-5tdOQkbheLu9hbLXdmqHg.text: I was walking along Paris and decided to grab a quick bite.  I stumbled upon Sekushi, and I'm glad I did!  I asked the server what she would suggest for their signature rolls, and she said the Aria O.  Considering that I just wanted a quick meal, one roll was enough.  The Aria O has salmon, shrimp, avocado, mango, jalapeno, micro cilantro and honey truffle aioli. Since I am not a big fan of cilantro, I asked if it would be very pungent in the roll, and she assured me that it would not be overpowering the other elements of the roll. Good!  Out comes the food! Beautiful! Presentation's great!  And this roll had a bold immense flavor. It's a good thing I listened to Sandra's suggestion, she was right, the cilantro was not overpowering. I loved the honey truffle aioli, it made the roll come together harmoniously! Ingredients were fresh, and the jalapeno was just the right amount to make it spicy but not burn your tongue.  I would definitely come back; food, price and service are great!   I had a wonderful experience, and I would certainly come back to taste more of their signature rolls, and I would for sure recommend it to all my friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aria O

y1GDX3il06efpgQnu9q93w.text: Great service! Food delicious! Enjoy this place at the Paris Hotel! Very clean and lots of choices.beer and wine also served.

UZPGxoYNn1yuVKVqZqN-xg.text: Great little Japanese cuisine place.  My wife reports that the sashimi pieces were well sized and that her sushi roll was very good.  The Bugolgi Beef Bento was good and the spring roll was very crisp.  The ambiance was off, the decor is good as well as the layout, however the music clashed for me, the last thing I want to hear on the sound system while eating in a Japanese styled restaurant is *NSYNC

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sashimi 6 Sampler

NTbsgL5lGKIpcFjIrCcd2A.text: Outstanding bulgogi bento box and Bun! They give you free edamame. Happy hour prices for appetizers was a welcome surprise! I also liked the laid back vibe.

ehDkQRlP2w-gPRFL8eIE_g.text: Went last year when it first opened in December. Stayed at Paris it right bear the elevators. This time went twice in May.. I sit at the counter in front of the chefs preparing food. Soft bun with steak great. Always get different sushi fresh watch them make it. Nico one of the chefs very friendly talks to ne while working. Hostess and servers attentive. Open late.

i331wNuHABKdirOZSxTFhg.text: Great atmosphere. Good sushi bar. The rolls were delicious. We had the rainbow and surf and turf rolls. Great customer service our waitress was Nikki. She was very customer friendly and nice to talk to. She cater to our needs. The bento boxes were quite filling with good sticky rice rolls and a salad.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small but nice menu

mxAm8YFEU-_tkXczJSxAPQ.text: Great Food. Good Staff. Totally overpriced even for happy hour, but hey, they probably have some monster rent to deal with. Go out to Spring Mountain Road, and I guarantee you'll find better deals on Sushi. However, If you're in the mood for Japanese in Vegas and too lazy to leave the strip, Paris has at least 3 little Japanese restaurants all right next to each other, and this is one of them. Basically what I'm saying is, come down to the Paris and you'll find something you'll like, maybe not here, be certainly nearby.

fUMUzZQGLcCKg4JkaZ7bkQ.text: Kitchen is not busy, chefs are not busy but the Ramen is not cooked here and coming from restaurant next door. Not happy why I had to wait without explanation. Overall service not as expected but no complaints to the crew because they are exceptionally hard working.

T-zuZM5x8TNd8loshdGSqg.text: Great decor with my sushi. Ordered dumplings, hot springs, bulgogi Bento box and scallops! Will definitely come here again tonight for a midnight snack attack with my beer (805)! Loving the cheese cake.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful decor with sushi!

V4qINaPsOxMVkbiC5rdgpw.text: What can I say???? This is one of the best Japanese Sushi spot I've tasted in a while! Everything tasted so fresh and the unique menu that they offer!  We ate here twice the same day and the manager gave us a couple rounds of saki the second time around! Great customer service as well! The foie gras sushi is to die for!!! I'd come back to this place in a heart beat!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf n Turf (wagyu beef)
Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sekushi Rolls (foie gras &amp; tuna)
Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie Gras Roll

m6usyaOE9Y5tVTg7OzSdmQ.text: Came in with four friends on a whim for lunch. Everyone really enjoyed their lunches! One had sushi, two had the salmon bento boxes, and I had the ebi don.  My lunch was delicious! The only problem I had was that the sauce was a bit too sweet/salty, especially by the time I got to the bottom. The tempura shrimp was light and lovely!  We also had great service! I highly recommend this place if you want some quick, delicious Japanese food.  *This review was written in exchange for a free dessert.

QkaZf2WWzVbm_mvuV_7l_Q.text: GOOD SUSHI. SERVER WAS  YUI. GOOD TIME at the sushi place. Prices were reasonable. Delicious dessert. I really like their chocolate mouse :)   It's in the PARIS HOTEL.

WAlNRmQ-KOwHj8nhEAEJdw.text: The service was great, and the food was even better. This was the freshest sushi I have had in Vegas with my favorite being the snapper and tuna belly.  Will make this a regular stop on my Vegas trips!

NXsIo8kBlR9vEN7d4zCQJg.text: Their Aria O was delicious! Love the crunchy texture. Would definitely come back to try other sushi.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Edamame,  tempura beans and Aria O

7GA5mT8zoiTf-HDX_BNiHg.text: Service was outstanding. We've been asked if we're okay multiple times. Plus water refills, etc. They are helpful with suggestions when I was order. Riko at the sushi was super friendly even though he had to focus on work, still took time to talk and make us feel welcomed. He even gave us a special plate! Shoutout to Riko! We'll visit you soon, love-the couple.

WC8CZDe4dq7EBoP1uzIldw.text: $6 for a piece of a tuna sashimi? Really? I know this is LV, but c'mon. I'm seriously shocked. This is the first time I've experienced this. All other restaurants will offer you a plate of say, 3 or 6 or even 7 pieces. Just Terrible.  The menu needs to change.  Now for the cut rolls. Oh the rolls are just super dinky.   They look like shrunken rolls. What the heck.. They really need to beef their rolls up.  I'd say the only good thing about this place that's good is the service, that's it!

tGGzb-g5rR_DeAwJJLIvlg.text: Came here on a Wednesday night around 6:30 for dinner. Food and service are really great! It may seem pricey, but for being in a nicer hotel it is reasonable. Chirashi is a good deal if you're not too picky! Sushi by the piece is a little expensive but rolls are decently priced. The Salmon Avocado roll is great! Overall food and service were excellent. Definitely one of the best restaurants at Paris.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Mousse Aka Devils Pie good for any chocolate lover!
Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Salmon Avocado Cut Roll
Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chirashi Don

HppDrV1_DhuVi9qtV6L-tQ.text: Vegas has a lot of chains, but Sekushi is an original, delicious sushi restaurant definitely above average. I don't usually sushi in landlocked states, but the quality and flavor of Sekushi definitely warranted an exception.  I had:  The beef bao--never had beef before, but this was definitely a little different and very rich. It was messy and the dough fell apart, but I wouldn't change a thing about the flavor.  The Aria O roll was definitely my favorite. It's very spicy, so be forewarned.   We also had the hot spring roll, which was great but served warm, which isn't my preference.  Food great, service slow, but good if you want to take a long time to chat.

Cmk_X8AHQ2r6MU5N9umY7g.text: First time I'm eating here ... they have a Very good sushi and absolutely great service !  I Didn't need to wait long for the food and the servers were super nice.  Check in with them on yelp and you'll get a free cheesecake ..  highly recommended

6cHhF3rwYw2uBAo-0niQNw.text: Aria O roll is unique and tasty.   Service was very speedy and helpful.   The spicy edamame was very tasty as well.    Other folks got the bento box and rated it "ok" as the chicken was very dry.  Would certainly return to try more rolls.

rB50u0ZHiPiT1v08PjNNVQ.text: I was very impressed with Sekushi. There are so many restaurants to choose from in Vegas and this place did not disappoint, especially since they just opened a few days ago! The food and decor are top notch. The layout of the sushi bar allows for great people watching.  The sushi was very fresh and the presentation was beautiful. I have no complaints. I would definitely recommend it.

L5uLbc55yT-qoi-yQIMU_w.text: We did not enjoy the restaurant. King salmon roll had no flavor and was mostly rice. The sashimi was not from the best fish cut. Scallops tapas was ok but not that great. The waitress was crabby.

dXP7lQWu7CwquCBzE20LKw.text: This place is not bad. Customer service was great. They were really quick! :)   I got the chicken teriyaki bento box (comes with rice, salad, and miso soup) and it's a decent size. It filled me up. I liked it. We also got sashimi salad. That was ok. I think it would be better if they had a different dressing because the one that comes with the salad is really salty in my opinion. But other than that, it was good.

wwZNj-tIjgqrmPqCxT-E-Q.text: We were waited on by Areeya. She was awesome and helped us right away, making recommendations and helping us maneuvering the menu to find selections that best fit our taste. We definitely will be back, not to mention the food is amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Specialty rolls yummy!
Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sake!

ma9IU8doW6AZZDF79_amCg.text: Honestly this restaurant is more like 3 stars but it's so overrated that I had to bring them down to earth a little. IMHO, the real test of sushi is a chirashi (nothing but raw meat to assess the quality); that's what I bought and it was very underwhelming. Low quality meat, the rice was good but who cares about rice?  House sake had a good flavor. I think the strip is often overrated like this.

Q1hw30CFmACYiWcRwXgEQg.text: Had been craving sushi for two days so I jumped on Yelp and tracked down Sekushi inside the Paris Hotel and Casino. I was dining alone so had a seat at the sushi bar without any problems and was immediately served some warm edamame to get me started and some green iced tea. By the time I was finished I think the staff were a little concerned about how much sushi I managed to shove down my throat- I spent $83 at this place BY MYSELF!  If you're a sake fan I suggest you try a bottle of the Lychee Sake. For $23 it is worth the price and goes down a little too well! For food I ordered the Pork Gyoza, the Wagyu Beef Bun (so tasty and tender), the Yellowtail Ceviche Wonton Taco (super fresh!) plus the Spicy Tuna Hand cut rolls and the Salmon and Avocado Rolls. I definitely could not pick a favourite out of all these dishes as they were all so fresh and so tasty! Highly recommend for some fresh food on the strip. Hopefully will come back before I leave.

Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu Beef Bun

VbkTYGt_2hfWcwr-Toab9g.text: Had some downtime at a conference and sat at the sushi bar watching the show of the chefs making some of the best sushi i have had period.  I would recommend the aria o if you have a chance.   Don't sit in the back, sit and watch the chefs work at the sushi bar.   I will be back if i get the chance.

BbqFjvaxG6NFwytrqzzyEg.text: Stopped in for a light dinner with apps and one sushi roll. Everything was fabulous and the service was wonderful.

njml9HKbuK0jHV_IBTQ6vg.text: The food came out fast and not bad but not very good.  We had Wagyu beef skewer- good but overcook Foie gras- good Uni- good Spicy tuna roll- OK King Cali roll- Ok Chicken teriyaki bento-good- the kids love the glaze panko shrimp bento- good Surf n turf roll- bad- mushy rice very mushy blah mushy  Sekushi Sashimi- good- fresh Hamachi kama- very good and the biggest we saw  Japanese miso ramen- ok full of bean sprout I will get the sashimi and the dinner plate/bento if we ever go back but I'll stay away from the rolls unless it was an off night for them. When it comes to sushi not only the fish plays an important role but the rice. If the rice is not right it just throws everything off.

K0hPU9FIm1xlgL6wK3IG1g.text: Great food & service! Jada was absolutely fantastic! Super friendly & fast service & food was amazing. Definitely recommend coming here if you're walking around Paris, Vegas! Worth the wait & money if you're feeling some sushi! :)

BU03q5a8lwT1ojxR7i_YSA.text: This place was terrible. Sushi was named differently on the menu. We had order a king crab roll and they literally delivered a California roll! Honestly just name it that! Plus the ramen was gross, we were very very hungry so we had to stop here. On top of that the waitresses were taking an extremely long time to bring our food! The people sitting next to us also complained about the time it took for the food to come out and and also about the how bad the food was. For everything our bill ended up being $80 for the terrible food! To make matters worst we drank water so that was the bill just on food. That place really left a bitter taste in our mouth. Never!!!!

BpG7iYc4MfHE2TuanKL-6w.text: The best Japanese restaurant I've ever tried in Vegas.  Foods are delicious and fresh, and recommend the Aria O roll it's so special & yummy!

pAzINuvFWw7p0qg9cBVGAA.text: Amazing food and excellent service!!! This is the only sushi restaurant in Paris hotel where we're living so we were kinda skeptical about it but it turned out super amazing! Sophie was out server, she super super attentive, polite and answered all our questions and helped us with what to order. I highly recommended Sophie if you stop by this place. I hope there's more server like her. Will definitely be back!

y8AGp8Q9tKR8WEwp4CGwqQ.text: This place is amazing, it's on the restaurant pathway in the Paris Casino. My favorites, the Wagyu Beef Tartar & Fois Gras hand roll.  The Hamachi is very good too.  Great happy hour, but can get packed.   Prices are a bit high, but hey, quality ingredients and your in Vegas.  Nice size sushi bar, but not a lot of seating.  We frequent this place for a sake or sushi snack.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu Beef Tartar $17
Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. FOIS GRAS hand roll - $9
Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Panko Shrimp Cut Roll - $9

8cvWiqravPf_BQWYO4MxeA.text: Came here to explore what Sekushi has to offer; We ordered Vegetarian Ramen, some rolls, and a salmon skillet. The food was pretty good but slightly overpriced, but hey we're in Vegas. However, what made this place a one star experience was the service. The server Sandra was extremely rude and didn't treat us like guest in the restaurant. She didn't smile, didn't greet us, didn't ask us if we needed anything, didn't offer us water, and didn't check up on us. Basically, a lot didn'ts. Would never come back here again based on the service.

NloIy-rPpvozbJjoWBTQmg.text: Stumbled upon Sekushi heading to my room and fell in love. The fresh fish looked and tasted amazing. The art is super cool and the staff is amazing. A must go while visiting Vegas.

zRqWHjrp2_vmLQIMstJAUw.text: This place was awesome! The service was quick and the food was great! I will definitely come back to Sekushi! Our server Novi had great recommendations and was a pleasure being our server.

oQHL7VU9564LfqBzKjQx5g.text: Had the oyster skewer which was small but flavorful and had delicious crispy pieces. Also got the pork belly skewer which flavor was good except it was hard to chew through. Also had the steamed ribeye bun which was tasty as a final bite shared. Sweet like a dessert. The pork belly skewers and bun are pictured. Decent service and kept our water filled the whole meal. We sat at the bar. Oh and got 20% off for checking in on yelp!
