SXzlryMP9-QF6h4jKFUVLw.text: To go was super fast and convinient. They're open until 1 which is amazing! Hostess was super nice and accommodating would definitely come back

vGebyoL05SAZwKl5e2RwwA.text: The skewers here were great! Such a nice staff they were super helpful and nice! Definitely a good place to stop next time you're at the Paris hotel.

0MkNG2hE3kHRNhe3xECy9w.text: Good food and excellent service. Novi is the best server. She told us to try the Aria O and Kirin beer.

IGdt3fUwmuEzyLCcPvBBTQ.text: Amazing sushi on the Strip located inside of the Paris hotel. It's a tiny place so expect it to be packed at peak times. The sushi is comparable to some of the upscale sushi restaurants at a lower price, but I still think it's pricey...and I'm comparing this to Chicago and NYC standards. I love how we received complementary edamame. We had the Sekushi lobster, Kimono, and Aria O. The kimono is my least favorite. Still good, but I think it's the sauce. I prefer a creamier sauce rather than the balsamic. The Aria O is one of the best rolls I have ever had. There is a crunch component which is really unique. Don't know what it is, but it's fantastic. Wait service is good here too. Since it's a small place, they were all attentive to everyone's needs.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Top to bottom: Kimono, Aria O, Sekushi lobster. Aria O was the best.

qs5fzD7COICZAmRSBherpw.text: Can I just that this restaurant the shit.  The customer service was superb.  I love sushi and this place delivered.   The staff at the front told us exactly what we needed to order.  And she was able to help us the full extent of what we were looking for.   Highly recommend this place to anyone staying in the hotel.

tvxc9u1JX1G590PiQQp22A.text: Sashimi is very fresh, good to try! Very recommended Japanese food in vegans and nice staff:Yui

dRgEmaZrXwf7rgJeVHTUbw.text: Cool sushi!! Fantastic ramen!! The best service!!! We've got the warm welcome. You must be here once you're in vegas.

ZNdwFFUT24tzdwnp-vA0yg.text: Are here several times in the past and sushi was great.  Tonight, the otoro pieces (2) I ate was served still slightly frozen.  After eating the 1st piece, I left the 2nd piece on my plate and smashed it around off and on for several minutes.  When I finally ate it, I could see the "small" water ponding.  At $15 a piece, I believe it should have been served way better, if not, then better to eat at Nobu.  If only I had my phone to take a picture.

-zP_t3wM_Zw9bRHQ9kUWQQ.text: I don't get why the rating is so high. Decent looking place and good customer service are the only reasons for the 2 stars. Other than that the food is overpriced. The portions were too small. I ordered a rainbow roll, steamed rice and beer. My boyfriend had one their rolls with eel, don't recall the name - that's how poor it was, and some poke. Both rolls were small, dry and lacking flavor. I think the sushi buffet on the strip is way better than this and that's where'd you'd actually expect it to be not so great. Yet, somehow we wished we'd gone there. We basically paid $77 for appetizer sized meals.

RlrCDABaLsVBvYE-46j4BA.text: I've been here twice with my bf and did enjoy the food there. The Japanese oysters were super fresh and tasted a little bit sweet. Uni don was my favourite! We also tried Aria O roll was great, though I am not very into spicy food. The staff are all very nice and their service was great.

VnpTv4UAtixIh_mr0F40ng.text: this place is amazing the food is really good the service is really good if i could i would give this place a million stars

ATE3bWl9OBbCYl_IXMbhlQ.text: Great service, Novi and Bia was especially helpful in helping us decide a sushi roll that didn't have raw fish in it. Very quick and we love the rolls she helped us pick!

1BPbFXLmfEZ8XzmlL1ueEg.text: The food was great and I had the best service by our waitress Bia! Definitely recommend when you're in town.

s7r17ClJUfEftNGBGOptYQ.text: Great sushi, great atmosphere. We found this place after calling around, apparently no sushi is open for lunch in Vegas but so happy these guys are. Cozy sushi joint with great food and service. Definitely coming back for some fresh sushi! - highly recommend the specialty sushi rolls

482rot2sw_SCCu0W0-l8Ww.text: Food was awesome! I will be back for the Panko Shrimp and king Cali Crab. Everything seemed fresh and well prepared and fast service.

Q1f4jVk0GxKSyEIWgk50BQ.text: Nice casual Japanese/sushi restaurant inside Paris Hotel, good solid food, great service. It was a good change from all the heavy food the last 2 days. Very convenient location.

sFl2YAV9EkhLLkWRHFCRLQ.text: Attentive servers and the best food for my dollar during our entire stay in Vegas. We ordered the wagyu beef skewers, tuna tartare, tuna with foie gras, and the daily salmon roll. All of them were fantastic but the foie gras and tuna (their namesake Sekushi roll) really stole the show. An absolute must-order, but don't be shocked when you only get three pieces!

J4D-nlYLPfZI8UFhC9c70g.text: Solid restaurant! Sake was buy one get one!!! Gyoza was yummy and waitress was very informative.

6FalwkCQvPNAEyO79fg4LA.text: It's a great Japanese place in Las Vegas, located inside Paris. We ordered the seafood udon, and there were lots of seafood in it and it tasted good!

2-6Rb1kp8pXE4mZVT-Fghg.text: Good place to have sushi in between Ballys and Paris. Fish was fresh and service was good.

Z7E-UsvV1whPbdv3Tbdk9Q.text: Very nice Vegas dinner. It was very cool seeing the sushi made by the chef right in front of me! Our waitress Mika was also very friendly. Great place to grab a bite before hitting the slots!

NTCmmIHGpgWNSN1PWlNaJQ.text: Do NOT trust the yelp page and the price rating! This restaurant is definitely over priced and tastes no better than any of the sushi from the supermarket. I spent more than twenty dollars for beef tataki but not expecting only seeing three tiny pieces. I have been to many good sushi restaurants and willing to pay expensive bill if the food worths it, but definitely NOT this one. Worst resultant ever and my first yelp review.

faKo-aVdOxupPS1WaD-Yzw.text: Overpriced, small rolls.  Sekushi is located inside Paris Paris.  Service was good.  Food taste was average.  I cannot recommend.

fa4sMCPoYRAw-G2l7WLmsA.text: Stayed at the Paris Las Vegas and decided to hit up this restaurant before we went to Jay Leno. We are a huge sushi family so we know what to order and what good sushi tastes like.  Our servers were terrific but that is where it all ended.  The edamame they brought us before dinner was very sad looking. I also ordered a glass of Merlot and was brought out a tiny, tiny glass of very mediocre wine.  I figured for the price I paid it should have been much better.  My family ordered sushimi and got one small piece of fish for $12.  I decided to try something different and ordered the wagyu beef and the seared foie gras.  They were absolutely the smallest dishes I have ever been served in my life.  The wagyu was around $15 and only 3 tiny strips of meat.  I had to fold them over just to get a taste of the meat. The foie gras was $36 and 4 tiny slices probably the size of a penny. I was starving and broke by the time I left the restaurant. Would have rather gone to the Dim Sum place next door.  At least I would have been full when I left. With all the great restaurants in Vegas, I will never go back to Sekushi again!!

Z40e658iJKyKMwBos7maVQ.text: 4.5 stars? Not even. First, I hate when restaurants call themselves "Japanese" yet have Korean dishes. A real Japanese restaurant doesn't serve Korean food. Food was just ok. I ordered chirashi. It came with 4 pieces of fish, two pieces of fried egg, a little salmon roe and a shiso leaf. Rice was cold and unseasoned. Fish quality was ok. Not a $22 dish.

gX2FXCDKxz_Hj_7XjwOYgQ.text: Delicious. Spicy tuna roll was BOMB. We got a second, just because. Free desert if you check in on Yelp!

Exb1Tmf080at1xcTgSTHUQ.text: Most overpriced average at best sushi in the world. $30 for three small pieces of salmon and $35 for a boring roll that would have been 7 anywhere else.

Mh7UXkEYHhBuiJM3z3oV7A.text: Novi is very kind and dinner also super great!! Here is very clean and food is soooo fresh!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

esqLl3QxOf8_8yflrpoC3w.text: Had a wonderful time with friends.  When I passed by the restaurant it looked interesting.  Food was good, enjoyed the spicy garlic edamame, spicy tuna roll, goyza and king salmon.  We even had to order another order of spicy tuna rolls.  With good music and Melisa as our waiter and her constant attention to our need I could not have wished for anything this evening. Melisa was kind enough to wait and explained for our friends who have never eaten Sushi.  I will return to this restaurant I the furniture. This restaurant is located in the Paris Hotel.  We were lucky they had a cancellation.

yMsy_F2_orRl2LuAZ_BMXA.text: My wife and i came to get a quick sushi fix here and it was tasty. The AriaO roll had great crunch and good flavour.. The Salmon was fresh.

wCl-GnkqugHt6YNVbcZaRQ.text: The beef skewers are awesome !!!! The uni sushi are fresh, all the food are very delicious.

WBl-pcyEV8eYplZdhuTgeg.text: I Came in on the Sat night before the Super Bowl by myself and sat at the sushi bar. Tien T was a fantastic waitress! She was friendly and offered plenty of menu suggestions to help me pick my perfect dinner. I'll definitely come back.  Thank!

gvaEv8MJ_QAUwpa7q7qmMA.text: So glad we found this place. Good food, boyfriend loved his rolls. I had the halibut, yummy!

dID0tKEbkbmhvRqhp2IiCg.text: Good service, good sushi. Nice atmosphere. Good for a little break from your busy Vegas day

QEIIjpRv6RrJI4lPZ0zwZg.text: This is my first time here. The steak was great and good portion. They also have sushi on the other side for you to order as well. The service is great!!! Staff always checking if we are ok. Over all I would recommend this place you should give a shot!!!

e04hNh_v53gnbRhTvka1lg.text: I'm always skeptical of trying new sushi spots but this place was amazing. The service is top notch and the sushi was amazing. Yellowtail jalapeno roll was delicious, traditos were yummy and the pork upon was perfect. I highly recommend this place

Nswa1OxbQbY4Y8dduuO9Gg.text: Went to eat here and it wasn't really very good. The fish was flavorless, and the staff seemed very confused when I asked for a simple tuna roll. Maybe this is geared towards more experienced sushi fans, but I felt let down. Poor selection of rolls on the menu. There are 1000 other places to have sushi in this town. Maybe try one of them?

DgQozvxunxrbemLbY1_1UA.text: Great food really enjoyed yourselves, our server was very personable and food was outstanding, I highly recommend this place, we stay at Paris very often, and are we deafly coming back here very soon

ZcsIadh9qoiyAqJsCANykw.text: Delicious and cute! We chose this spot after walking the strip in the sun. Complimentary edamame for the table is a nice touch. Miso soup very tasty. All the rolls we tried were fresh, flavorful, and interesting! Great prices.

595qEbnEIyVau1IcMPnEYg.text: Great place! Got the chirashi and a shot! It's a little tough to find but it is in the Paris hotel! Good food at reasonable prices and friendly staff!

ZBr-Z0tElj1prICyiXLk_Q.text: Excellent Service. Sushi, Rolls and oysters shooter are delicious. Must visit restaurant if you are on the Las Vegas Strip

RUw2aPlO6zKmHv4XsQAwog.text: Fast and yummy sushi - very convenient to hotel and casino. Tried special hot spring roll and it was great...tuna sashimi was very tender and fresh!

4MEFOaj_0aNTR2FOwCJ0wg.text: Very good and nice place located inside the Paris Hotel. You have to hug the walls of the casino to get there, and once you do, the food does not disappoint. They greeted us with complementary edamame, which was a first for me. The fish was good and the rice was too. The ginger dressing on the salad was very delicious. If you're in for sushi at the strip and looking for a quick bite, this is a good spot!

04FPQHwWi2SpaSkH6Ga9rQ.text: Unexpected find. There's only one ramen soup dish on the menu, which was off-putting since I was craving ramen, and thought that it was added as an afterthought to the sushi-bar. But it did NOT disappoint. Delicious ramen, perfect texture noodle in a deep-flavoured broth. Quality sushi - "Aria O" signature roll - a must-try. Would definitely come again, this trip.

AxTxcWGXV24YLwgnGM4Qsw.text: Visiting Vegas again, tried out Sekushi with our server jade.   Service was good, friendly. Saul too.  I liked the spicy tuna roll.   We will come back.

vH7viNOcWuNvuvirePbCHg.text: The food is not that great, the prices are confusing. it's a restaurant that I would only come once. The service is okay.

EoopjKoDXtx6nEMCDyWCyw.text: I ordered sashimi 12. It's really fresh! (In pic)  I do not recommend ordering their sushi cut roll. It's $6~$12, nothing special, super small size and the rice taste old.  But the service was good, and also I got a cheese cake with mucha on it which is really tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sashimi 12

zQ5P_2WHnvH0ccfgX7hRDQ.text: Stopped here for a quick lunch as we just got in and are staying at Paris. It was not busy, we were seated immediately. We were greeted with complementary edamme . I ordered the salmon teriyaki bento box, my husband ordered 3 sushi rolls, spicy tuna, scallop, and tuna.   We did not specify but assumed everything would come out together but the sushi was brought out one roll at a time all before my bento box. My miso soup came out before the rest of the bento box.  My husband enjoyed the sushi. My bento box was good. It included miso soup, a chicken egg roll, a nice sized piece of salmon, steamed white rice, and a mixed green salad. It was the perfect amount of food for lunch. Our bill was 55 dollars before tip.

ZwpFuj3iOxQNbVcVGlwLMQ.text: Great friendly staff! They have gluten free soy sauce. Delicious yellowtail roll as well as king crab roll. Definitely a plus that they have free edamame. Yummy spot!

MeLgn2DTAbj3ZwPTkRK6kQ.text: I liked Sekushi because it is a very authentic sushi restaurant right in the middle of Paris.  The prices were fair, the fish was fresh.  You can go on the cheap with a 7 pc plus roll dinner and buy one get one house sake, or you can go all out with Omakasa, fancy rolls, expensive sake.  The booths are comfortable for a small group.  The sushi bar is good for singles but beware of the somewhat uncomfortable bar seats.  There were a number of sushi restaurants that I considered, and based on price, decor, and authenticity, this was the right pick for me.

yRECcmW9hdajxY6oRUvPjg.text: Sekushi Japanese Restaurant has wonderful food. It also has amazing service and a had a very short wait. Jada the host was fantastic. It has a convenient location inside Paris Paris on the strip.

-VLBk3U8tkcM6L9kmvPHhg.text: Novi is a so friendly and was very attentive. We came for my sisters 21st birthday and it was a great experience! Definitely recommend coming here

IBwKz0RAHUl-Cu1ncCSqFg.text: Great decision to stop for dinner here while shopping! Menu had plenty of good options and hostess was friendly and efficient. The food was a good value and tasted amazing. Would definitely recommend and will be coming back again!

Mb6We_VISMz2PNZr3nNkqQ.text: As soon as we arrived at the restaurant, the server named Jessica gave us the best service. She helped us as soon as we arrived. Big thanks to her. Good food. Good service. Will come back for sure!

L-22CWa917lj_aHWil-5Bg.text: Overall decent service and good rolls. Food is overpriced and not worth the $$. Highlights recommended by the waitress were the Surf n Turf roll and the Aria roll. Honestly to be in Vegas this place is not worth the money.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf n Turf. Made with Wahyu beef
Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

566xYdupH5Ya9dMDXHvjmQ.text: Food is so good!! Amazing place! Fast service! Nui is a very sweet and kind waiter! I liked her a lot! Thanks Nui for the fastest best service!

TGL70mj7PwLL_R0qTnsYYw.text: Food okay. But i gave them one star because the day special was 2 for 1 house sake. We ordered one house sake and instead of bringing us two (like most places do when they have this special) they brought us one. We ordered a second one and when we ordered a second one we were charged for both! I spoke to the manager; he claimed two different waitresses must have taken the order. I said yes but the two sake bottles are still on the table AND on the check!!! I don't appreciate being cheated out of my money.

EN2bwR0KJUFCDNcG-V3cuQ.text: The food and service here is exceptional. We had the sweetest server Novi. She was kind, friendly and made sure we were happy. The food was on point, served quickly, and enough for two people. They had great sushi, seafood pot, and waygu beef skewers. I also like how they stayed open late.

DtL86j1tlBH2YGI80wg19g.text: First time in Las Vegas and I decided to check out this restaurant. The atmosphere was really welcoming and warming. The host was really friendly and helped us out with the menu. The food was really fresh and delicious. In fact, the service was really fast.

YKPiQ680lyjElz4tvLDK2A.text: Hands down the best sushi I've ever had. I honestly think it ruined all other sushi places which blows because I'm not a Vegas local and I don't ah e a location near me... so that's the down side. However the surf n' turf roll was amazing and if you ask them to surprise you- you won't be disappointed.

opFTPSiPV-5vXesdW-cquA.text: There was no wait time and everyone working here was friendly. Our waitress messed up our order twice (reason for star deduction) but the sushi and shrimp was amazing. We ordered the Sekushi Lobster Roll and Shrimp Cocktail. We were also able to try Mochi Ice Cream (Mango and Green Tea) from the Yelp check in. I would definitely come back here again. Everyone's Plates around us look great as well- and edamame was given to us to start.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

m-RFopUqII9VYD349E_lBg.text: As a picky eater I can say this about Sekushi Japanese Restaurant:  Great food. Great service. Very clean and fresh.   I recommend the chicken teriyaki Shishito peppers.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ugzm0RS4wLhmZJM4VsepAA.text: Very fresh sashimi but a little overpriced, but your in Vegas so that might not matter. Service was spot on and I got a free bottle of hot sake. Parking is horrible so try to walk here from your hotel if your close enough

UW-0INye5KhsVHGlBddOeA.text: Very fresh tuna belly and enjoyed the gyoza!  Nice for a casual evening.  Close to the Paris Casino too!  Also a good atmosphere.  Enjoyed the experience/night.

_q0fjQ87xomF6q2pw0cBvQ.text: Glad to have some thing authentic at a reasonable price . The Chirashi don tasted good. Felt satisfying

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bHsLp7W9JDcMIhGo6Au15g.text: Came here last weekend with a craving for sushi while in Vegas. Having eaten a lot of fancy meals in the past week, my boyfriend and I were looking for something more low key. We stumbled upon this place and I was taken in by the awesome authentic looking decor. We were seated with no wait. The service was on point. We each had a sushi roll, a ceviche tuna taco and spicy edamame. Never had edamame served any other way than with sea salt. It was great! I recommend it. And it's ACTUALLY spicy. We were happy with everything. I'm surprised I remembered the name of this place to review it after this weekend!

e70v0cP6VPiNrkhBuKzRVA.text: Really, really good. I had the Sekushi Sushi which was chef's choice for seven pieces of nigiri and a special roll. The roll was okay, but the nigiri were some of the best cuts of fish I have had in Vegas. My wife got the creamy udon soup which was very well balanced and had several interesting ingredients. Service was prompt and fast and the decor was well done, if a little cheesy with the sample food displayed. Edamame at the table was a nice touch.   During our visit, it was very warm inside the restaurant to the point of almost being uncomfortable but I am not sure if that is a common feature.   Overall we had a great time and will visit again on future trips.

l8jhMS8WjUe2ffjsWobbVA.text: This is a small Japanese restaurant located inside of the Paris hotel. The sushi prices were reasonable (especially for Vegas) and the rolls we ordered were delicious. My favorite was the sekushi rainbow roll. The tempura batter on the shrimp was also excellent, not too much and just the right temperature and texture. We picked up a 20% off coupon at the check in station as well, so look for it! Sorry no pictures, I was too hungry.

hWXrUchDEkZJr8kKTV8hZA.text: The sushi was oeshi desu! Service great and the sushi chef "Niko" was extremely skilled! Wonderful surprise & would certainly return! Novi was very helpful.

FASPcai_HJzeL9iikArztA.text: Terrible! They charge $16 for one piece does not worth it . Also their service is terrible.

0D215F0eb4tyFD44xSV45A.text: Real Japanese sushi place,  very good taste and good quality.  Four stars because it took long time to make the Aria roll but I really recommend to try the Aria O.

HV73_aigms9HSTXu9fMxtQ.text: I had such an amazing experience, Tien was our server. Thank you for choosing all our apps and sakes haha. Have a wonderful one.

hAGM99kk1QHlwFBGTuXQBw.text: Love gambling around Paris and grabbing sushi here. The quality is great! The service was also spot on once we were seated and Tien, our waitress, was very attentive. Drinks were fast, oyster and uni shooters were prepared quickly, and our main dishes were delicious. Definitely recommend and will come again.

GDfXhn3DBqxB20ciIr7s3g.text: I ordered the aria roll and it was so tasty. It is a little bit spicy but for me it is a bonus for this sushi roll.

QOYTcwG0q9mVJwJKasr4Yg.text: Ordered the chef's choice sushi and grilled sea bass. Sushi tasted fresh, and the sea bass was super creamy and buttery. We also ordered the chicken teriyaki bento and seafood udon, and both were delicious as well

jvaKz2XCppGOSLF3XNjIMg.text: Great service!  Melissa was awesome suggesting great options for our large group. Green beans appetizer were a great start along with the dumplings appetizer. Sashimi was tasty and fresh.  Overall very satisfying.

QntQjs4kB78aU6ir8hJbew.text: This is the best place to go eat sushi! Niko is  a great sushi chef!!  The guy with dreads!!!

Wa2gWl7VgkaOXCMsjHk9lg.text: Maybe good for people that don't eat Asian/Japanese food frequently or any at all. If you have any palette, the prices don't even come close to the food served. 22 dollars for a basic roll with super small cuts of fish.  Service great, food.. not so much. If I had to compare this place with a chain, I would say Niko Niko is significantly better in terms of food quality and taste.

DiWctihIiQFXHlr-TKnDDA.text: This place is simply amazing! The sushi is as fresh and authentic as it gets! Extremely friendly and helpful staff. Melissa is great. Great options for non-sushi people as well. Two thumbs up!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-AwrZknX5MyXqVgDevYzMA.text: Fish was fresh and delicious.  I sat at the sushi bar and witnessed my order being made.

cAm-ZhfPeNkp-z0cbW6LCQ.text: this is the worst Japanese restaurant I ever been. The worst chicken teriyaki, I can make that with my foot. The octopus taste like wet wood and the water  eel rice is too salty and oily.

GZCwrPr3D4Lf5D47LaGwxw.text: This Japanese restaurant either shall be removed from Paris Las Vegas. If not, its executive chef shall be fired or the own shall look for a new chef if he or she is the chef.  You can tell from the traffics of crowds. I sensed it but still gave a try and I was right about it.  Don't give me wrong, the services are great like the most of restaurants in Vegas. If you believe that the taste of food is your ultimately choices by the end day, this place is not what you would like to go. It does Not taste what what it is worthy based on the location as well as the price. I understand the portion may be varied...  Imaging you can taste raw salts in the sushi rolls. The rice is cheap ones, certainly not the authentic Japanese rice. Shrimp tempura is the typical low-end deep fry style. It was not even well done and worse than Safeway sushi!  Overall I would never go again since there's so many other great ones to go.

5BaMWgJDrYU_gnsZeaDiiw.text: This was the perfect restaurant to check out before a night out! Great service, good food, can't ask for much more. Definitely try the salmon bento box if you want a little bit of everything.

Otxa7sixilo5qU512xDzpg.text: First time visitor to Sekushi. Found it on yelp.  FOOD: My friend and I ordered chicken teriyaki bento boxes. Each comes with chicken, steamed rice, salad, and a vegetable egg roll. It was a good portion and the food was delicious. We both particularly enjoyed the egg roll which was crispy and flavorful. All of the food was served at a desired temperature. The cheesecake stole the chose. Incredibly creamy and just all around delightful!  SERVICE: We visited on a Saturday at noon. We were greeted and seated within minutes. The service was fast and efficient. The servers work as a team to execute orders with high quality and speed. Our server Weethara was friendly and helpful. We waited a minimal amount for our food and had our drinks and complementary edamame to hold us over.   AMBIANCE: They have an upbeat fun vibe. It's noisy because it's near the shops but manageable. Casual. QUALITY/VALUE: This place is designated $$; I agree. It's reasonable. Good value if you're looking for something quick on the strip and craving Japanese.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Teriyaki Bento Box (asked for dressing and sauce on the side)
Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesecake

131xGLtH0uFL_YDK6DGzyg.text: Ordered hamachi Kama and it was delicious. Miso soup was fresh, too. Definitely would come back next time when we are in town.

x-TxF2FuO9ToNnK6Weg2eQ.text: Just pick up sushi at the airport. Who on earth gave this place more than a star? It's embarrassing to pay these prices for something you should reasonable get for 2.50 at a trader joes. Vegas trap. Should have taken the time to get off the strip.

_9fMJvRo_vcmn_PUM1HrMw.text: I have no idea where the 4 stars comes from.  My only conclusion is the people rating a 4 star have never had sushi before.  The fish was old.  The portions were small and the service was slow.  Stay away!!!!

gqEhGamXIpMj3S-Dqb0eJw.text: Went here to eat sushi.. but they dont sushi to the customers in the dining area. Ended up with a $100 bill and I'm still hungry. Very un-happy and still hungry. :(  Spoke to the front desk and the Manager girl told me that I must have gone to the wrong restaurant..and didnt give a care if I was happy or not. I told her I dont want a comp or credit but she didnt care at all what so ever. 9:30pm on Jan. 12th. Great customer service Paris hotel staff. This Total Rewards Diamond/MGM Platinum player is NEVER staying here again!! WOW:(

PT71lUVi-EyvYW9yWWvZkg.text: This place is definitely one of the best restaurants in Las Vegas. The Wagyu Sliders are some of the best burgers I've ever had, and all of the sushi is incredible. My favorite rolls are the Surf &Turf roll and the Shrimp Tempura roll. Overall the food and service are amazing and be sure to ask I for Novi as a server, she is hands down one of the best servers in this restaurant.

bRTVUpJrG0sjmMUICpMLBA.text: Located just past the casino area at Paris as you make your way onto the shopping area...  Here's what we had:  Edamamae:  Complimentary; very nice of them Japanese gyoza:  Pork dumplings; very good Kimono roll:  Spicy tuna plus other delicious ingredients; very good Chirashi:  I won't order this again; this is a very tough dish to make and probably my fault for ordering this at Vegas hotel  Good experience overall

Niw3rdhSoMI2nVO9jvVXhQ.text: Been walking past this place for a few Vegas visits & finally made it in & it was happy hour. I had the edamame, tuna sashimi,  maki roll & 2 Japanese beers. The sashimi & sushi were fresh & the beer ice cold.The entire bill was under $20. I don't remember the last time that happened, let alone in Vegas, on the strip & for sushi but it did. I can't wait to come back for a visit to my new fave sushi bar on the strip.

ciUOVYL2OO9--MJZ9MPgGg.text: This was really disappointing.  The service was unprofessional.  I got the feeling that most of the help was new.  The food was very average, but the miso soup was excellent.  For $175.00, I expect something memorable.  This place was not.

4ScbV4Ku9BHkArz4oHtUEg.text: Nikko was a showman cooked up some amazing ramen the sashimi salad was to die for and the service was great.  Had great conversation with the staff and would recommend this place to anyone visiting Vegas and hungering for Asian food.

Tgp_Gnhzg06EzY5LxMaI7A.text: We found Sekushi a few days prior to us trying the food. The restaurant caught our eye ! The girl who took our order had great costumer service very friendly . The menu was easy to understand and the restaurant set up is super dope. Definitely would come again on my next visit .

z6LqGvtDcS76vk196JNlhw.text: Awesome place. Ate here while staying at Paris. We had three rolls that were amazing. I dot remember the names...Baya, Arioli?, and the Cali. All were great and would highly recommend.

NCOrnwxDXCpL7_fDYVSd_w.text: Just had the best experience with sushi chef Nikko. We asked for a special mix of sashimi and he whipped up this amazing dish with a beautiful presentation. Thanks for the great service Nikko!! You deserve recognition!

lTLziOKoA_W0wXpGv63Dyw.text: Excellent service! Jessi took my order she was very helpful & nice...  Cold beer & sushi yummm!

I9Ca0Lfdub9F4vu_IA9eBA.text: Awesome food.  Same prices as strip Sushi in Vegas, but nice portions, distinct and delicious tastes with each item.   Great quality and friendly sushi bar chefs...

JyG3h15b1V4pG8tCdu6t_w.text: Novi was my server  Great service and she offered us great deals  Thanks and will come back!! Great food  Will come back

OWS3vcWzHL9HSeXQmLstNg.text: The food is amazing. The ambience is great! I had the spicy ramen and it was delicious! I will be back!

uUuTtVlxATbYLWcT0H3Zlg.text: Visited Vegas for the weekend with a bachelor party. We stumbled upon Sekushi in the lobby of our hotel and we're thrilled with the food, service, and atmosphere. Went back again the next day for lunch!

h9_HKXhG-tq6KfCTqTrUtA.text: Great ambience! Excellent service. The hostess was very accommodating and friendly. She was familiar with the menu and made great recommendations!

TNP6vcw2yK2bIHMDwkObzw.text: The food was great. Service took a little bit, but when the food came it was definitely worth the wait. We had the uni shooter, definite must have if you are looking to start with an appetizer.

8I1wEw79Y7hWLPTELqawbQ.text: Foie gras oysters, albacore tuna crudo, salmon rolls were all delicious   Service was fast   Great for a quick snack and small plates while passing through Paris to Bally's

Qk5QvZ9Gn4QcOtfMfU2h3Q.text: Great hostess, feel good atmosphere.   This place has fast service and is not too pricey.   Love the edamame apps and miso soup.

uTxn4UlrJHhet5xqJmpcvg.text: Great presentation, nice touch with the long black hair inside the roll. Observe your customer, or in this case your customer's hair color before claiming "that's not ours, it's a woman's hair." I felt embarrassed for you when I had to comment back with "I would say it's mine, but my hair isn't black." Thank you for apologizing after you've taken a second glance at the color of my strands. I should have known better than to eat ramen in Paris.

3FjR-UrQQbxssm25WIN7yA.text: Food comes out hot and delicious. Kim Chee and sushi was so good! I got the galbi, spicy sushi, and Kim chee pork belly.   Would definitely recommend!

cGoVcc4RU0LQuNXFWX8mJw.text: Delicious ramen in the middle of Paris! Ate and drank my face off, literally! Ramen was bomb and super fast for a ramen place. Got sat right away on a Saturday night. Totally worth going to if you're in the middle of the strip and want ramen. Hostess was super nice and helpful too

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ramen

ejCLZ8jsUmDjkIxpuHG43w.text: Novi was a great server !!!  she was awesome !!!  Would be definitely back because of her!!!

JcTojOdqcksqkrm-WCkUNg.text: A bit disappointed with this place given the reviews, mainly overpriced. We were looking for a decent Japanese place, but with the price we should have gone to another.  The rainbow roll was good and fresh, which was the only highlight. I would just come here if you're in a hurry and need a bite to eat, but get ready pay a lot more than what you thought!

0QBwKZtQqallAj8ceg0JmA.text: This was such a nice treat! Excellent customer service, great food, and fresh fish! If you are looking for good sushi, this is a must try! I highly recommend Sekushi!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oU_s5lCpUMD7jUU1fXDWfg.text: Overpriced and left feeling unsatisfied.  Worst yet, feeling ripped-off.  It started off with my Pepsi tasted flat.  However, I did get that replaced.  Then the first waitress who assisted us was not friendly.  Seems like she was stepping to serve us temporarily and only wanted to do minimal work.  Wife order Chirashi Don.  It was decent, but nothing special.  I had the Pork Katsu Bento Box.  The meat portion was small, but worst yet, the meat was thin and the breaded part was over fried.  The worst part of this is the bill.  This is the first time I see a bill with recommended gratuity with the start of 20%, 25% and 30%!!  On top of that, the suggested gratuity amount is based on AFTER tax.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outrageous gratuity calculations!  Gratuity is based on AFTER tax total!

kOVk8Xr3xlksYZ0OiYiT0Q.text: Incredible Food! Fantastic service. I'm absolutely amazed about the experience my wife and I had here. The sushi rolls were to die for and the ramen is the best I've had on the west coast. I will be back here for sure.

0OaPVQQtg4P9ouXyoRO53A.text: Not bad for a late snack   Inside the Paris. Good service. Super fast. Great for the hangover.   Been here a few times. It's not the best but it gets the job done.

l87W13JlyleV9rkyFBG1oA.text: This was the best meal I had in Vegas by far. The service was the most attentive and personable I have experienced in Vegas. Our server Novi was exceptional and took amazing care of us. The food was delicious and the presentation of all courses was perfect. The atmosphere and decor was wonderful as well. If you enjoy sushi and Japanese cuisine, I would recommend you stop here for sure! We will definitely come back next time were in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chirashi don
Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly bun

K2oYme4aklCRKWR0lyiLPA.text: Nikko is the man. Sushi chef killed it. Had a wonderful omakase!  They gave us complimentary edamame and shrimp heads. The presentation was excellent. Prices were even better...  Want good sushi? Want it on the strip? Want fair prices? Come to SEKUSHI and have Chef Nikko hook it up.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nikko

gwuibHsOs5B83DhQlalCBA.text: This place was quite good! We were in and out quick too which was great as we were in a rush. The king crab was delicious and incredibly fresh. The rainbow roll was probably the freshest fish I've ever had. It was expensive but most other sushi places are the same price for not the same quality of fish. When I'm back in Vegas I would come back. Their gyoza was not very good though, tasted more like cheap frozen gyoza. Sushi was great.

rWxGbWsygaf5-y3B9EIMDw.text: Amazing food and amazing service! Got the chiefs platter and Nikko did fantastic. Highly recommended!

GoIhXgwvd5seBETcBQVivg.text: Great service. Friendly. Helpful with the menu. Atmospheric was cool. Sat at bar facing the hallway. Food was good.

DpgBQK0wShCXFkTE5Wp7Ww.text: This is one of our favorite restaurants on the strip  We come to Las Vegas almost every month. We used to walk by this place all the time and decided to stop by one time. We met a awesome sushi chef, Nikko, he took great care of us! Everything we ordered was great as well; we ordered a lot of thing btw. Now, because of Nikko's great service and quality of food we come here every time we visit Vegas now! Honestly, this is only 1 of maybe 2 restaurants we consistently go to. Thanks again Nikko!!

G8dydNrhwdLJQxADGv1Arg.text: Quality is key in sushi and sashimi and they definitely don't have it.  Go anywhere else. One of the people I ate with didn't get their sushi roll until after the rest of us were done eating. Shame, shame!!

12AYT053JljAku1Sm2RGHg.text: I was surprised by this little spot inside of the Paris Hotel. I had a skillet type dish with noodles and teriyaki chicken...it was very good. I also tried the ceviche and it was very tasty. The decor set up is really neat "cool" and busy and the place is a bit crammed but it Las Vegas it all overly crowded on weekends. Service is very good and attentive. I'll visit again.

EVlsf_PrNh4nET9z37CCKA.text: Great place to go with a huge group of people. Get kimchi pork belly! Also, the waitress Pear is amazing!

eEbKOaACAJSyDWae5XjQoA.text: Service - 4 stars Food - 3 1/3 starts  The place is located inside the Paris hotel, so obviously, price is much higher than the already expensive Japanese cruisine which ranges higher about 30 - 50%.    Umi shooter - $8 Oyster shooter - $7 Sashim - 12 pieces - $39 Aria  roll - $18 Rainbow roll - $18 Hamachi Kama - $18 Hot sake - $15 Hot tea -$4.5  Is it worth it?  Let's just say, its the experience.  The presentation of the sashim was nice.  Fish were thinly sliced with two pieces that were questionable whether they were the natural color of the fish or whether they were turning into different stages.  Not daring to try.   The aria roll was nicely rolled up in a skinny roll. The texture of the rice is mixed well, the filling is made with real fresh crab meat with maybe lightly salted, as you can taste the freshness of the crab meat.  Topping was salmon cerviche with a creamy sriracha aioli that added the heat to the roll along with the sesame coating on the outside of the roll.  That was my favorite dish. The fish and shrimp on the rainbow roll again thinly strategically placed on the roll perfectly fresh.  The shooters were interesting shots with heavy sake, soy sauce, raw quail egg, and chopped green onion.  Need to chute it down as fast as you can . Hamachi Kama is ok, it would have been better if it has more grilled mark that brings out the chard taste.  Again, it's all about the experience.

14CFMeBl2Gm11iEiQTw8kA.text: Went for a late night snack at the bar and met the sushi pioneer Nikko!! Such s delicious Japanese snack! So impressed with Nikkos insanely fast hands cutting the most delicate and fresh sashimi and delicate rolls ! We had to go back onour last night, same spot at the bar in front of Niko! He was so impressive to watch... thank you Niko for the incredible "breakfast in bed" (his specialty), wagyu beef with a seared soft quail egg on top couples with volcanic salt and caviar! We can't WAIT to go back!!

SRg9LFf9z5vUTcTxoHlGxg.text: Food was good, came into town and was looking for a good spot. Found it on yelp and the sushi was good quality and the service was ok, they could get better with the service. I'll come back again when I'm in town.

V7UfHDH5B25h12JmAEOiug.text: Went here on a whim and enjoyed the food very much. Took advantage of the free house sake check in, it was great!

08us6ufbtz8YrCZ_s0u9Ig.text: Came here for my birthday today.  I saw the 4 stars and was excited to try this place out.  Unfortunately I was jot able to enjoy my food.  The place is nice and clean, the wait staff was ok.  They do give you free edamame but it was super dry.  I don't think I have ever tasted edamame that was just, blah.  Here is what we had for lunch:  Miso soup:  so salty, like they gave me the bottom of the batch, i had to send it back  King Cali Roll: the first order we got had hair in it so we sent it back.  When they brought the new one, it was not tight at all, the insides just fell out, and it was really dry  Sekusushi sashimi: this was probably the only thing that was good.  At least the fish was fresh.  I really do not like to give bad reviews but I would've given it a 2 if it weren't for the sashimi.  The wait staff did not even apologize for the hair or salty soup.  I do not recommend this place...sorry

Zgp_vv-TDAGCLz53DMuGlQ.text: Great service! Hostess was exceptional. Food was great, especially the ramen. Great atmosphere and music. Right in the Paris hotel, can't miss it

5eU3miWUyWhFFaRxNqKZQQ.text: Very nice staff! Sushi looks great!!!hostess got us seated right away. Really fun decor -different seating options available.Excellent sushi- definitely go!!!!!!

0X9bgrJdT7-SaHvHnwyUTA.text: The authenticity of this restaurant is what caught our eye when we walked by it on our search to find the Concierge desk. After grabbing Happy Hour drinks and snacks at Alexxa's Bar, we decided to head back through the walkway to take a peek at their menu. They give you a lot of choices, between ramen, sushi rolls, bento boxes, etc., which is good, in my opinion. The vibe of the restaurant totally makes you forget that you're in the Paris Hotel in the middle of Las Vegas, which was probably my favorite part!   We ordered the spicy garlic edamame (amazing), the California roll (safe, but also a boring choice, we should have picked something else), and the Spider roll (delicious!). However, if I could choose again, I would have ordered their diced teriyaki chicken hot noodle skillet! The people sitting right next to us ordered one and it looked soooo good; it also comes out sizzling. Would definitely come back and try something different during our trip, perhaps after some drinking and walking around a lot :)

XRSFAgPU9t2P8w74wzOJDw.text: Nikko made this five stars for me. He accommodated to all my requests! The aria o roll is the best!  He made it for me with no rice! Amazing!  Ask for Nikko you won't be disappointed!

-ak_X6YU6E3fgI8hAMeu1w.text: Came two nights in a row for appetizer. We had California roll and salad. It was great!!

jzbDg6cN2ReVrv8t9ZyKVA.text: The service was fast, the staff friendly and the food delicious. I highly recommend comming here.

VqafTDpgWsjYQFHP1DCDqA.text: Ended up having a late dinner so wanted lighter food and thought sushi. Had walked by this place earlier. Reviews were good. The only negative was the seating. High seats so close to the others and uncomfortable chairs. But the service was great and the food was even better. My tuna sushi was some of the best I have ever had. The pork belly Bao, served like a taco was so yummy. My husband got the rib eye with rice and loved it. We will go back again when in town.

Food was so good. High quality ramen was exactly what I was craving. My husband loved his meal so much he also didn't share.

f3y282TdYxeyHjCNygB37g.text: We shared the shishito peppers appetizer and a few rolls: salmon skin, tuna tartare, and the rainbow roll (this one was supposed to be something different... but it was good anyway :) ). The food was great, and the service attentive and fairly quick. I'd say a 4.5 stars, but we had an enjoyable evening, and a complimentary sake, which are worth another half star!

9vXkIQfQjPgLXWyo_sEmjA.text: One of the best ways to test freshness is by tasting Uni (Sea Urchin) and to lesser degree salmon.  Fresh Uni is absolutely delicious.  Very creamy, plump, slightly sweet with a mild pleasant taste - melts in your mouth.  The Uni I ordered here when I was there few weeks ago had all the signs of less than fresh Uni: Shriveled, strong taste and color was dark.  Salmon: same thing.  Not wild and didn't taste fresh.

g5aVUwfsDHwDWIUPlPtBWg.text: This is my third time dining at Sekushi and have gotten the same dish each time, tofu bibimbap. Unfortunately this visit wasn't up to par. The only good thing about this visit was we were seated immediately. After we placed our orders, it took quite a while for our food to arrive even though the restaurant had a few other diners.  The temperature in the restaurant was really warm and very uncomfortable to say the least. A couple next to us even asked to sit "outside" of the sushi bar area.  After taking a few bites of my meal, we decided to leave because the heat was becoming unbearable. We had to flag down another server because no one ever came to check on us the entire time. The new server brought us boxes and the check. I was a bit irritated because she stood right at our table and watched me box my leftovers and quickly took the plate out of my hands.  I really like the food here but the entire experience I had that Friday night was horrible.

EUP-PrXkpkOYCQpyw7hj3A.text: I've never bothered to leave a review anywhere before, but our experience at Sekushi with Chef Nikko the other night was AMAZING! As a traveling consultant, I've tried a hundred or so sushi based restaurants and have never had a more beautiful display (omakase nonetheless) of unique and fresh tasting fish, foie gras, wagyu beef, uni and japanese peaches. Kudos to a great staff and talented chef!!

GOTOwzJP-u3qRGUB-ONfyg.text: With 2 visits in 3 days, it became my midnight food spot in Vegas!  1) Foie Gras Nigiri (3.5/5): Their foie gras is very nice, but I suggest to have the Sekushi Signature Roll instead of this, it is a way better deal!  2) Uni Shooter (3.5/5): Such a nice taste surprise for an alcoholic shot. That little egg yolk in the middle will blow your mind!  3) Sekushi (4/5): The Sekushi Signature Roll is just fantastic! It has Foie Gras, Tuna, and perfectly cooked Japanese rice, that is everything you need for just 21$!  4) Creamy Seafood Udon "The Hangover Cure" (2/5): Even if you are drunk, just pass this.  Overall Rating (3.5/5): With all that foie gras at such a nice price, between 3 and 4 stars I have to go with 4!

I didn't like that they charged meat extra to cut my sushi into pieces so that I could eat it respect fully in front of others instead of grabbing it like an animal. We won't be going back.

7V0ucWZSwdPyoYADDjBkyg.text: Best sushi in Vegas!! Everything was fresh and definitely met our expectations, but more than anything THE SERVICE WAS AMAZING!! You can't pass up good service in Vegas, Novi was my favorite server of all time!

CCooxAsm40r5JrN9ZsgNXQ.text: I'm experiencing a great ambiance as I sit here and wait for my food. Menu is forward and straight to the point, prices are very reasonable for being on the strip, and the hostess, Jada, was so informative and so kind. I didn't dine in-house but requested my food to go. My order was verified, I was given an itemized receipt and received everything I needed. Thanks, Sekushi!

AZsvgCQLw7EdZN5l6iqeXQ.text: Creamy udon seafood bowl was very large and tasty. Fire roll was delicious. Great staff who checked on the table multiple times. My only problem was the music was a little too loud for good conversation.

aVB7W6apTyehuGjDNBem1w.text: Incredible sushi!!! Great service and really awesome selection of sushi. Everyone was so friendly and Melissa was a fantastic waitress! Made our trip worth it!!!!

NN1QCMGNpZi5rRjQLfgA6g.text: Recently came for dinner, then a lunch on a recent visit to Vegas. Wanted Sushi and saw a new restaurant in Paris (was staying at Ballys).   Dinner- sat at bar on a Thursday evening. Service was good from Yui. Sashimi very fresh and AriaO roll was amazing. Edamame was complimentary and standard. Pass on miso soup - very salty. Chocolate mousse cake - pass also. Overall 5 stars.   Lunch- sat at a table on Sunday afternoon. Service was non-existent that even the hostess came by to see if a server had come by. Unfortunately, never got the young lady's name who was my server.  It wasn't even busy, but she didn't seem to know what she was doing. Sashimi still excellent, but AriaO roll left much to be desired. How was it amazing one night and not a few days later? Portions were much smaller despite its one size for ~$20!!! Should of went with my gut and get a bento box for lunch. Service - 1 star. Food - 3 stars.   Debatable if I will come again, and I frequent Vegas often.

_3MGa9WED1JoEihN2tNbqw.text: This sushi restaurant located inside the Paris Hotel was excellent!  The Miso Seabass was delicious and the Aria roll was the best.  Our server, Jane was very attentive and personable.  I definitely recommend this restaurant.

KTaXr270GBHJnWJ8TSdygA.text: Great environment with amazing food. Would definitely come back the staff was nothing short of awesome glad I came across this hidden Gem inside the Paris Hotel

BUYUZaao-fxKAs4F3TxBuw.text: Food was delicious and beautifully presented! Definitely recommend the mussels! They pack so much flavor in every bite. The wait staff & hostess were very sweet and accommodating however, sitting at the sushi bar the chefs didn't make any effort to welcome or communicate with us.

Whmm2pScLpLFR92SgxSbgA.text: Must order Ariao roll, very good and well balanced. Service was good and food tasty. Only complaint was food took awhile to come out, other than that it was a nice meal. I would come back again. Price was fair for sushi in Las Vegas.

UfR1t_ceqRoQ6rrBptjpgg.text: Great selection of sushi. Perfect selection of beers and whiskey!

kdIXc5rvC1freV1BaK6hzQ.text: The sushi was okay, but they didn't offer low salt soy sauce so the saltiness was over the top.  The rolls were "meh." Not even a little sea weed salad or anything to start, which is a little stingy.   It's okay - the bento lunches looked better than the sushi.

J6zRD_kHnxiXSWmT4qpgBg.text: Great sushi spot for a nice quick meal in Paris. Try the aria O for a unique and tasty roll.

hVQXXrwpeYdRDYtPGC2QXA.text: For the past 2 times we visited Vegas, I've wanted to try Sekushi at Paris because the reviews were always pretty stellar. We arrived to Vegas a little earlier than check in, so we decided to finally try this place out.  We were planning on buffet for dinner, so we ordered 2 rolls here to try: Spicy Tuna cut roll ($9) and Sakura Roll ($24). First impressions, rolls were very small, more like 1/2 size bites or maki rolls. The Spicy Tuna cut roll was not what I expected: chopped up tuna with spicy mayo ON TOP of each piece. The Sakura Roll was very salty, without any soy sauce, which masked the flavors of tuna and whatever else was inside.  The table seating is very underwhelming, doesn't feel like you're in Vegas at all. Try sitting at the sushi bar instead for hopefully better ambiance.  Unfortunately, we will not be coming back for the sushi. I can imagine the bill to grow quite fast if you want to leave feeling full. Almost $50 for a snack and drink before dinner is quite scary even by Vegas standards  I would love to see more noodle options as it's hard to find on the strip, particularly other udon or soba dishes. Hopefully we can give this restaurant another chance somewhere down the road.

O3-cgG6jj9EPju_rTCy0zg.text: Great food!! Get the Aria-o roll!!!! The sauce on it is to die for. Such a cute place inside Paris. We came on Chinese New Year and there were celebrations and it was so fun. The display of the sushi is beautiful and there's a nice bar too! Great location. Great food. Great service. MELISSA was the best. Very attentive. Would definitely come back!

3pXZB8v26y-l9zM8sCTEEg.text: Came to Vegas for the wknd with my gf. We found this place walking through the casino at the Paris Hotel. Decided to try this place out because the decor caught my gf's eye. Food was delicious. The Aria O sushi roll and green tea shots are a must!

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aria O &amp; Green tea shots!

ldaBE3oMANva36uj-6EU6g.text: I'm perplexed by the good reviews. The salad dressing is pure soy sauce and leaves an inch or so reservoir at the bottom. The rice tastes as though it was made a few days previously, cooled and microwaved. The seaweed was so rubbery, because it was old, that it was almost impossible to chew. Speaking of impossible to chew, the actual fish was cut very thick and again, was NOT fresh. Do not eat here. I rarely leave reviews for this but I am afraid someone will get ill. This was really, really terrible.

Price wise, this was reasonable for what you received.   Note: if you do the Yelp check in for dessert, you must show them on your phone that you are giving them five stars before you can receive this...

Wzg9pdxk4lM3t27JX9neXg.text: I'm a huge sushi lover and this is one of my favorite sushi restaurants in town, the sushi is always fresh!! Must try the aria o roll!

89-wv-sqXzGwewKsG4FdLA.text: I recently came here with my girlfriend since we stayed at the Paris Hotel and we wanted to eat some sushi and we noticed this was one of the restaurants inside the hotel. When we arrive we were seated immediately since there weren't many people. The sushi was delicious, some of the best I've tasted honestly. The reason I'm giving 2 stars is because it is WAY overpriced. I've had All-You-Can-Eat sushi for two people for less than what I paid for 2 sushi rolls. I understand the prices in Vegas can be steep but the prices here are ridiculous.

jQgMTGV0704YeHLAxAL3Iw.text: We were kinda hungry. Wanted to grab a bite before show. This okace was awesome. Great sushi,rolls, beer, and sake. Staff was extremely friendly and prompt.

Yn7flI_qCUs_fEJPlwL5zQ.text: The shishito peppers were amazing and our server Novi was fantastic! Please stop by this place and check them out.

bp0iUOS7Okk_jHBSXTYUNQ.text: Food was awesome,service was awesome but their host Jessica was the cherry on top. So sweet and so accommodating and easy!

XZVbo5YTNs7DdHdSRx4Z3g.text: I enjoyed the food here. It was delicious and the atmosphere was fun. We sat at the sushi bar. The chairs were a bit uncomfortable but the place was decorated nice. The place is a bit small for a sushi restaurant. We ordered several appetizers and tried the lychee sake. It was a big bottle. They give you free edamame to snack on. I enjoyed the wagyu beef skewer a lot. Beef was cooked to perfection. Mussels were good as well but a little spice to it. We also had the oyster shooter shots. My first time trying it and it was good but strong. We ordered the chicken teriyaki dinner and the sushi combo. Sushi was fresh and good. Size of the fish was cut big so it will definitely fill you up. We had so much food we had no room for dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My favorite beef skewers
Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our sake with edamame and oyster shooters
Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken dinner

OKGBH55I1c1_cSFH-XwizQ.text: This place was delicious and worth the price which is a bit high but it's in Vegas hotel so that is expected. I had the soup called hangover cure (even though I wasnt hung over) and it was super delicious even my boyfriend loved it and he had the bento box which was delicious too. We also tried the green tea shot and that was good as well. Overall all delicious food for your money.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Viw7FvueMwOFEUUKGD26zg.text: Hey im here at sekushi. Has one of the best foods inside the Paris hotel. They have these amazing pork belly skewers that are my favorite. I order them every time. Their sushi is great too and you can't go wrong with their noodle. They have good music and the atmosphere is pleasant. Do recommend for anyone to come enjoy

2pSA00RWHGWdvJAKyA1zhQ.text: This place is good but a fair warning pricy if you order sushi. The sushi is very delicious and fresh, the chefs put there own twist on things with the special sauces they add. For appetizers we ordered the wagu beef skewer a long with scallop skewer and the panko mixed appetizer (I forgot the real name). For the main event we ordered the surf and turf roll which is panko shrimp topped with seared wagu beef (I added mango), the lobster roll, spicy scallop roll and a spicy tuna roll. Nice place and really delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PdDsDEVIDX4CjeWQhM98Yg.text: The service here was really bad. It took our table about 10 minutes to get  water, after being served the edamame, which they provide for free. They also never refilled throughout the meal.   This is probably the worst sushi I've ever eaten. I love sushi and I feel it's fairly easy to tell if the fish is fresh. This fish was not fresh, nothing was raw and the rolls had so many "extras" on them, you could barely see or taste anything. They loooove spicy mayo here too. Do not order the Hot Spring if you don't like mayo. The presentation was horrifying and I sent it back because it was beyond hideous and disgusting.

swXCEgEeWBWj1DvSB9IFhQ.text: What a great place... fish was wonderful, rice wasn't great but not terrible. Great selection and open fairly late. Wifey and I had uni shooters(which were outstanding). Don't miss out on this place, just outside of Paris casino.   Will b here every trip to vegas!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Uni, foie  gras, salmon, yellowtail, aria o, and uni shooters!!!

4t7DM_l7tw1INdjhM4oFHQ.text: Was looking for a quick meal after a long flight and Sekushi fit the bill.  Service was friendly and quick.  Ordered the Bimibab and it was quick to arrive.  Food was great. Would recommend anyone who is staying at the Paris to stop by. You can eat in or get food to go.

sILBg66n_CFjimZZs7JVlQ.text: Best Japanese food ever!!' The miso soup was just delicious and jada was the best hottest I've ever encounter. Highly recommend  if you come to Vegas and you gotta ask for jada. Great experience and great food

lXkYntIxaOYDtvIfM-aRHg.text: I was really disappointed in the food here. I thought that by the reviews it would be good but the sushi rolls were just ok and nothing fancy. They were also very expensive and the fish wasn't fresh. I would not recommend this restaurant!

i6owb5QVi6_TmSuZXVUdLA.text: We are so happy we came here for dinner! We ordered the Uni Shooters, Kumamoto Oysters and Bluefin Sashimi! OH MY GAWD!!!! Everything was so fresh and so flavorful.   Aside from the amazing food, the service was also superb. Everyone was so nice and attentive.   Must try for sure!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bluefin tuna
Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kumamoto Oysters

KNFORPFgoqp5DdmC3K6yfg.text: Amazing fresh sushi!  The waitress was friendly!  Bulgogi Beef was wonderful!   My sashimi was so great!  Quick service!  Only came for the weekend, but I will be back later tonight!

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-wwSxdREQ4KP3ZnP07Y1KA.text: Looking for great sushi in Vegas then this is where it's at!! This is one if the best sushi bars that I have eaten at. I ordered some sushi and miss soup and it was on POINT! My waitress "Yui" was attentive and very nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BA_gsi5rezM1cb6CuYG1CA.text: Very good service! And food! The miso soup was the best. Yui, our server were friendly and cute. They gave us 4 free desserts for a party of 6!

F9gpIyAEhK3GivBcLGRkOw.text: Enjoy our family dinner here the food was great. Enjoy it very much. If you have time come enjoy fresh sushi from Sekushi at Paris Las Vegas.

_JXfCP2tBlS6uOGss5J-kA.text: Service was not good. We requested for so many things from the busy waiters, including soy sauce, chopsticks, water, and napkins... Waited for a long time for the foods as well. The foods are okay but pricy considering the quality and portion.

TL2R4doiQmUoIkGjQgC1JQ.text: OMG! The most creative and flavorful sushi roll that I have ever had.  I ordered a lobster roll that had avocado and jalapenos, but what really set it apart was it was topped with coriander threads and wrapped in pink soy papper. It was so pretty and delicious- I cant stop thinking about it. The restaurant is located inside the Paris casino.  Large double sided bar, otherwise a small place. Decorated nicely and the service was fast and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Sekushi Japanese Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sdfadEgk6HTUKP72Kmq-tA.text: This is solid sushi at non-Las Vegas prices in the heart of the strip inside Paris. Rolls are not huge but reasonable portions at those prices. Good apps/small plates as well.

io43slmvsfxirWK9sVquAw.text: The food was great!  The sushi was fresh and very tasty. It was so good we came back for a late snack. The service was wonderful and prompt.

W9k4VHsfUR1U91E9_RC0ig.text: Come check this place out really good food and a great vibe! Try the king crab  roll!

prVjL9aNepZG9Ccoq9Du_g.text: This is the best little sushi spot in Vegas.. We found it as we walked between Ballys and Paris.. I'm so happy we decided to try it out.. our server Bia was incredible and we will definitely be back again !!!!

dfw-l2Y4xkP-CPmMoD5UZQ.text: Incomparably the best sushi imaginable. I would recommend this place to everyone! I had the Aria-O and it had the perfect amount of spice and heat.  We also had the cheese cake with dried wasabi, definitely well worth it!  Located on the first floor of the Paris!

H2A3XPF_6wD83rjeoAdU8Q.text: Sekushi is an amazing place for sushi and all kinds rolls. The sea food combo Don is the last thing you want to miss. Creamy udon is also a strongly recommended dish.

ee_-ocy3e9lbkG7tnI6pRA.text: I stumbled upon this place by accident! Late evening dinner, tired of burgers and fried food. Me and my mom ordered the unagi don and the salmon avocado roll. I have to say that the unagi don was the freshest and best I've had, ever. The portions was just right for me and my mom to share. The roll and the unagi don was enough for me and my mom to share! I definitely recommend this place and will be back!

1chCQrKQVAvZXl7i5fVy4g.text: Service was exceptional! Novi- our server-  was so knowledgeable- gave us fantastic recommendations. The Sekushi roll was so good, we had to order a 2nd one!! The service was spot on- fast, courteous!  They welcomed us with a bowl of edamame. Every dish we ordered was a win!

hQR539dsT2Rp3b1sZp4joQ.text: Good Japanese place to eat inside the Paris casino. Had some rolls and miso ramen. Waitress was very nice and helpful. Would come back again!!

_dtmN4Lyf5kfgIT-2uLl4w.text: Presentation was good but sauce for dumplings VERY vinegary . Crab leg sushi tasted old. Overpriced. Did not at all leave a wow favtor

28L1wn--U7N7DahTRdUW9g.text: Very yummy sushi and sake. A bit overpriced and service could have been quicker. Overall, very good lunch! I enjoyed the edamame appetizer as well.

C8TNj8UndxSpCfLeqjYQ2A.text: Fresh, tasty and reasonable prices. Unfortunately I was forced last minute at the restaurant to write this review in order to get my free cheesecake or mousse as a Yelp check in bonus.  Not part of the original deal, and not transparent. Also, despite me telling the server we had this promo she failed to mention they only had cheesecake, not the mousse.

CoyDLgtT-AMEQ0tB-Yjq3g.text: Decent Japanese food inside Paris, we especially like the eel. Don't forget to check in to get a free matcha cheesecake.

cwvlqJ8QxbbOI5-t1eeGcg.text: Absolutely delicious. Buttery, sweet fresh sushi, good service and not badly priced.  Great lunch.

vM-fTnDdWD0AQauJ7CFS0A.text: The 3.5 star review is mostly dedicated to the sweet sushi chef we had. He was so nice and patient with us. Different from most Japanese restaurants where the sushi chefs at the bar would be fast paced with none to minimal conversation. The food was just alright, we got the salmon avocado roll and salmon skin roll, with the salmon skin roll tasting very burnt and charred.
